Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.

Job Description
General Accountability:
This position is accountable for the development and implementation of advanced analytic models to improve business process, and to generate insight in order to support the strategy & goals of Group Functions. This position will provide analytics thought leadership, coaching to the Data Scientists & Analysts and support the development of the capabilities of the team. Additional responsibilities include the development of documentation & measurement framework.

Responsibilities:
Develop & implement models to support Group Functions strategy and business pillar initiatives
Develop advanced analytics models in order to maximize ROI, revenue and overall profitability.
Perform needs analysis with business area (understand business problem & generate hypotheses)
Explore, generate & source data relevant to the hypothesis(internal, external, 3rd party)
Create, assess, evaluate & Iteratively improve models
Calculate model impact/ROI
Peer review other Data scientists work
Leverage sound judgment, balancing analysis effort vs incremental improvement
Measure & communicate analytic results & impact of analytics models
Implement measurement & documentation framework against all project work
Generate insights in such a way that the businesses can clearly understand the quantifiable value. Enable the business to make clear trade-offs between and among choices, with a reasonable view into the most likely outcomes of each.
Turn statistical and computational analysis into user-friendly graphs, charts, and animation. Enable those who aren’t professional data analysts to effectively interpret data. Ability to communicate results and educate others through reports and presentations
Provide thought leadership around analytics methodology, tools, and measurement
Leverage extensive theoretical and practical knowledge of advanced analytic methods and algorithms, understanding their utility in different problem domains (sparse data, rare event detection, etc), evaluation methodologies and pitfalls, and stays on top of industry & academic developments.
Innovate & find creative ways to source & leverage data to support modeling efforts, leveraging structured & unstructured data, and big data technologies.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to develop tools and services such as modeling, dashboard development, decision aids and business case analysis to drive innovation, strategic initiatives and recommend solutions.
Coach & provide guidance to Data Scientists & Data Analysts
Leverage depth of experience in business, technical & analytical problem solving to support & coach other team members.
Qualifications:
Post grad in Statistics, Math, Comp Sci, Engineering or other related discipline (PhD preferred)
Minimum of 10 years' experience specifically in statistical/data analysis and data mining, predictive modeling, cluster analysis, optimization
Advanced Experience in Python, R, SAS, SQL, Java, , VBA
Track of record of delivering innovative analytical insights to lines of businesses
Strong commitment to organizational success and team work
Adaptable and open to change with strong collaboration and elaboration skills
Demonstrated data transformation & manipulation experience
Strong Knowledge of strategic marketing, data, audience targeting, segmentation, and customer analysis. Familiarity of vendors that operate in this space
Insurance or Financial Services industry experience preferred.
Demonstrated experience exhibiting innovation and leadership in proposing new strategies and/or tactics based on analysis findings
Experience with Big Data platforms desired
Experience with analysis of unstructured data desired



If you are ready to unleash your potential it’s time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.
About Manulife

Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people achieve their dreams and aspirations by putting customers' needs first and providing the right advice and solutions. We operate as John Hancock in the United States and Manulife elsewhere. We provide financial advice, insurance, as well as wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2016, we had approximately 35,000 employees, 70,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving more than 22 million customers. At the end of 2016, we had $977 billion (US$728 billion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made almost $26 billion in payments to our customers.


Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

Manulife is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request an accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Company Profile
Miovision's mission is to provide the foundation for tomorrows smart cities by transforming the way traffic networks are managed today. Backed by the worlds most advanced traffic AI, Miovision innovations in traffic signal planning and operations have made it possible for cities to improve the transportation experience for drivers, cyclists and pedestrians since 2005. With offices in Kitchener, Canada and Cologne, Germany, Miovision serves over 17,000 municipalities worldwide. For more information, visit
www.miovision.com [http://www.miovision.com/].

Position Summary
Do you know someone who hates the commute to work? Do you want to be part of the solution? Miovision is looking for an exceptional machine learning engineer who is passionate about developing machine learning models and solving cutting-edge problems. The team you would be joining is responsible for training, validating and delivering machine learning models to be used in other parts of the business, ranging from execution environments in the cloud to low power devices installed at the roadside.

Our team makes use of powerful libraries such as tensorflow, opencv, scikit-learn and pyspark to develop algorithms, test and refine our ideas and productize our solutions. We frequently deploy our models and algorithms into internal systems and customer-facing products, so they have immediate impact in various lines of business. In this role, you will have the freedom and responsibility to collaborate on, design, and develop algorithms to solve real problems in computer vision and statistical modelling. Our team values strong problem solving skills, initiative in ensuring that we're building robust solutions, and solid experience with machine learning workflows. This includes the ability to manage large datasets, build efficient workflows and present compelling data analysis.

On this team we work within the agile process. You will directly see the impact of your deliverables pushed to production frequently, being utilized by your colleagues on the team and making their way to customer facing products. You will also have frequent opportunities to demo your work with a wider audience excited to find out about the latest developments coming from our team. Come help us solve traffic problems together, and have fun while doing so!

Things we'd like you to do:

Train, validate and deploy cutting edge machine learning models
Design, conduct and interpret experiments.
Communicate substantiated recommendations based on experimental results.
Participate in dataset definition and gathering activities.
Discuss and implement architecture considerations with the team.
Ensure high quality of work using both manual and automated testing.
Participate in the code review process.
Participate to technical road map discussions and estimation exercises.
Contribute to publishing research papers.
Read research papers to stay on top of latest developments.

A few things we'd like you to have:

Expertise with at least one of: python, c++
Expertise with at least one of: tensorflow, opencv, scikit-learn, pytorch, gluoncv
Strong software development skills
Comfort working on unix systems
Experience with machine learning, preferably in computer vision
Ability to take ownership of delivering complete solutions
Curiosity to dive into technical details of how things work
Creating data visualizations and analyzing data

It'd be great if you also have experience with:

Familiarity with bash scripting
AWS architecture and services
Git version control
Docker
Conda packaging

About Plantiga

Plantiga provides Human Movement Intelligence - deep insights into health based on the way we move. Our platform is built to optimize performance, reduce injury, monitor rehab and quantify load by detecting changes in functional movement patterns that the eye cannot see. Our cloud-based, machine learning algorithms analyze data acquired by our instrumented insoles and deliver actionable insights in our mobile app. Our goal: change the way we think about human health and performance by becoming the world-leader in motion analytics.

Job Title

Data Scientist

Location

Vancouver BC

Experience

5+ years

Responsibilities:
We are currently looking for a Senior Data Scientist that will help us discover the valuable information hidden in the vast amounts of data that we collect. This information will enable us to deliver world-class solutions to our customers, helping them perform better and reduce injury. You primary role will be developing start of the art algorithms with machine learning techniques, on captured biomechanical data, to build high quality prediction systems.

Required Skills:

Completed degree in computer science, electrical engineering or a comparable qualification.
3+ years of experience in machine learning.
Experience in dealing with TensorFlow, Caffe, Torch or similar frameworks.
Very good programming skills in Python, Java or R.
Experience with data visualization tools.
Experience with AWS, GCE or Azure cloud services
Strong analytical skills, very strong understanding of complex algorithms and best practices in handling large amounts of data.
Experience with analyzing sensor data including that from accelerometers and gyroscopes.

Additional Qualifications:

Full stack and mobile development experience.
Linux experience preferred.
Familiarity with at least one version control system, preferably Git.
Agile/Kanban development expertise preferred.
Experience in startups or small teams.
Ability to collaborate with other teams of the organization to ensure successful commercialization, deployment, and maintenance of developed algorithms and methods.
Flexibility and interest in being involved in all aspects of the platform.
Experience in human motion capture and/or biomechanics.
An interest in sport.

Additional Info:
This is a full-time position, located in Vancouver, BC. The position is currently open and preference will be given to those available immediately.

Benefits:

Working closely with a small, highly-driven team to help shape the future of the company
Competitive compensation rates and vacation time
Stock options in a fast-growing company
Readily available growth opportunities, 1:1 feedback
Amazing customers in professional sports that are vested in Plantiga’s long-term success
Transit and bike accessible location in historic Railtown
Mountain and ocean views in an open, naturally lit office space
Frequent company outings and a well-stocked kitchen

In the last 6 years, Prodigy has gone from 3,000 to over 50,000,000 students registered globally. We are currently the fastest growing educational startup in North America, with offices in Burlington, Toronto and India. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to help an entire generation of students to LOVE learning, while working alongside some of the brightest and most passionate people in education and gaming.

We are looking for a marketing analytics expert to join our growing marketing team. You will have the chance to apply your data science skills to help our marketing team to make better decisions.
You will be responsible for all aspects of marketing data, including data ingestion, storage, transformation, analysis, and visualization using our business intelligence and analytics infrastructure. You will be working alongside many of our teams to help run experiments, build data pipelines, create reports and visualizations which are used to help drive crucial decisions. The work you do here at Prodigy will aid the educational advancement of millions of students.

You Will:
Work closely with others as part of our marketing team to apply experiments, data science, and investigative research
Create and manage data pipelines, including developing better solutions for batch and real-time marketing analytics use cases
Work cross-functionally to explore and propose solutions to business problems using insights from data and algorithms
Apply your analytics and data science expertise to better serve our users
What You'll Need:
Demonstrated ability to do marketing analytics and data science, with at least 2 years of experience or relevant quantitative graduate degree
Experience doing A/B and multivariate testing in digital platforms (Facebook, Google Search, Pinterest, etc) and landing pages along with channel forecasting and attribution modeling
Advanced Google Analytics (Google Analytics 360 preferred) skills with experience implementing user-id views; integrating mobile app data using Firebase, Google Analytics SDKs for iOS and Android, or other third-party SDKs such as Adjust and Appsflyer; implementing custom dimensions for business-specific data; and defining user buckets for experiments
Strong understanding of and passion for digital marketing trends, models, and platforms
Programming fluency in Python, and experience with applying Python or R to marketing analytics
Experience with relational databases and SQL
Demonstrated ability to solve hard analytic and statistical problems
Ability to work simultaneously on different projects with a variety of timelines
A team and customer centric mindset
Love for our mission of helping kids everywhere enjoy learning
Bonus Points For:
Familiarity with Google Optimize, Hubspot, Influitive, and marketing automation
Experience with SEM/SEO spend analysis & advice
Experience with applied Machine Learning and AI techniques
Experience with cloud platforms like AWS, real-time data processing, and agile software development
Experience in software requirements analysis, design, implementation, and testing (especially data related)
Experience with brand lift studies and brand metrics including awareness, consideration, favourability, and intent
Significant accomplishments demonstrating both technical and strategic capabilities, such as entrepreneurial or open source projects
What We Offer:
Full health benefits (from day one!)
Gym & learning fund
Flexible hours
Stock options
Snacks & coffee
Games & ping pong
We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). Prodigy Game will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

About the role

At Shopify, we recognize that after our people, our most important asset is our data. With over 10+ years of aggregate ecommerce data, we are driven by the potential insights that our data can provide. Our 600,000+ merchants process over $72 billion in gross merchant volume through our platform, and depend on us to deliver insights that enable them to grow their business.
We are looking for a Lead Data Scientist to own the data strategy and integration around an important product line at Shopify. Working closely with the product team, you and your team will help to drive optimization in this area through the development of machine learning models that are scaled across our 600,000+ merchants. Your team will also provide valuable insights to the product team in order to help them build and improve new features.
You’ll Need To Have:
Technical leadership and/or management experience (you'll enjoy doing both). You can jump into the code to the level that your subordinates admire and respect, but are also interested in developing people and capacity for your team.
Strong background in machine learning including experience implementing models at scale
Extensive experience using Python (including scikit-learn) or similar languages
Extensive experience analyzing data using SQL
It'd be great if you have:
Previous experience using Spark
Experience with statistical methods like regression, GLMs or experiment design and analysis
Exposure to Tableau, QlikView, Mode, Matplotlib, or similar data visualization tools
If you’re interested in helping Shopify shape the future of commerce, click the “Apply now” button to submit your application. Please address your cover letter to Solmaz.
Experience comes in many forms, many skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. If your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, consider applying. We know that diversity of thought makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply.

job_description:

Field Application Scientist
Summary:
Provide applications support (consultation, troubleshooting, customer training) to MGI's customers in assigned territory and collaborate across sales/marketing teams to develop, implement and manage business strategy.
Responsibilities:
Coordinate and conduct customer training for MGI products and applications.
Troubleshoot issues related to experimental design, data processing, software operation, sample preparation and chemical reaction. Perform preliminary on-site failure analysis to identify root cause and feedback to corresponding company department or personnel.
Develop and maintain positive relationships with customers
Support sales efforts through technical presentations, customer management or organizing seminar.
Maintain an up-to-date understanding of current Commercial initiatives and strategies; maintain close collaboration with Commercial team to act on current initiatives and opportunities. Maintain proficiency in all product lines, instruments as well as applications from competitors and keep up with latest advancements in the field of NGS.
Direct interaction with MGI product end-users and channel partners. Direct interaction with Product Support group, consisting of Product Management, Market Development Specialists, and Field Service Engineers. Maintain close relationship with globally-based FAS colleagues, with the intent to promote collaboration, sharing of best-practices, learning, and overall communication
Ownership of content/program creation and facilitation of field-based product line demonstrations and trainings, troubleshoot when needed.
Creation of reports at the completion of field travel to document visit outcome. Act as voice of the customer and provide product feedback to departments such as Product Support, R&D, and Marketing
Own and create content/program for technical workshops/training as directed by leadership. Represent the MGI business through participation at various global NGS related tradeshows/conferences as requested by Marketing team.
Serve as Product Support core team member for all products. Provide feedback and direct involvement in the creation and maintenance of product documentation such as, product inserts and instructions-for-use, from the perspective of ensuring a positive customer experience
Act as a key contributor of customer feedback to marketing and product development teams
Proactively share experience, knowledge and skills to peers and help to build an organization with strong professionalism. Coach and mentor new hires as needed.
Education/Experience:
Master’s degree or above in Genetics, Molecular Biology or Bioinformatics or related subject. With NGS academic training or background or work experience preferred. Undergraduate with outstanding knowledge and skills is welcomed as well.
Willingness to travel mainly within the appointed region. For training or occasional special calls, international traveling including China is required.
Prior field experience supporting customers in a highly technical field preferred.
Outstanding problem solving and interpersonal skills
Demonstrated English written and verbal communication and training/presentation skills
Excellent learning ability. Experience working in an international company and biomedical instrumentation or technology preferred.
Must be and willing to travel, >50% time
Company:
MGI Tech Co., Ltd. is one of the subsidiaries in BGI groups, which is committed to enable effective and affordable healthcare solutions for all people, focus on the innovation, development, production and distribution of the devices, instruments, consumables and reagents for life science research and medical healthcare, and provide said services for its products. Only by providing the real-time, life-long panoramic view of digitalized solutions, our mission to develop and promote advanced life science for future generation healthcare could be realized. Building upon the sequencing technology from Complete Genomics Inc. we have developed a series of NGS sequencing platforms and consumables, we are refining the tools needed to support our mission and re-innovating the solutions for life science and healthcare.

Qui Etes-Vous

Nous recherchons des professionnels entreprenants motivés par la croissance et l'apprentissage, qui évoluent dans un environnement de travail dynamique et souvent dynamique. Chez NestReady, nous apprécions la passion, la curiosité et la motivation plus que l'expérience. Nous sommes une équipe diversifiée qui valorise la transparence, le dévouement, l'excellence et le plaisir dans tout ce que nous faisons. Pour la bonne personne, notre environnement est exigeant, mais finalement très enrichissant. Si vous êtes prêt à relever le défi, nous aimerions avoir de vos nouvelles

Vos Tâches

Vous rapporterez directement au Directeur de la Technologie, vous contribuerez à la vision dans l'impact des données sur nos produits. Vous surveillerez la qualité de l'architecture, du code base et de l'infrastructure du produit, en fournissant des conceptions conformes aux spécifications convenues dans les délais et les contraintes budgétaires.

Vous prospérez dans un environnement startup, avec un fort désir d'aider à l'avenir et une équipe d'ingénieurs de premier plan. Vous êtes ambitieux, axé sur les résultats et axé sur le client, qui gérera les discussions techniques avec les prospects, comprendra et évaluera leurs besoins, préparera et présentera les offres NestReady et formulera des recommandations pour des solutions optimales.

En Dehors Du Canada?

Nous sommes ouverts à aider avec le parrainage de visa pour Montréal, Québec.

Ce Que Nous Recherchons

BSc/BA en informatique , Statistiques, math é matiques appliquées, Ingénierie ou domaine pertinent ; Diplôme d'études supérieures en science des données ou autre domaine quantitatif est préférable

Expérience en tant que chercheur de données ou analyste de données

Solides compétences en mathématiques (e.g. statistiques, algèbre )

Capacité à élaborer des récits sur le comportement des consommateurs à grande échelle en utilisant des données que vous collectez et analysez

Expérience en modélisation de données

Capacité de travailler indépendamment

Grande capacité à présenter, synthétiser et influencer le changement via d'excellentes compétences en communication et en présentation

Expérience de l'utilisation des outils de d’intelligence d’affaires (e.g. Tableau) et cadres de données (e.g. Hadoop)

Connaissance de R, SQL, et Python; familiarité avec Scala, Java ou C est un atout

Compréhension de l'apprentissage automatique et de la recherche opérationnelle

Excellentes compétences en reconnaissance de formes et en modélisation prédictive

Capable de comprendre diverses structures de données et méthodes communes de transformation de données

état d'esprit autonome

Aptitude à résoudre des problèmes

Appréciation du développement agile et du code efficace

Avoir de l'expérience en création de documentation technique

Sens des affaires

Ce Que Nous Offrons

Des prestations de santé couvertes jusqu'à 80%

Une semaine supplémentaire de vacances payée entre Noël et le nouvel an

Des événements d'équipe courants et payé par l’entreprise

Une cuisine toute équipée contenant des collations gratuites en abondance

Des primes de recommendations

Des formules de travail flexibles

Un chien de bureau qui sème la bonne humeur au quotidien

Des appareils de bureau de marque Apple

Un emplacement de travail spacieux et à aire-ouverte

De multiples opportunités de croissance en carrière

Des sorties d'équipe, des “dîners-conférences”, et les meilleures partys de “start-up” en ville!

****************************************************************************

NestReady works with financial institutions like banks and credit unions to offer a new trusted and convenient way for homebuyers to find and purchase a home.

Our clients include banks like Scotiabank and National Bank, credit unions like Meridian and Alterna and market-leaders like Ruoff and Boston Private.

NestReady is ventured capital backed company, alumni of TechStars and was awarded “Best Startup in North America” by Next by Google Entrepreneur.

Who You Are

We are looking for entrepreneurial professionals motivated by growth and learning, who thrive in a fast-paced, often dynamic work environment. At NestReady, we value passion, curiosity and drive more than experience. We are a diverse team, that values transparency, dedication, excellence and fun in everything we do. For the right person, our environment is demanding, but ultimately very rewarding. If you’re up for the challenge, we would love to hear from you.

Who You'll Work With

Reporting directly to the Chief Technology Officer, you will contribute to the vision and leadership in the impact of data on our products. You will be overseeing the quality of the architecture, codebase, and infrastructure of the product, delivering designs to agreed specifications within timelines and budget constraints.

You thrive in a startup environment, with a strong desire to help in the future and a leading team of engineers. You are an entrepreneurial, results-oriented, customer-focused leader who will manage technical discussions with business prospects, understand and assess their requirements, prepare and present NestReady offerings, and provide recommendations for optimal solutions.

Outside of Canada?

We are open to assisting with visa sponsorship for Montreal, Quebec.

What You’ll Do

Creation of business intelligence and insights as a product using statistical learning data models that you originate

Undertake to preprocess of structured and unstructured data

Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns

Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms

Present information using data visualization techniques

Collaborate with sales, marketing, and product management teams

What You Have

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math, Engineering or relevant field; Graduate degree in Data Science or other quantitative field is preferred

Proven experience as a Data Scientist or Data Analyst

Strong math skills (e.g. statistics, algebra)

Ability to build narratives around consumer behavior at scale using data that you collect and analyze

Data modeling experience

Ability to work independently

Strong ability to present, synthesize and influence change via excellent communication and presentation skills

Experience using business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) and data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop)

Knowledge of R, SQL, and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C is an asset

Understanding of machine-learning and operations research

Excellent pattern recognition and predictive modeling skills

Able to understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation

Background in data mining and statistical analysis

Self-driven mindset

High problem-solving aptitude

What We Offer

Health and dental benefits plan

Extra paid week off between Christmas and New Years

Company sponsored team events

Fully stocked kitchen

Referral Bonus

Flexible work arrangements

Dog-friendly office

Apple equipment

An open office environment with standing desks

Career growth opportunities

The best startup parties in town

Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Montreal, QC, Canada; Toronto, ON, Canada

Minimum qualifications:
PhD in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.

Experience in Natural Language Understanding, Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Algorithmic Foundations of Optimization, Data Mining or Machine Intelligence (Artificial Intelligence).

Programming experience in one or more of the following: C, C++, Python.

Experience contributing to research communities and/or efforts, including publishing papers in machine learning venues (e.g: JMLR, ICLR, NIPS, ICML, ACL and CVPR).

Preferred qualifications:
Relevant work experience, including full time industry experience or as a researcher in a lab.

Developed publication record.

Ability to design and execute on research agenda.
About the job
We do research differently here at Google. Our team of Research Scientists aren't cloistered in a secret lab but are embedded throughout the engineering organization, allowing them to setup large-scale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly. Ideas may come from internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, Research Scientists work on real-world problems including artificial intelligence, data mining, natural language processing, hardware and software performance analysis, improving compilers for mobile platforms, as well as core search and much more. But you stay connected to your research roots as an active contributor to the wider research community by partnering with universities and publishing papers.

Research Scientists at Google work closely with Software Engineers to discover, invent, and build at the largest scale. Ideas may come from internal projects as well as from collaborations with researchers at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new learning algorithms, Research Scientists work on challenges in machine perception, data mining, machine learning, and natural language understanding. As a Google Research Scientist, you will continue to be an active contributor to the wider research community by collaborating with academic researchers and by publishing papers.

The Google AI team’s research focuses on methods that can learn multiple layers of rich, non-linear feature extractors and can scale to large amounts of data. Much of our work is best understood as part of the deep learning subfield of machine learning, but we are interested in any methods capable of efficient and effective feature learning that get good results on challenging problems. We have resources and access to projects impossible to find elsewhere. Our broad and fundamental research goals allow us to collaborate closely with and–contribute uniquely to–many different product teams across the company.
There is always more information out there, and the Research and Machine Intelligence team has a never-ending quest to find it and make it accessible. We're constantly refining our signature search engine to provide better results, and developing offerings like Google Instant, Google Voice Search and Google Image Search to make it faster and more engaging. We're providing users around the world with great search results every day, but at Google, great just isn't good enough. We're just getting started. Responsibilities

Participate in cutting edge research in machine intelligence and machine learning applications.

Develop solutions for real world, large scale problems.
At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by emailing candidateaccommodations@google.com .

Looking for a great place to work? A place where an award-winning culture means empowerment, teamwork and a passion for what you do? Then think WestJet. It's a great place to land.

WestJet is an organization recognized by its delivery of a remarkable guest experience resulting in us achieving over $3B in sales. In order for our best-in-class airline to be this successful, we require the skills and talents of professionals like you to ensure our ongoing growth. In an industry that is dominated by legacy competitors, you have the opportunity to build your career with an organization driven by progressive strategies, leadership and practices. If you are looking to break out of the status quo by joining a company with a strong growth plan, which consistently ranks as one of the most profitable airlines in the world, and which has a vision to be a top five international airline, WestJet is the place for you!



As WestJet becomes more complex and dynamic, we are seeking a proven leader in data and analytics reporting into our Digital and Innovation team. This individual can exhibit a high standard of excellence, enjoys challenges, and is results-driven. The incumbent must be highly motivated and demonstrate the ability to work in an agile environment. The successful candidate will bring an insightful vision and will actively participate in long term strategic planning ensuring data and analytics are in place to address complex business needs.

Playing a key role within our Performance & Analytics group, you’ll bring your technical expertise, business acumen, strategic and analytical thinking to deliver key actionable insights. The lead of data & analytics is responsible for the entire digital insights portfolio as it relates to data analytics, user research and performance optimization. You will build, lead and develop a talented team that can provide daily insights into business performance, marketing activities, product impacts, and the voice of the guest. This role can be positioned in Calgary AB, or Toronto ON.

Responsibilities:
Lead all reporting, analysis and measurements ensuring a high quality, accurate and consistent output of data and insights.
Monitor end-to-end performance, traffic and user behavior reporting on changes, anomalies and business impacts.
Bring data to the center of WestJet, sharing key insights and KPIs that will enable the business to make proactive and informed decisions.
Build clear and digestible executive reports and dashboards for business and commercial reviews, reporting on revenue, cost savings and guest experience.
In collaboration with IT, propose, build and implement against a technology roadmap as it relates to necessary data solutions that will support daily operations, future business needs and a 360 view of the guest.
Drive improvement and performance by providing recommendations for digital enhancements.
Oversee and reinforce data strategy, governance, standards and best practices.
Develop predictive models.
Work with business stakeholders such as Pricing & Revenue, Contact Centre, Loyalty and Marketing to share and leverage actionable insights.
Share and present weekly, monthly and quarterly reports to leadership, breaking the material into a digestible format for all audience types, providing impactful insights and recommendations.
Manage the operational budget and vendor relationships, with ongoing reporting and reviews.
Manage scheduled and ad hoc reporting needs of the organization, as well as provide support to stakeholders on the use of data analytics tools.
Build data visualization dashboards.
Oversee A/B testing strategies, competitive analysis and user research.
Lead and develop a multidisciplinary team of analysts, researchers and designers.

Professional Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or higher (Masters) in Information Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Statistics or Math, HCI or other quantitative discipline.
10+ years of diverse analytical experience helping drive business growth and developing end-to-end customer insights.
Experience with data mining and visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, Medallia and Adobe Analytics.
Experience with user testing, session replay, A/B testing tools and Cognos an asset.
Strong passion in uncovering strategic opportunities and solving business problems.
Experience in data solution implementation.
Ability to collaborate with internal stakeholders: Information Technology and Business Intelligence.
Excellent communications skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues, at all levels in the organization.
Proven ability to lead, develop and coach a diverse team of analysts, scientists and researchers.
Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
Strong organization skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work in a fast paced, demanding, and fluid environment.

We would like to thank all applicants in advance for their interest in WestJet. We believe in enriching the lives of everyone in WestJet's world and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Our ongoing efforts toward evolving total diversity will continue to be the way we do business every day. As owners, we believe in celebrating everyone’s unique skills, perspectives and experiences. WestJet is committed to inclusiveness, equity and accessibility. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

If you inspire greater creativity and innovation towards reaching new altitudes and meet the qualifications for the position in which you are interested, we welcome you to complete an online application. WestJet is a great place to land - powered by Talent and Growth.

At WestJet, the safety and security of our people and our guests is a core value and at the heart of what we do. As safety and security is a shared responsibility, it is expected that you will utilize safe work practices to ensure your well-being and the safety of others.

job_title: Senior Data Scientist, Advanced Analytics - Toronto, ON
job_description:
Requisition ID: 50384
Join the Global Community of Scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
Job Purpose:
The Data Scientist role in the Corporate Functions Analytics team is designed for individuals with a curiosity for deriving insights out of data and applying them to address business opportunities, in partnership with global teams and business lines driving innovation and advanced analytics across the Bank.
The Sr. Data Scientist will lead key projects, in an agile rapid lab environment, aimed at accelerating benefits for customers and the bank, leveraging enterprise-level data management tools and advanced analytics. She/he will work closely with Global teams, business lines, Digital Banking and technology to apply advanced analytics techniques and tools, as well as explore ideas to enhance business opportunities utilizing advanced analytics and artificial intelligence.
The Sr. Data Scientist role requires rigorous logical thinking, curiosity, flexibility and great teamwork abilities, with a strong aptitude for understanding complex business problems and translating their deep technical knowledge into practical, implementable solutions that will drive high impact business value. Individuals should be able to consider end-to-end solutions and have the ability to work on all technical elements in an Analytics project from system architecture, through modeling of advanced artificial intelligence models, to the front end user interface and design.
The candidate will be at the intersection of math/stats, computer science, communication, the business line and the customer. She/he will take a leading role in agile rapid labs and strategy development to drive innovation and digital transformation throughout the Bank and Corporate Functions.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
Opportunity to make an impact in the digital transformation of Scotiabank
Exposure to global teams and business lines where analytics techniques are being applied
Hands-on practical projects which provide an opportunity to gain new knowledge and develop skills
A compensation program with competitive salary, opportunities for annual performance incentives based on performance thresholds, a competitive benefits program and continuing education programs
Key Accountabilities:
Work in an Agile environment to deploy new credit solutions within 90-120 days
Coach a team of data scientist for analytics. This includes providing them guidance on how to work in agile environment, infuse analytics in building solutions and transforming the Bank’s digital capabilities, determine the analytics tools and technology that should be applied in each solution and coaching the team as they work with colleagues from across the organization.
Collaborate with business lines and other stakeholders and identify opportunities to drive business value by leveraging Data Science
Work collaboratively with data engineers, UX designers, digital marketing team and agile coaches to define analytics requirements for every scrum and map out an end-to-end solution
Help find solution on what and how to ingest massive volumes of structured and unstructured format data, model transform and store it in variety of data stores
Leverage distributed computing tools (e.g. Spark, Hadoop) for analysis, data mining and modeling
Collaborate with Data engineering to deploy models and algorithms in production, across business lines and geographies
Create and apply model and algorithm testing strategies to measure conduct multi-variate testing and A/B testing to measure effectiveness of models and make ongoing changes
Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models and algorithms used and developed
Present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real data-driven changes
Lead Research & Development work focused on the effective application of design thinking and scalable advanced techniques to drive ideation and innovation
Collaborate with other Advanced Analytics teams and partners to define data engineering, visualization and machine learning best-practices
Be an integral part of the Advanced Analytics community for incubating ideas and use case acceleration in rapid labs across key markets through advisory, training and scalable solutions
Support analytical use-case delivery, as well as customer/financial benefits tracking and communication
Competencies and Experience:
Hands-on experience with Big Data ecosystem tools (e.g. Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Spark, Kafka) and experience with NoSQL databases (e.g., Hbase, Cassandra, Druid)
Production experience with experimental design, statistical analysis, machine learning and predictive modeling (e.g. cross-sell, upsell, attrition, acquisition and lookalike models)
Experience cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g. unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files, audio, image)
Working experience with machine learning and other AI techniques for strategy design
Experience with UNIX tools and shell scripting
Solid SQL skills for querying relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, DB2, MySQL)
Experience using and implementing visualization tools like D3, Tableau or Qlikview
Working experience of strategy optimization leveraging operations research principles would be an asset
Strong collaboration skills with ability to translate technical knowledge into business value
Effective communication skills with ability to prepare project documentation and presentations
Education:
University degree in relevant STEM discipline (Computer Sciences, Electrical/Computer/Software Engineering and Mathematics)
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto
As Canada’s International Bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. We are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

COMPANY OVERVIEW

Nulogy is a rare company. We value autonomy, mastery, and purpose for our employees and a highly transparent and honest culture. This has helped us be recognized repeatedly as one of AON Hewitt's Best Employers in Canada at their Platinum level — an award decided by anonymous employee surveys, not marketing spin. Our motto is: It's not just business, it's personal. After 16 years working together, the company's founders from the University of Waterloo are still all at Nulogy — and great friends!

Nulogy also has a solid business model, generating real revenue from huge concrete benefits provided to customers around the world serving the supply chains of household names like L'Oreal, Sony, Procter & Gamble, and Pfizer. We are still in the early stages of bold and transformative strategies that stretch far beyond where our business is today. For our rapid growth, Nulogy has won the Deloitte Fast 50 award where we were identified as one of the 200 fastest growing companies in North America.

By joining Nulogy, you will work in intelligent, high performance teams on very challenging problems that make real global impact.

YOUR MISSION

Provide a solid direction to a young and enthusiastic data science team. Identify groundbreaking solutions using Nulogy data and bring them to life through leveraging Machine learning techniques.

JOB PURPOSE

As a Data Science Manager at Nulogy, you will lead an ambitious Data Science team that is transforming the way Brands and their Contract Manufacturers and Packagers do business. You and your team of data engineers, machine learning engineers, and data analysts will work closely with product management to create solutions to complex problems using machine learning, and you will help bring these solutions to life.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


Research, develop and build machine learning models that generate insightful recommendations for customers
Mentor and supervise data scientists and engineers
Work alongside product management and other stakeholders to translate business requirements into machine learning functionality
Work alongside data and machine learning engineers to deploy models in production
Develop optimization algorithms to improve customers operations
Help distill complex machine learning products to various audiences
Identify machine learning opportunities across the Nulogy platform and communicate findings to the appropriate stakeholders
Develop domain expertise in supply chain

EDUCATION


Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Math, Operations Research, Engineering or equivalent
MSc or PhD in related fields a big plus

EXPERIENCE


5+ years of industry experience working in the field of data science, machine learning and/or software engineering
Deep knowledge in machine learning, data mining and statistics
Extensive experience using Python (pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, etc.)
Expertise in optimization and scheduling algorithms
Experience working in an agile environment
Strong business acumen
Experience mentoring and/or supervising data scientists and engineers

NICE TO HAVE


Strong software engineering fundamentals

ABOUT YOU


You are an expert in Machine Learning
You are a creative problem solver
You are a team leader that thrives in a cross-functional and agile environment
You value autonomy, and are capable of owning data projects from start to finish
You are capable of narrating the story behind the data to a non-technical audience
You have great communication and interpersonal skills

Nulogy embraces diversity, and we recognize the need for teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We encourage everyone to apply.

job_title: Senior Data Scientist - Shipping & Risk Algorithms
job_description:
About the role

At Shopify, we empower 600,000+ entrepreneurs all over the world. For over 10 years we have been super driven when it comes to using data insights to help drive our product direction and make things better for our merchants.
We are looking for passionate and hard-working Data Scientists for both our Shipping and Risk Algorithms’ teams! Working closely with the Product team, you will help to drive optimization in this area through the development of machine learning models that are scaled across our entire merchant base.
Shipping
One incredibly important area of focus is Shipping costs. Shipping is usually one of the top marginal costs of running an online store. Working with our Shipping Services team, your work will help to optimize all areas of fulfillment which can have a huge impact on purchase conversion rates. One POWERFUL way to make commerce better for all of our merchants!
Risk Algorithms
Understanding a merchant’s future potential is critical to Shopify’s unfolding vision. Traditional commerce systems focus on risk, but Shopify cares about the full spectrum of value. The Risk team at Shopify is responsible for building the scalable systems that detect and prevent fraud for our merchants and their customers. They build automated systems that scale machine learning to analyze customer behaviour, incoming orders and financial transactions. Their algorithms also power Shopify Capital, which offers cash advances and loans to eligible merchants.
You will need to have :
Strong background in machine learning including experience implementing models at scale
Extensive experience using Python (including scikit-learn) or similar languages
Extensive experience analyzing data using SQL
It’d be great if you had :
Previous experience using Spark
Experience with statistical methods like regression, GLMs or experiment design and analysis
Exposure to Tableau, QlikView, Mode, Matplotlib, or similar data visualization tools
If you’re interested in helping Shopify shape the future of commerce, click the “Apply now” button to submit your application. Please address your cover letter to Solmaz.

We are seeking a Data Scientist Developer with expertise in ELT and or/BI toolsets to join our Technology Consulting team in Winnipeg. You will engage with a variety of different clients and amazing development teams to gather requirements, analyze, and consult with clients to lay a solid data foundation to perform robust analytics to achieve sustainable growth. You will have the opportunity to work on different assignments to build your technical skills and expertise in both ETL and BI as well as expand your consulting skills. You are a team player who has a desire to learn and grow in their career and help others do the same.

Critical Competencies for Success: Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) tools, Business Intelligence (BI) Tools, Coding, methodical data analysis, critical thinking, collaboration, and excellent presentation skills.

What you'll do


Design, develop, and test software and processes to implement schema and/or data quality changes to the Enterprise Data Warehouse.
Support decision-making where transformations should occur in developing new applications, such as ETL job, database, and application code, based on the business function being performed.
Design ETL process and data flow from source systems to data warehouse.
Develop and unit test ETL processes for optimal performance and pperformance-tune ETL mappings and report queries.
Design and develop Business Intelligence solutions to meet end user demands.
Utilize BI tools such as MicroStrategy and Power BI.
Review physical database objects including fact tables, dimensions, staging, materialized views, and indexes provided by data architects.
Maintain processes that load the legacy operational data store.
Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve application incidents that support third party reporting.
Estimate and track progress of assigned work.
Create and update relevant documentation.
Follow established practices, processes, and guidelines.
Keep current with relevant technologies.

What we'd like

A passion for data.
Strong understanding of data warehousing architectures, core concepts, methodologies, and best practices.
Experience with ETL tools, such as Ab Initio, Informatica, IBM DataStage, SAP Data Services and Microsoft SSIS is considered an asset.
Experience with BI reporting tools such as Microstrategy and Power BI.
Hands-on experience in tuning ETL jobs to reduce run-time and increase efficiency through code tuning, hardware deployment, and architecture changes.
Experience with multiple relational databases (Oracle, SQL Server), Oracle PL/SQL, and advanced SQL writing techniques is a must.
Familiarity with Kimball data warehouse and Dimensional Modelling concepts.
Experience with Windows, UNIX, and scripting tools (Korn shell, Python, PowerShell).
Knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle.
Ability to interact with clients and business users and analyze complex business requirements.
Detail oriented with analytical and problem-solving skills to recognize and identify issues and take proper action to resolve them.
Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, for creation of reports and support of end users.
Effective organizational skills with the ability to self-manage a fluctuating workload, with various situations and changing priorities.
Experience using collaboration tools, such as JIRA, Confluence is considered an asset.
Experience using source code management tools like GIT, SVN, etc. is considered an asset.
Up-to-date on latest technology trends.
Someone who shares our core values:
Caring & Empathy: We look out for each other.
Passion: We are energized by what we do.
Integrity: We do what's right.
Forward Thinking: We are always evolving.
Commitment & Perseverance: We finish what we start.

What you can expect from us

A fantastic work environment. Check us out on www.glassdoor.com ( http://www.glassdoor.com/ ).
Social events, staff meetings, and active Slack channels to keep you connected and collaborating with other Onliners.
A professional development program that is second to none. Every Onliner has an annual budget plus time (outside of allotted vacation) that they are expected to put toward courses, conferences, exams, etc.
The consultant's life – fast-paced and challenging with exposure to a variety of industries and technologies.
Competitive compensation, benefits, and work life balance.
Opportunity to work with Career Mentors who assist with career planning and professional development.
An office on Bannatyne Avenue in the Exchange District to come home to when you're not on a client site. We're located just steps from the river and a beautiful walking path, as well as from a bus stop. We provide a small on-site gym and locked bike storage, and our kitchen is always stocked with free coffee and fruit and an assortment of snacks for those 2:00PM sugar cravings.

About us

Online is a Digital Transformation and Cybersecurity consultancy. Businesses today are under pressure to transform to remain relevant – at the same time there is unprecedented opportunity to innovate, and achieve incredible things never seen before – securely.

We combine the best technology, business, and security practices, and lead Clients through the transformation process. Onliners engage our Clients' vision, embrace the challenge of creating something new, and then push the boundaries to deliver. Not just information technology and security, but processes and people as well – which is the hard part. Results. Guaranteed.

Online was founded in 1986, and our founder, Chuck Loewen, is still President and CEO today. Chuck has always believed in treating our employees (we call ourselves Onliners) and our Clients as guests in his home, and this philosophy permeates our company. We place great emphasis on our culture, always striving to be a great place to work and a great place for our Clients to work with. We look for ways every day to be better than we were the day before, and we are proud to have made the "Best Workplaces in Canada" list for the past 12 consecutive years. There are no signs of slowing down as we look to create new opportunities for Onliners.

About company

AltaML is a fast-growing startup that focuses on applied ML. We partner with industry to co-develop AI/ML powered products. We are experts in ML commercialization and help our industrial partners gain a competitive advantage by combining their data and domain expertise with our analytics and ML proficiency. Our Downtown office is located in the heart of the innovation district. Data informs our every move, and we aim to work quickly, collaboratively and creatively.

Who we are looking for:
Our core values speak volumes about who we are and how we work:

Humble – Listen to the data
Happy – Tap-dance to work
Gritty – Be persistent, not complacent
Agile – Make small bets, then iterate

Our current and future employees:
express our core values

are hungry for knowledge

want to learn new skills

are respectful

collaborate with others across the whole company

share knowledge with coworkers

educate and promote AI and ML concepts both internally and externally

have a high work ethic and are self-motivated

What we have to offer for you

You will be able to experience a silicon valley like company culture. Your work will be applied and will have a high impact on our clients and Alberta’s economy. We work with multiple industries so you will gain experience and domain expertise working on data that comes from different fields. You will be working with people with multiple years of industrial and academic experience in data science, software engineering, and machine learning fields. To solve the problems we apply various ML techniques from traditional Machine Learning and Data Mining algorithms, through to vision, Deep Learning, Information Extraction, advanced NLP and conversational agents.

We also have fun. We believe in working hard, getting the job done and enjoying a beer on Fridays. You’ll also get flexibility in where you work, what hours you work, how much vacation you take, and what you wear. We expect hard work but respect work/life balance.

Job role:
As Director of Data Science you play a crucial role in making sure we grow our team and develop best practices to advance ML projects and deliver value to customers. Your primary responsibilities will be to manage and mentor a team of Data Scientists and to make sure we have a high performing culture and best work practices. You will work with a team of talented Data Scientists and will be responsible for making sure the team grows and people are progressing in their careers.

Responsibilities:
Set the direction for building a high performing culture of data scientists and ML engineers

Create the best possible environment for applied research and development.

Provide mentorship and supervision to the Data Science team

Be a community leader that promotes the company and ML/AI

Oversee the team budget

Minimum Requirements:
8+ years of relevant academic and industrial experience

Degree in Comp Sci, Comp Eng, Statistics, or related field

Experience in managing Data Science teams

Experience in conducting and managing AI/ML projects

Expertise with Machine Learning and Data Mining concepts and techniques

company_name: Ontario Agency for Health Protection and Promotion (Public Health of Ontario)
job_description:
$67,020 a yearOverview

Position Title: Epidemiologist
Department: Health Promotion, Chronic Disease, and Injury Prevention
Duration: Temporary FT 12 to 14 months, externally funded
Location: 480 University Avenue
Compensation Group: AMAPCEO
Salary: $67, 020 to $94, 357
Position Status: OPEN
Internal applicants to be considered first
Hours of Work: 36.25 per week
Posting Date: January 11 , 2019
Closing Date: January 25, 2019

The Epidemiologist is responsible for providing specialized epidemiological services to a research team within the department of Health Promotion, Chronic Disease, and Injury Prevention on a research project: ”Examining the impact of alcohol warning labels on adult drinkers’ awareness of alcohol-related health risks and ability to make more informed and safer drinking choices”. The primary objective of the project is to conduct the first controlled pre-post quasi-experimental study in Canada to test, in the real-world, the impact of posting warning labels on all alcohol containers sold in liquor stores. The data sources for this project include liquor store transaction and longitudinal survey data.
Responsibilities

Works under the general guidance of the Scientist to coordinate all aspects of the project.Provides analytical expertise to support research team’s data, information, knowledge and support goals.Collaborates with internal and external partners to develop data analysis plans.Assists in the preparation of grant submissions and knowledge translation activities, including the preparation of peer-reviewed manuscripts and conference presentations related to ongoing findings of the study.Contributes methodological expertise.Performs other duties as assigned.
Requirements

Master’s degree in epidemiology or related field.Minimum 2 - 4 years of experience as an epidemiologist in a public health or related settingExperience in analysis and interpretation of survey data.Experience in public health research.

About the role

At Shopify, we empower 500,000+ entrepreneurs all over the world. We're looking for hard-working, passionate people to help us make commerce better. For over 10 years we have been super driven when it comes to using data insights to help drive our product direction and make things better for our merchants.
The retail world is continually evolving and what it looked like 5 years ago is drastically different than what it looks like today. A key element in helping our merchants to evolve with the retail industry, is the unprecedented amount data and the advances in technology that help us understand how buyers discover and experience shopping in person. We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Retail Algorithms team and help shape the insights and algorithms that will enable merchants to adapt to the ever changing retail landscape.
You'll Need to Have:
Understanding of dimensional modelling concepts and database design or experience with feature engineering
Experience with statistical methods like regression, GLMs or experiment design and analysis
Extensive experience using Python (including scikit-learn) or similar languages
Extensive experience analyzing data using SQL
It'd be great if you had:
Strong background in machine learning including experience implementing models at scale
Knowledge of the retail or fulfillment industries
Previous experience using Spark
Exposure to Tableau, QlikView, Mode, Matplotlib, or similar data visualization tools
If you’re interested in helping Shopify shape the future of commerce, click the “Apply now” button to submit your application. Please address your cover letter to Rebecca.

Guavus provides dynamic solutions for data-rich businesses, so that they can gain a competitive advantage in creating more meaningful customer experiences.

A Sr. Data Scientist at Guavus is responsible for creating technologies to analyze extremely large volumes of data producing actionable insights for timely decision making by our customers. A person in this role will be responsible for building machine learning models from multiple data sources in order to provide advanced analytics and reporting. The ideal candidate should have skills to quickly select the best analytics approach, perform a proof of value and write production quality code to move the research into production. The role requires exceptional coding skills along with the analytics experience to productively collaborate with our team of scientists and engineers in providing cutting edge, real-time analytics solutions to customers worldwide.

This is an exciting, technical role is based in our Montreal office. It is focused on enabling our customers to create real, practical value through advanced analytics on their streaming data. Our customers – primarily large telecom service providers – use Guavus’ analytics to increase revenues or reduce costs by better network optimization, customer experience optimization, churn management,

Job Responsibilities:

Identify state of the art techniques to solve challenging predictive analytics problems
Create machine learning pipelines, including feature engineering, to analyze terabytes of structured and semi-structured data sets
Quickly design and conduct experiments to showcase proof of value
Build analytics modules using Python / Scala
Integrate analytics modules into Guavus’ real-time analytic platform and update the core machine learning functionalities in our product lines leveraging Python/ Scala.
Work closely with other team members in converting the business problem definition into validated results with customers
Must be self-driven and capable of prioritizing, organizing, and managing
Desired Skills:

The ideal candidate will have a strong academic background with development experience in R/Python or Java/Scala (a big plus) with good command over data pipelining, linear algebra and statistics libraries.
3 -5 years of experience in analyzing large volumes of data in building predictive models is desirable
Exposure to analytics techniques such as outlier detection, classification (RF, NB, etc.), regression, regularization, clustering, dimension reduction (PCA, etc.), reinforcement learning, stochastic methods (ARIMA, HMM, RNN, etc.), hypothesis testing will be a big plus.
Experience with data science toolkits: pandas, scikit-learn, Jupyter, Anaconda, spark-ml, etc.
Good understanding of calculus, linear algebra, and applied statistics
Good understanding of CS fundamentals such as data structures and algorithms, functional programming, cluster computing, etc. and the ability to quickly translate ideas to efficient, elegant code
Experience in high volume data scenarios and hands on knowledge of distributed systems such as Hadoop and Spark will be a big plus
Education:
Bachelor’s degree, but graduate degree preferred, in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or other science field with a dissertation supported by data analysis.

job_title: Alternative Data Scout, Enterprise Data Services
job_description:
Job Description

We are presently recruiting for an Alternative Data Scout at the Associate level within the Enterprise Data Services (EDS) team. The mission of EDS is to successfully service the data needs of investment departments and core services groups across the Fund. You will play a key role in the following activities including, but not limited to:
Proactively sourcing, evaluating and on-boarding data with existing and new providers with an emphasis on unstructured and unique datasets.
Working with portfolio managers to prioritize data scouting projects, including being directly co-located with Data Engineers, Data Scientists and Portfolio Managers.
Collaborating with departments across the company to identify creative applications of disparate data sources.
Develop and maintain deep relationships with data partners.
Inventorying new and existing data content required by the organization to support tactical and strategic initiatives.
Become the trusted source internally to identify, prioritize and develop new data partnership prospects and the trusted source to data providers to maintain and mature commercial models and approach with new datasets.
Build sustainable and scalable processes and best practices; drive day-to-day operational excellence through design, execution and improvement.
Create and maintain reports and communications internally to advance and share knowledge.

Qualifications


5+ years of experience in financial services; sell-side, buy-side, management consulting; or business strategy/corporate development.
Previous experience advising investment, or product, or data engineering teams on alternative data solutions.
Exceptional listening skills in translating open-ended data requests into actionable data searches that will create value in the investment process.
Experience working with data catalogs, data dictionaries and sample data files.
Team player and natural explorer with excellent communication and negotiation skills.
Eagerness to execute with strong work ethic and a sense of urgency.
Experience in Python or R an asset.
CFA/CAIA designation.
Exemplify CPPIB’s Guiding Principles of Partnership, Integrity and High Performance.

Additional Information

Visit our Linkedin Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn. #LI-JC1

Duties
Position 1: Ecosystem Scientist II: “Recovery of Species at Risk”

The intent of this position is to enhance protection and recovery of species and their critical habitat through science, Indigenous knowledge, and implementation of on-the-ground recovery actions. Through applied research and monitoring projects, active management and restoration activities, and signature projects on iconic northern species, you will aim to achieve landscape-scale conservation outcomes. Working in collaboration with Indigenous knowledge holders, partners and stakeholders, you will be responsible for providing advice and expertise with respect to the planning and implementation of recovery measures for species at risk and implementation of Species at Risk Act requirements.

Position 2: Ecosystem Scientist II: “Enhancing landscape-level connectivity through collaboration and partnering”

The focus of this position will be to guide the implementation of landscape-scale conservation, including with respect to ecological connectivity, and the incorporation of Inuit knowledge in conservation. You will strive to develop partnerships and mechanisms to support Inuit and Inuit organizations in playing an active role in conservation, including supporting the creation of protected areas to enhance the connectivity of PCA places. Through collaborating and coordinating with partners and stakeholders to you will identify, understand and respond to landscape-level ecological issues. By proactively engaging jurisdictions, Inuit and experts you will address landscape-level issues, through developing and implementing measures to improve connectivity between park ecosystems and the surrounding landscape.
Work environment
Parks Canada is a federal government agency responsible for the protection and presentation of Canada’s outstanding natural and cultural resources through a system of national parks, national marine conservation areas and national historic sites in all regions of Canada.
Intent of the process
The intent of this process is to staff 2 fulltime positions in Nunavut Field Unit. The two vacant positions have a work location of Pond Inlet and Naujaat (Repulse Bay). However, there may be flexibility to work from another Parks Canada offices in Nunavut.


This process may be used to create a list of qualified candidates to staff similar positions with various tenures, security levels or linguistic requirements in same or other parts of the country
