STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.

Job Description Summary
The Process Chemist, Nanoparticles will assist the Process Development team in designing magnetic nanoparticle manufacturing processes at various scales from laboratory to production. Primary responsibilities include identifying potential process improvements, designing and executing studies to support engineering efforts, and characterizing process products and intermediates.

STEMCELL strongly encourages cross-disciplinary teamwork, and the successful candidate will bring experiences and ideas from a variety of fields. STEMCELL is committed to continuous improvement and innovative scientific research, and this role will provide a diverse range of technical challenges for the successful candidate.

Job Description

Duties and Responsibilities
Synthesize and modify particles that lie at the interface of chemistry, biochemistry and physics
Study reaction parameters (eg. kinetics) at small scale and map results to pilot systems
Inform process design by relating engineering phenomena (eg. heat transfer, shear, pressure) to potential impact on product quality
Identify and optimize key chemical process parameters to understand product attributes
Independently design and execute experiments to support the continuous improvement of STEMCELL’s processes
Operate pilot scale equipment such as reactors, pumps, heat exchangers, and filtration systems, at times in an aseptic environment
Draft technical documents such as SOPs, batch records, validation protocols and development reports
Summarize findings and present technical data to non-technical audiences

Qualifications
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in organic chemistry, materials chemistry or a related field
Experience in one or more of the following areas is desired: organic synthesis, bioconjugation, polymer chemistry, surface modification, functional materials, and the associated analytical techniques
Experience with process scale-up and tech transfer activities is an asset
Experience with nanoparticle synthesis, characterization, functionalization, and purification is an asset.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Experience with design and/or execution of DOEs is an asset
Experience with aseptic processing and/or working in a GMP environment is an asset
An ability to summarize and communicate technical detail to non-technical audiences

Influence the company’s strategic direction through enabling our business leaders to make data-driven-decisions

Develop data-integration processes to integrate disparate datasets into a cohesive data model in support of BI and Analytics requirements

Implement necessary processes and tools to ensure process maturity and best practices are followed
Lead design discussions and decisions as it relates to business intelligence and database solutions and drive decisions through to completion
You’ll Excel Because of Your:

company_name: The Centre For Drug Research And Development
job_description:
Summary

The Drug Delivery Co-op Student will work with CDRD scientists and staff to provide Formulation and Analytical support for multiple drug development projects. The individual in this role will contribute to collaborative research, and conduct experiments in a team-oriented product development focused environment. We are currently seeking to fill one, 8-month term Co-op position with the possibility of extension.

What can you look forward to?

You will:
 Develop and implement physicochemical assays for characterization of small molecules, biomolecules and drug formulations.
 Develop LC-MS methods for novel drugs molecules.
 Assist in the preparation of drug product formulations for in vitro and in vivo evaluations.
 Present and discuss data and results at team meetings.
Document test procedures and summarize results in reports.
 Other related duties as assigned.

Should you apply?

Here is what we are looking for:
 Currently enrolled in an undergraduate co-op program in Chemistry, Pharmaceutical Sciences or related Health Science disciplines at Canadian University.
Previous Co-op studentship experience is an asset.
 Prior HPLC and LCMS experience is an asset.
 Strong written and oral communications skills.
 A self-motivated and creative individual able to work in a team environment.

What can we offer you?
Beyond drug development, we take pride in a training program that is dedicated to providing every opportunity for our students to grow and develop their technical and soft skills. Our training program has over 200 alumni with a 95% employment rate and incorporates mentorship, event opportunities and a speaker series.

In addition to being a training platform for scientists and business people, we also take additional steps to build a work culture that champions innovation, partnership and a social aspect. With an enthusiastic WE@CDRD Events committee, we host monthly socials, holiday parties and company events.

Our Commitment to You
CDRD supports employees to strike a balance between their work and personal lives. At CDRD, our human resources practices and strategies have been developed to build an inclusive culture regardless of race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital or family status, or disability.

Are You Ready to Apply?
Submit the following:
1. Your Cover Letter (PDF)
2. Your Resume + Your Transcript (In one PDF)
 We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those applicants short-listed will be contacted for an interview.

Formulation Scientist – Food and Beverage, Nanaimo, BC

Tilray is a federally licensed producer of medical cannabis. We are committed to setting the gold standard of care and excellence in our industry. We believe that commitment starts with a great work environment and benefits for our associates.

Looking to develop your career at the forefront of a rapidly expanding industry?
Ready to apply your talents to make a positive difference in the lives of patients across the country?

The Formulation Scientist – Food and Beverage is accountable to and interacts directly with the Product R&D Manager. The Formulation Scientist - Food and Beverage will be responsible for the research and development of new cannabis consumer products for adult use, with a focus on food products and beverages.

As a Formulation Scientist, you will have unique opportunities to increase technical knowledge by participating in the development of a diverse portfolio of beverage and snack product categories. Successful candidates thrive in an environment of fast-paced, consumer-driven product development.

This role requires close collaboration with internal stakeholders such as marketing, operations, supply chain, quality, and any applicable third-party agencies. The Formulation Scientist supports all activities required to develop, optimize and scale-up a stable and robust formulation to make it suitable for commercial production, adhering to correct procedures and health and safety guidelines.

Role and Responsibilities
Develop beverage, food, and other consumer product formulations, leveraging expertise in food chemistry and food ingredient functionality
Assist in the formulation and development of novel nutraceuticals in a variety of delivery applications with emphasis on achieving appealing flavor, color and other organoleptic properties
Design and execute experiments, and analyze and interpret data to make sound technical recommendations on product and process
Investigate and apply new technology to provide a competitive advantage
Partner externally to source ingredients and leverage vendor expertise in ingredient functionality
Provide expertise in techniques for isolation of volatile compounds from food, beverage and packaging
Translate product attributes into formal specifications for manufacture
Lead development for quality/product improvement and productivity initiatives
Participate as an active member of cross-functional business development teams comprised of individuals from a variety of disciplines, including Marketing, Finance, Purchasing, Engineering and many others
Be responsible for ensuring shelf stability and safety of new formulations
Present findings regularly with marketing and R&D departments.
Evaluate feedback and make necessary changes to formulas
Research and summarize relevant topics for active work streams and new marketable products
Strong writing skills and ability to record and formalize data and processes according to Company and Health Canada directives
Maintain a clean laboratory environment and ensure that safety regulations are followed. Perform calibration and maintenance on laboratory instruments/ equipment as required.


Qualifications
Degree in a technical field (Chemistry, Biochemistry, Biology–related field, Nutrition and/or Food Science). PhD is considered an asset.
Minimum 4+ years Product Development Experience (on Beverages and/or Food preferred) which require both formulation, packaging, and process to create.
Demonstrated expertise and strong knowledge of flavor, analytical, and food chemistry
Previous experience working with cannabis and/or exceptional knowledge of its properties and how it uniquely reacts when infused into digestible preferred, but not required
Enthusiasm for research / computation and hands-on experimentation and formulations.
Attention to detail and efficiency in a laboratory setting
Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Self-motivated problem solver and the drive to deliver objectives in a complex environment.
The ability to plan, put together well thought out design of experiments, anticipate next steps and incorporate course corrections when hurdles appear.
Excellent verbal and written communication
Executional excellence, personal leadership and customer focus a must
Ability to learn new products and processes quickly

-------------------------
Experienced Data Engineer
-------------------------

Overview
--------

Marketmuse Inc.'s M4 Lab ( https://m4.marketmuse.com/ ) is seeking an experienced Python & Java/Scala engineer to help create the next generations of content analytics and content generation technologies. This role blends production software development, big data, and machine learning. The engineer will work on natural language processing systems that try to understand the semantics, intent, and topical structure of vast amounts of web content at scale. This role requires extensive knowledge and experience in architecting and developing data-intensive applications.

About Us
--------

Marketmuse Inc. is a rapidly growing institutionally-backed content planning technology firm with offices in Montreal, Boston, and New York City. We are the premier provider of enterprise content planning technologies and are recognized as a leading technology for content marketing functions. MarketMuse's new M4 Lab (the MarketMuse Montreal Machine Monograph Lab) will be a hub for our advanced machine learning and data sciences teams working on cutting-edge R&D to improve our systems' quality of content understanding, knowledge representation, and machine learning powered content generation assistance tools. Our software also helps our clients optimize or create content ranging from short blog posts to long whitepapers.

Responsibilities
----------------


Design and implement reliably distributed data pipelines
Implement scalable architectures of machine learning prototype solutions geared towards solving natural language processing, knowledge representation, and natural language generation problems
Create parallelized and/or distributed versions of existing algorithms
Maintain and develop existing machine learning models
Collaborate with research scientists, architects and product management to design and program innovative strategic and tactical solutions that meet market needs with respect to functionality, performance, reliability, realistic implementation schedules, and adherence to development goals and principles
Gather and determine requirements for new features from internal colleagues

Required Skills
---------------


Experience with architecting data-intensive applications
Experience writing software in Python, Scala and/or Java. Experience working with data structures, algorithms and software design
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, including data warehouse technical architectures, infrastructure components, tools and environments (such as Apache Beam, Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive, MapReduce, Flume)
Experience with test-driven development
Experience working effectively with software engineering teams
Mentor others in achieving their career growth potential

Required Education and Experience Level
---------------------------------------


At least 5 years of engineering experience with Java/Scala/Python
At least 2 years of distributed or highly threaded software development experience

Preferred But Optional Skills
-----------------------------


MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related fields
Experience with workflow tools like Airflow, Luigi, etc.
Experience with data mining or machine learning applications
Hands-on experience implementing new research ideas with a neural network training framework such as Tensorflow, Keras, or PyTorch

Unata is on a mission to build the grocery shopping experience of the future. Our white label platform powers the digital customer experience for some of North America’s most well-respected grocers, and we don’t plan on stopping here. We were acquired by Instacart in 2018 so that we could take over the grocery world with the most comprehensive, innovative digital grocery solution in the market. The chance to help shape the technical future of our product as we scale to scores of retail partners and millions of users
Learn and work with technologies like JavaScript, Angular, React, HTML, CSS, and more!
Participation in daily stand-up (providing a status of work completed and in-progress), team sprint planning and solution design meetings; as well as in all aspects of software development including design, implementation, and deployment
Present work performed to other team members for constructive review. Communicating design decisions and solutions to other teams in the form of tech circles in effort of improving awareness, and soliciting feedback and buy in on approach.

The opportunity to mentor junior engineers via pairing, design review, participation in code reviews to help maintain best practices.

Time to attend various developer conferences, like PyCon, where our Team is regularly selected to present

A place within a company that appreciates learning new technologies and implementing them when they make sense
… and more!
Want to join a talented team of people changing the way the world grocery shops?
Unata is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse team representative of the city we live in, and the people who use our product everyday. We believe that the best solutions are the ones created from a variety perspectives and that experience comes in many forms. If you are reading this posting and thinking 'I could do that!', we strongly encourage you to apply (i.e. exact experience not required).
Apply today with a copy of your resume, and let us know why you're a great fit for the position! Visit www.unata.com/careers/. To learn more about our parent, please visit www.instacart.com.

Recognized as the 25th Fastest-Growing Companies in B.C. in 2016, Applied Biological Materials Inc. is a Vancouver-based biotech company that develops and markets research reagents and custom services to the life science community and the biotech industry. We currently have an opening of a Technician position for a reliable, motivated and detail-oriented individual.

The successful candidate(s) will be part of the Molecular Pathology team for our complete line of Immunohistochemistry Antibody products. The successful candidate(s) will have plenty of opportunities for fast-track career development while being part of a highly diverse, innovative and interactive cohort of scientists.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following

Apply technical knowledge and laboratory skills to design and perform various experiments under supervision from senior R&D scientists, including immunohistochemistry (IHC), western blotting, ELISA, and column chromatography.

Perform sterile cell culture procedures following standard operating procedures and maintain standard level for quality control.

Perform immunostaining procedures, including tissue processing, fixation, embedding, sectioning, staining, and analysis.

Establish a GLP IHC program and examine stained slides under microscope to ensure results are satisfactory.

Develop protocols and write related SOPs.

Follow established laboratory practices to smoothly and safely operate equipment including microtome, IHC automatic stainer, microscope etc.

Collect and analyze all experimental records/data and keep them well-maintained and organized.

Present findings in meetings and contribute to project planning.

Qualifications : shortlisted candidates will have the following experience:

A minimum of BSc in Chemistry/Biochemistry/Biology

Previous experience in cell culture and microscopy, western blotting, ELISA or column chromatography is an asset

Previous experience in immunohistochemistry is an asset

Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and the ability to troubleshoot

Strong communication and interpersonal skills

Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced, team environment.

How To Apply:
Please apply for the position through our career site. We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.

job_title: Research Associate, Assay Development - Flow Cytometry (Toronto)
job_description:
BlueRock Therapeutics is an engineered cell therapy company with a mission to develop regenerative medicines for intractable diseases. As part of BlueRock Therapeutics vision to change the future of medicine by enabling ground-breaking cell therapies, the candidate will be a key technical contributor of a dynamic and progressive team pioneering scaled somatic cell manufacturing processes utilizing state-of-the-art culturing technology. The successful candidate will support various research teams at BlueRock by co-ordinating and conducting critical flow cytometry and other cellular assays for cell therapy products and manufacturing processes. Expertise in developing and qualifying multicolour flow cytometry assays is required. The ideal candidate will be a highly motivated individual who leads from the bench and enjoys having broad responsibilities and opportunities. Collaboration with a highly-motivated, world-class team of scientists and engineers promises an exciting and engaging work environment for motivated, self-starting candidates. Familiarity with performing flow cytometry sample analysis under GLP or GMP regulations is a plus.
KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBLITIES:
Perform flow cytometry and other cellular analysis of cell therapy products, as part of an analytical core
Co-ordinate all technical and logistical aspects of sample analysis, from receiving and organizing incoming samples, sample processing, conducting appropriate method testing, performing data analysis and reporting results with proper documentation in a timely manner
Develop and optimize new multicolour flow cytometry panels and other cellular assays as required
Identify and determine appropriate ranges of (critical) assay process parameters to ensure robust, repeatable and accurate results with minimal supervision
Collect and analyze data from various assays, track and trend data and establish specifications for critical process controls
Ensure that experiments, analytical methods and data meet the requirements for the intended use of assays, which includes characterization, lot release and comparability
Perform other cellular and molecular assays as required
Author and review SOPs, study protocols, reports and other scientific and quality documents
Ensure that assays meet regulatory requirements in all regions relevant to the company, in compliance with the Quality Management System
This position requires hands-on laboratory work
Present scientific data to colleagues in group meetings, prepare and present internal and external presentations (presentations, posters, publications) as required
Perform additional duties to support the safe and efficient operation of the laboratory, and other duties as assigned
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills

INTERPERSONAL SKILLS/CONTACTS:
Self-motivated and willing to accept temporary responsibilities outside of initial job description
Comfortable in a fast-paced small company environment with minimal direction and able to adjust workload based upon changing priorities
Shares relevant information openly and seeks appropriate input from others outside of the direct team; develops and maintains effective cross-functional working relationships and partnerships; responds positively and constructively to requests for support from across the organization
Creatively challenges the status quo to find new ways of working; looks for the opportunities that arise during times of change; readily adapts to new environment, jobs, technologies and processes

WORKING CONDITIONS:
Candidate will be working in office and controlled laboratory environments
Work may periodically require moving heavy equipment and the ability to lift ~50 pounds
There is a risk of potential exposure to chemicals and biohazards consistent with somatic cell therapy culture
Working in the laboratory requires mandatory use of personal protective equipment
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/CREDENTIALS/SKILLS:
B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Biological Sciences or related and a minimum of two years of relevant flow cytometry experience, preferably in a biotechnology or pharmaceutical industry setting, core facility or contract research organization
Demonstrated expertise with multicolour flow cytometry procedures and data analysis software including experience with operation, maintenance and daily calibration of cytometers
Significant experience in developing and optimizing multicolour flow cytometry panels is required
Practical understanding of qualification and/or validation of analytical assays (e.g. to GLP or GMP regulations) and familiarity with Good Documentation Practices is a strong plus
A solid understanding of aseptic techniques and technologies in cell culture is required
Experience in management and statistical analysis of data is desired
Cooperating with a larger team, must be able to solve a wide range of complex problems in creative and practical ways
Skilled in initiating and managing projects of complex scope, including cross-functions
A proven ability to be highly productive and successful in a high pace work environment with excellent attention to details and meticulous bench work
Competency in computer skills and familiarity with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)

job_title: Staff Environmental Scientist / Engineer/Technologist - Ottawa, ON
job_description:
SLR is a multi-disciplinary environmental consulting firm that specializes in the provision of these services within the following business sectors in Canada and the world: Built Environment, Industry, Infrastructure, Mining & Minerals, Oil & Gas and Power. SLR is one of a very small number of truly international specialist environmental consultancies.
As an employee controlled company, in which many of our staff have a share, SLR offers rewarding careers to all of its staff and values and rewards customer care and commitment as well as technical expertise. SLR provides a healthy and dynamic work environment, challenging career opportunities and competitive compensation and benefit packages.

For more information, please visit http://www.slrconsulting.com.
Role:
SLR has an opportunity for a staff level Environmental Engineer/Scientist in our Ottawa, Ontario office. The role will consist of implementation of data collection programs (field work) including soil, groundwater, surface water and soil vapour sampling to be used for Phase I and II environmental site assessment and remediation.
Other duties include preparation of health and safety plans, coordination of field programs, preparation of environmental summary reports for work conducted, environmental monitoring of construction projects, and assisting with a variety of environmental engineering and science projects.
Responsibilities:
Participation in a team environment, working closely with Project Managers, and co-workers to complete work programs.
Collection of site background information, participation in field data collection programs, and preparation of reports.
Perform field work safely and as directed, including soil sampling, groundwater sampling and monitoring, soil vapour sampling, and site reconnaissance
Technical Skills / Abilities / Experience:
2-4 years of experience in contaminated site assessment, including Phase I and Phase II ESA programs (e.g., drilling, test pitting, groundwater sampling, etc.) Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential with demonstrated skill in technical report writing.
Knowledge and practical application of health & safety requirements unique to subsurface investigations and contaminated sites.
Willingness and ability to travel and conduct fieldwork.
Ability to work alone in remote locations and adapt to conditions/resources.
Strong Computer skills, including Microsoft Word and Excel.
Education / Qualifications / Memberships:
Environmental Technology Diploma, Degree in environmental engineering or science or equivalent.
Professional status or eligibility for professional status with a professional organization (i.e. C.Tech., P.Eng. or P.Geol.).
Personal Attributes:
Demonstrated team player with excellent interpersonal skills.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
Ambition to grow with the company.
Ability to solve problems with minimal supervision.
Valid driver's license.

GenomeDx Biosciences is a dynamic entrepreneurial molecular diagnostics company focused on cancer genomics. Whether in the cloud with big data, or on the phone with patients, our innovators are working hard to deliver usable genomic information into the hands of physicians and patients: information for life.
Our team is constantly learning from each other, from patients and from urologic oncology professionals in world-renowned cancer institutions. Our team works in multi-disciplinary, collaborative project teams that enable us to respond effectively to an evolving, growing, data-driven environment.
We are currently seeking a dynamic Data Engineer to join our team in Vancouver.
**Accepting co-op or intern applications**
GDx Innovator
The GenomeDx Data Science and Engineering team is a passionate group of scientists and software engineers striving to use the best science and engineering knowledge to develop data pipelines and software that make genomic data actionable to cancer patients and their doctors. We develop and deploy machine learning models based whole transcriptome gene expression data to reveal new insights in cancer molecular biology. We also develop software/apps that facilitates better data visualization and interpretation for colleagues, physicians, and patients.
As a Data Engineer you will work closely with a team of technical and product professionals. You will be a key member in our processes of data related software design, development, testing, implementation, and maintenance of applications that all departments in the company depend on for day to day business activities. This role will rely heavily on development performance, effective communication, thorough testing and timely delivery.
What you are great at doing:
Understanding, maintaining, and improving various databases and schema.
Developing software that automatically schedules data processing programs on cloud platforms (online transaction processing).
Developing data integrations with other platforms.
Assisting colleagues in data processing and troubleshooting.
Understanding and deploying machine learning models for genomic data.
Developing online analytical platform that process/analyze/visualize high dimension genomic data together with rich clinical data.
Developing AI data analytical program (natural language processing) that facilitates online data operations
Developing programs to extract/summarize clinical information from EMR or other forms of "raw" data.
What you need to be successful:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, bioinformatics, or equivalent field of study. Graduate degree is a plus.
What you will bring to the team:
Experience working with source control tools (Git) in a collaborative programming environment.
Familiar with both object-oriented and functional programming.
Proficient in Java, Go, Scala, and/or similar programming languages.
Experience working with scripting languages such as R and Python.
Experience developing and interacting with REST APIs.
Familiar with SQL.
Skilled at Linux environment operations (bash) and work with remote servers via command line.
Experience working with clinical data in a regulatory environment is a plus.
Experience with Cloud computation platforms (GCP, AWS) is a plus.
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes is a plus.
Experience with Spark as well as its dependencies/reverse dependencies is a plus.
Curiosity and eager to learn.

Our mission
To foster creativity, curiosity, and a lifelong love of learning in children 12 and under, through hands-on exhibits, programming and outreach.
Job purpose
Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Programming & Outreach Coordinator is a key member of the Operations team and leader of the Program Facilitators and Party Hosts, ensuring that the Museum’s in-house and outreach programs meet the goals laid out by the Operations Manager. This position is responsible for ensuring effective partnerships with community organizations that work with the Museum on programming; designing, facilitating and evaluating programs; and ensuring that all participants in the Museum’s programming have a positive experience.
Duties and responsibilities
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Work with Operations Manager to develop strategic vision and objectives for programming
a. Use feedback, data, trends and curriculum to determine programming needs.
b. Research, design and coordinate logistics for inhouse and outreach programming to meet objectives and achieve goals.
c. Oversee and coordinate materials needed for programs in inhouse, outreach and exhibits.
d. Work with Communications and Marketing Coordinator to promote programs and initiatives.
2. Coordinate Program staff and Volunteers
a. Coordinate and supervise CDM’s team of Program Facilitators and Party Hosts.
b. Submit staffing schedules to Operations Manager for approval.
c. Assist in training, orientation and performance evaluations for all Programming team members.
d. Support Programming team members in finding innovative and exciting ways to help children engage in the world around them.
e. Assist in training and orientation for all volunteers participating in delivering programming.
f. Work with Volunteer Coordinator to determine volunteer needs for in house and outreach programming.
3. Assist in the preparation of and adherence to funding opportunities
a. Provide program/project descriptions and preliminary budget to Fund Development Manager and Operations Manager for funding applications and requests.
b. Maintain collection of program data to be used for follow up reporting.
4. Develop and maintain positive relationships with community organizations and stakeholders
a. Initiate connections and continue to engage with, but not limit to, local artists, scientists, educators and organizations for programming and resource development.
b. In building relationships, work with Fund Development Manager to cultivate potential funding partnerships and opportunities.
5. Other duties as required
Qualifications
The individual will have knowledge of nonprofit practices and experience in program design and coordination. They will have further experience in building partnerships and encouraging participation. The individual holds a Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience and knowledge of child development and education practices. We value a diverse array in education and skillsets for our team and welcome specialties from a wide range of sectors.
The individual should possess proven leadership skills in a diverse and inclusive environment; a commitment to the positive growth and development of children; the ability to think strategically and translate goals into measurable operational objectives; sensitivity to accessibility and inclusion barriers for marginalized children and families; and highly developed interpersonal skills.
Working conditions
This position is full-time (40 hours per week).
This position will be located at the CDM museum site in Saskatoon.
This position’s wage is hourly - $20-$22 (Benefit coverage after three month probationary period).
This position requires working with the following equipment: POS system, computer, debit machine, vehicle (Class 5 driver’s license).
Some travel within Saskatoon is required to attend meetings, community events, and learning opportunities. Occasional overnight travel may be required depending on current activities.
The operating environment is such that staff may be required to work extra hours to meet the needs of the organization. While staff need to be flexible in their work schedules, the CDM is committed to providing appropriate time-in-lieu and/or compensation.
We work with children to promote a sense of discovery, creativity and exploration both indoors and outside. This sometimes involves facilitating fun in hot, cold, light, dark, dray, damp, quiet and loud environments. This position also typically involves walking, lifting, bending, kneeling, driving and carrying items over distance. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform their duties.
If you feel that this position may be right for you, please submit a resume, cover letter and three professional references to: michelle.mcmillan@museumforkids.sk.ca by 11pm January 29, 2019.

Insight is looking for a dynamic and driven Manager of Strategic Partnerships to support our growing team. Insight works with hundreds of cutting-edge teams across the US and Canada to build a pipeline of new talent for hard-to-fill roles. We run a free 7-week Fellowship program for scientists, engineers, and product managers identified from over 10,000 applicants a year. Fellows build new skills through collaborative learning and go on to thriving careers at top companies.

As Manager of Strategic Partnerships, you will be responsible for bringing new partners on board and maintaining strong communication with companies in the Insight network. In addition, you will be responsible for establishing new partnerships with community and government organizations. To succeed in this role, you should be a tried and tested self-starter, an excellent task manager, and have previous accomplishments in lead generation in a sales, business development, account management or strategic partnerships role. We are looking for individuals who are excited about working within the education space and tech industry and who want to learn more and grow within their role. This is a full-time position based in Toronto.

Responsibilities:

Identify and establish relationships with new organizations interested in working with Insight from initial contact through contract negotiation and signing.
Build tight-knit relationships with Insight's partners, ensure client success and satisfaction.
Pursue opportunities for partnerships with government and community organizations.
Establish trust, communicate expectations, and advocate for Fellows with hiring teams.
Act as an internal driver for outreach strategy and improving workflow.
Track goals and progress using Salesforce.
Engage Toronto data community and partners with regular (monthly) events.
Keep up to date with the latest trends in data science, engineering, and talent acquisition in order to drive strategies for business development.

We are looking for someone who has:

Impeccable written and spoken communication, with a love for talking to new people.
Skill handling complex relationships with multiple product offerings.
A strong grasp of technology and appetite to learn in order to effectively discuss the program with technical partners.
Multi-tasking ability and excellent organizational skills.
Enthusiasm to work in our rapidly-growing company.

You could be an especially good fit if you have:

Prior new business/negotiation experience at a high-growth company.
Experience navigating large enterprise organizations and establishing strong vendor relationships.
Prior work experience using Salesforce or similar CRM software.

Our technology helps reduce food waste which provides an economic, social and environmental benefit to businesses and society. They should have a strong background in using complex equipment that may include spectroscopy, chromatography, electrophoresis, and mass spectrometry to test and quantify samples for the purpose of integration into Artificial Intelligence frameworks. This individual will work closely with Hardware Designers, Data Scientists, and Business Analysts to build real world solutions for the Food industry.WHAT EXACTLY WOULD YOU BE DOING?· Apply various analytical testing techniques that may include microscopy, spectroscopy, UV/Vis, FT-IR, NIR, chromatography (HPLC and GC MS) and traditional wet chemistry techniques,· Perform analytical method development & validation,· Design creative sampling methods and protocols,· Prepare standards, reagents, and solvents for experiments,· Perform chemical extractions in accordance to accepted protocols,· Work with laboratory instrument vendors as needed to maintain instruments in a validated state,· Conduct laboratory calibrations and perform stability testing,· Provide analytical testing strategies to solve real-world problems related to the Food industry,· Design and execute experimental procedures, including qualitative and quantitative testing of complex samples,· Validate and troubleshoot analytical methods,· Participate in Product Development brainstorm sessions,· Communicate effectively in both written and oral presentations which may include emails, technical reports and PowerPoint presentations.· Maintain excellent laboratory behavior which includes but not limited to chemical hygiene and all EHS requirements,· Use chemometrics and multivariate modeling for data analysis of data capture from various spectroscopic techniques, including Infrared and Raman,· Use software (Python, MATLAB, C and other similar languages) for data analysis,· Comply with and complete all required internal and external training in a timely manner as well as maintain complete and accurate training records,· Fulfil additional work-related duties as required / assigned.EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED FOR THIS ROLE· Bachelor’s, Master’s or PhD degree in Chemistry, Engineering.· 5+ years work experience in Pharmaceutical, Food, or related industries.CORE TRAITS YOU MUST HAVE TO BE PART OF OUR TEAM!· Initiative and independence – the ability to take appropriate action and anticipate team needs,· Objectivity, integrity – the ability to seek and weigh opinions and evidence – compromising where necessary on ways and means but not on principles or goals,· Professionalism – operate at the highest level of professionalism with colleagues, clients and all other stakeholders,· Problem solving - ability to see multiple ways of tackling a problem and think “outside of the box”,· Diplomacy and tact – the ability to deal effectively with colleagues and stakeholders,· Leadership potential – capacity and aptitude for leading a team, taking charge and motivating team members,· High energy –capacity to work effectively in a rapid pace, tight deadline ad hoc work environment,· Team-player – is flexible and enjoys working in a team environment,· Positive attitude,· Result driven,· Entrepreneurial spirit.Excited? Then send us your resume!Job Type: Full-time

Company Overview / Présentation de l’entreprise:
Chez Nuance, nous donnons aux gens la possibilité d'interagir naturellement avec leurs divers appareils connectés et le monde numérique autour d'eux. Nous créons un monde où la technologie pense et agit de la façon dont les humains le font en concevant des modes d'interaction avec la technologie plus intuitifs.
Notre technologie agile utilise des analyses et des algorithmes avancés pour transformer l'inanimé en animé et transformer des processus complexes en processus simples.
Rejoignez notre équipe entreprise ... un excellent service à la clientèle commence ici. Nous concevons des assistants virtuels facilitant le service client intelligent. Les clients de diverses compagnies peuvent maintenant facilement trouver les informations dont ils ont besoin en utilisant tous les canaux qu'ils préfèrent.
At Nuance, we empower people with the ability to seamlessly interact with their connected devices and the digital world around them. We are creating a world where technology thinks and acts the way people do by designing the most human, natural, and intuitive ways of interacting with technology.
Our nimble technology uses analytics and advanced algorithms to transform the inanimate into animate and reduce complicated processes into simple ones.
Join our Enterprise team…great customer service starts here. We design virtual assistants for intelligent and effortless customer service helping customers find the information they need using whatever channel they prefer.
Job Summary / Sommaire du poste:
En tant que scientifique de la parole au sein des services professionnelle de la division entreprise de Nuance, vous travaillerez sur la reconnaissance automatique de la parole et des applications naturelles de traitement du langage couvrant un large éventail d'activités dans toutes les phases du projet, y compris la conception, le développement et l'optimisation du système.
Travailler au sein des équipes de développement d'applications pour garantir les meilleures performances de la reconnaissance et l'expérience utilisateur possible dans les systèmes déployés;
Concevoir, développer et tester grammaires VoiceXML et créer des grammaires pour des contextes dynamiques, y compris la compréhension du langage naturel (NLU) langage statistique et des modèles sémantiques;
Analyser les performances des applications en identifiant les points chauds, en évaluant du point de vue de l'appelant et l'utilisateur de navigation afin d’assurer la précision de la reconnaissance vocale. Faire des recommandations liées au flux d’appels susciter et optimiser les performances de la reconnaissance par l'amélioration des grammaires, des modèles sémantiques statistiques, paramètres de reconnaissance, des dictionnaires et des modèles acoustiques;
Fournir des résultats d'analyse à nos clients pour aider à conduire leur performance d'application de service à la clientèle avant. Avoir des nouvelles idées créatives pour améliorer l'expérience et d'accroître l'automatisation;
Élaborer des méthodologies, des scripts, des procédures qui améliorent l'efficacité et la qualité;
Développer des outils et d'améliorer les algorithmes qui facilitent le développement de nouveaux systèmes et l'optimisation du traitement du langage et des composants de reconnaissance vocale
Contribuer à la conception des futures versions du produit, en collaboration avec le produit, R & D, et d'autres groupes.
Compétences requises: 0-3 ans d'experience dans le domaine
Être autonome, très indépendant et capable de remplir les engagements des projets multiples simultanément;
Passionné par l'analyse des données pour résoudre les problèmes et améliorer les systèmes
De bonnes compétences en programmation, de préférence avec un langage de script tel que Perl ou Python;
Excellentes communications écrites et orales en anglais;
Capacité de travail efficacement dans le respect des échéanciers en prenant en compte les contraintes techniques du projet.
Atouts:
Expérience de travail (ou académique) précédente dans l'interaction homme-machine, des études d'utilisabilité, ou statistiques;
Expérience de travail à titre d'analyste d'affaires, idéalement dans une capacité technique
Solides compétences en programmation dans au moins deux des langages suivants : Perl, Python, Java, C / C ++, SQL;
Expérience avec des logiciels statistiques tels que R;
Formation en sciences de données, ou dans des domaines connexes;
Connaissances en matière de reconnaissance vocale, de compréhension du langage naturel et de classification de texte ou d'autres algorithmes d'apprentissage machine;
Familiarité avec IVR et ASR plates-formes et les API;
Expérience avec la reconnaissance des formes, l'apprentissage machine, la linguistique ou en signal de traitement des connaissances;
Connaissance de l'analyse des données statistiques;
Expérience avec XML, VoiceXML;
Capacité à parler espagnol, mandarin, et d'autres langues étrangères souhaitable.

As a Speech Scientist in the Professional Services group, you will work on automated speech recognition applications, covering a broad range of activities in all project phases, including the design, development, and optimization of the system.
You will:
Work across application development teams to ensure best possible recognition performance and caller experience in deployed systems
Identify recognition challenges and assess accuracy feasibility during the design phase
Design, develop, and test VoiceXML grammars and create JSPs, Java, and ECMAscript grammars for dynamic contexts
Analyze performance of applications by identifying hot-spots, assessing transactional success, and recognition accuracy. Make recommendations related to call flow and prompting, and optimize recognition performance by tuning grammars, statistical language models, recognition parameters, dictionaries, and acoustic models
Contribute to the analysis and presentation of client-facing deliverables
Develop methodologies, scripts, procedures that improve efficiency and quality
Develop tools and enhance algorithms that facilitate deployment and tuning of recognition components
Provide input into the design of future product releases
Number of Years of Work Experience: 0 – 3 Years
Required Skills:
BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering, Cognitive Science, Computational Linguistics, Physics, Mathematics, or related field
Highly independent and capable of fulfilling multiple project commitments concurrently
Passionate about analyzing data to solve problems and improve systems
Good programming skills, preferably with a scripting language such as Perl or Python
Excellent written and oral communications skills, as well as the ability to work as part of a project team
Ability to scope work taking technical, business and time-frame constraints into consideration
Preferred Skills:
Coursework or previous work experience in human computer interaction, usability studies, or statistics
Strong programming skills in either Perl, Python, Java, C/C++, SQL
Speech recognition knowledge, understanding of speech recognition algorithms
Familiarity with IVR and ASR platforms and APIs
Experience with pattern recognition, machine learning, linguistics, or signal processing knowledge
Knowledge of statistical data analysis
Experience with XML, VoiceXML, and Wiki
Ability to speak Spanish, Mandarin, and other foreign languages preferred
Education: College Grad (BA, BS, or MS); in one-of : Engineering, Comp Sci, Linguistics, or similar field

4 semaines de vacances
10 congés de maladies payés
Régime de bonus annuel, REER collectif, Régimes de participation différée aux bénéfices (RPDB), Régime de rachat d’action pour les employés

Canada's Top 100 Employers – pour 7 années consécutives

job_title: Spécialistes Apprentissage Automatique / Machine Learning Specialists - Data Scientists, Montreal
job_description:
Date: Jan 10, 2019
****ENGLISH JOB DESCRIPTION TO FOLLOW***
Présentation d’Ericsson :
Ericsson est le premier fournisseur mondial de technologies et de services de communication. Nos proposons des services, des conseils, des logiciels et des infrastructures dans le domaine des technologies de l'information et de la communication.
Faisant appel à l'innovation afin d'autonomiser les gens, les entreprises et la société, Ericsson vise une Société connectée : un monde connecté en temps réel qui sera source d'opportunités de liberté, d'évolution de la société tout en apportant des solutions à certains des plus grands défis auxquels doit faire face notre planète.
Nous sommes une entreprise véritablement d'échelle mondiale, traversant les frontières pour toucher plus de 180 pays, offrant une culture diversifiée, axée sur les résultats et un environnement inédit et passionnant. En tant qu'employé d'Ericsson, vous pourrez voir « grand » et recevrez le soutien nécessaire pour que vos idées deviennent réalité. Une formation continue et des opportunités de croissance, vous permettent d'acquérir les connaissances et les compétences nécessaires pour progresser et atteindre vos objectifs de carrière. Nous vous invitons à vous joindre à notre équipe.
L'opportunité passionnante que nous proposons :
Il sera pratiquement impossible pour l'Homme de savoir comment exploiter et optimiser la prochaine génération de réseaux sans fil, à savoir le réseau 5G sous la forme Edge Computing réparti, qui stimulera l'évolution économique et sociale dans tous les aspects de la société. Les technologies d'apprentissage automatique (ML) et autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence artificielle (IA) seront essentielles dans le cadre de cette opportunité. Nous mettons en place un Global AI Accelerator au Canada, aux États-Unis, en Suède et en Inde, grâce à 300 experts, afin que notre stratégie soit plus rapidement exécutée.
L'Intelligence automatisée (MI), la combinaison de l'apprentissage automatique (ML) et d'autres technologies liées à l'Intelligence Artificielle (AI), est ce à quoi Ericsson fait appel pour stimuler une gestion réfléchie, visant à automatiser et à faire évoluer les activités ainsi que les produits et services proposés par Ericsson. La MI est également un moyen capital permettant de voir surgir de nouvelles entreprises. Notamment la création de modèles, de cadres et d'infrastructures, dans le cadre desquels nous repoussons les frontières de la technologie au fur et à mesure de notre évolution. Nous nous engageons dans des collaborations académiques et industrielles, et stimulons la numérisation d'Ericsson et l'industrie en trouvant les meilleurs solutions permettant de simplifier et d'automatiser les procédés utilisés dans nos produits et services, et créons quelle que chose de nouveau et d'utile grâce aux informations procurées par les données.
Ericsson est maintenant à la recherche de Scientifiques expérimentes et seniors en traitement des données (Data Scientists) afin de renforcer considérablement son équipe mondiale, pour que l'AI soit plus rapide dans son évolution.
Connaissez-vous parfaitement les technologies ML et AI ?
Voulez-vous appliquer et faire évoluer ces compétences en résolvant des problèmes complexes touchant fortement la société : aller au-delà de ML / AI dans le domaine de la consommation et de la publicité ?
Vous souhaitez donc faire partie de l'équipe mondiale de Scientifiques en traitement des données (Data Scientist) d'Ericsson, repoussant les frontières technologiques afin d'automatiser, de simplifier et de valoriser grâce à des données volumineuses et complexes.
Récapitulatif des fonctions:
En tant que Spécialiste Apprentissage Automatique-Scientifique en traitement des données (Data Scientist), vous devez très bien connaitre la programmation, la Science des données et les outils utilisés en apprentissage automatique (ML). Vous utiliserez vos connaissances et / ou votre expérience en méthodologies de la Science des données pour les appliquer, dans le but de résoudre des problèmes concrets dans le cadre d'une équipe dynamique et mondiale. Vous travaillerez dans un environnement hautement collaboratif, où vous communiquerez et planifierez des tâches et des idées. Vous travaillerez sur des initiatives à fort impact avec d'autres DS dans le domaine de l'intelligence automatisée, pour stimuler la croissance et la rentabilité économique d'Ericsson et de ses clients, en faisant en sorte que ce que propose actuellement Ericsson sorte plus rapidement. Votre contribuerez également à créer de nouveaux produits dans les domaines des réseaux 4G et 5G stimulés par MI, du cloud répartir, de l'Internet des objets et d'autres nouvelles activités .
Vos fonctions et responsabilités:
Entreprendre des analyses fonctionnelles et technologiques au sein d'une entreprise d'Ericsson et de certains clients clés, afin de découvrir les besoins et les opportunités professionnelles liés à la MI.
Contribuer à la découverte rapide et itérative d'une solution viable et confirmée répondant à ces besoins. Notamment travailler avec des pétaoctets de réseaux 4G/5G, IoT et données exogènes, proposer / sélectionner / tester des modèles prédictifs, moteurs de recommandation, systèmes de détection d'anomalies, modèle statistique, apprentissage approfondi, apprentissage par renforcement et autres systèmes d'apprentissage automatique
Entreprendre des études et découvrir une utilisation créative de nouvelles et existantes sources de données. Travailler auprès d'Architectes de données pour tirer parti des modèles de données existants, et en créer de nouveaux en fonction des besoins.
Collaborer avec les équipes de développement de produits et les partenaires des entreprises d'Ericsson, à industrialiser des modèles et des produits d'apprentissage automatique dans ce que propose Ericsson, notamment en fournissant des codes sources, des documents et en établissant le déroulement des travaux
Travailler avec de nouvelles technologies et les appuyer au sein des communautés MI d'Ericsson.
Aider à accumuler les compétences en MI dans les entreprises Ericsson et au sein des services des clients
Aider à créer de nouveaux concepts, de nouvelles méthodes et technologies consacrés aux initiatives plurifonctionnelles, tout en les appliquant et en améliorant ceux existants
Établir des relations avec les communautés externe (universités, leaders technologiques, logiciels publics - open source -, etc.) afin de faire évoluer le portefeuille de compétences et de technologies contribuant aux besoins de la MI.
Pour être le candidat idéal, vous devez avoir acquis :
Master ou doctorat en génie électrique, informatique, intelligence artificielle, apprentissage automatique, physique ou dans un domaine apparenté
Expérience : Plus de 2 années d'expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de l’apprentissage automatique ou en Science des données.
Expérience éprouvée dans la rédaction de logiciels de production
Grande expérience en développement de modèles et en gestion du cycle de vie dans un ou plusieurs domaines de l'industrie / d'application
Très bonnes compétences en programmation en différents langages (C++, Scala, Java, R) et compétences en Python et / ou en C++
Compétences éprouvées de l'apprentissage automatique, par exemple : analyse discriminante par régression linéaire / logistique, bagging, forêts aléatoires, réseau bayésien, SVM, réseaux de neurones artificiels, etc.
Solides compétences en utilisation de cadres d'apprentissage automatique à la fine pointe de la technologie, notamment Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow et Spark, etc.
Aptitude avérée à utiliser de nouveaux algorithmes et méthodologies à partir d'initiatives publiques de premier plan, et d'articles de recherche abordant leurs fonctionnalités, leur faculté d'évoluer et leur viabilité générale en matière d'industrialisation
Expérience en technologies Big Data notamment Hadoop, Cassandra, etc.
Bonnes connaissances des statistiques, par exemple : analyse descriptive et analyse supervisée et non supervisée
Vous pouvez avoir :
Un MI MOOCS en cours est un « plus »
Des connaissances en applications / domaines en télécommunication et / ou IoT, sont un « plus ».
Capacité d'établir et d'encadrer des communautés internes et externes
De l'expérience en visualisation des données et en création de tableaux de bord est un « plus »
Capacité à travailler de façon autonome avec beaucoup d'énergie, d'enthousiasme et de persévérance
Bonnes aptitudes à communiquer en anglais, tant à l'écrit qu'à l'oral
Expérience en rédaction et en présentation de livres blancs, articles de revues et blogs techniques portant sur les résultats
Capable de travailler au sein d'un environnement en collaboration, à savoir capable de travailler avec plusieurs services commerciaux complexes de parties prenantes, des clients dans le monde, des partenaires technologiques et autres au sein d'une organisation mondiale et pluriculturelle, le tout avec délicatesse et persistance
IN ENGLISH
Ericsson Overview:
Ericsson is world’s leading provider of communications technology and services. Our offerings include services, consulting, software and infrastructure within Information and Communications Technology.
Using innovation to empower people, business and society, Ericsson is working towards the Networked Society: a world connected in real time that will open up opportunities to create freedom, transform society and drive solutions to some of our planet’s greatest challenges.
We are truly a global company, operating across borders in over 180 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture and an innovative and engaging environment. As an Ericsson employee, you will have freedom to think big and the support to turn ideas into achievements. Continuous learning and growth opportunities allow you to acquire the knowledge and skills necessary to progress and reach your career goals. We invite you to join our team.
Our Exciting Opportunity:
It will be practically impossible for human brains to understand how to run and optimize next generation of wireless networks, i.e., 5G network with distributed edge compute, that will drive economic and social transformation for all aspects of society. Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies will be vital for us to handle this opportunity. We are setting up a Global AI Accelerator in Canada, the US, Sweden and India, with 300 experts, to fast-track our strategy execution.
Machine Intelligence, the combination of Machine Learning (ML) and other Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies is what Ericsson uses to drive thought leadership to automate and transform Ericsson offerings and operations. MI is also a key competence for to enable new and emerging business. This includes development of models, frameworks and infrastructure where we in our advancements push the technology frontiers. We engage in both academic and industry collaborations and drive the digitalization of Ericsson and the Industry by developing state of the art solutions that simplify and automate processes in our products and services and build new value through data insights.
Ericsson is now looking for Experienced and Senior Data Scientists to significantly expand its global team for AI acceleration.
Do you have in depth understanding of ML and AI technologies?
Do you want to apply and extend those skills to solve real complex problems with high societal impact; going beyond ML/AI for consumption and advertising?
Then, you do want to join Ericsson’s global team of Data Scientists pushing the technology frontiers to automate, simplify and add new value through large and complex data?
Role Summary:
As a Machine Learning Specialist - Data Scientist, you will need to have strong programming skills and strong understanding of data science and Machine Learning tools. You will use your knowledge and/or experience in Data Science methodologies apply them to solve challenging real-world problems as part of a highly dynamic and global team. You will work in a highly collaborative environment where you communicate and plan tasks and ideas. You will be working on high impact initiatives with other DS in Machine Intelligence to drive growth and economic profitability for Ericsson and its customers by accelerating current Ericsson offerings. Your contribution will also help to create new offerings in the areas of MI driven 4G and 5G network, distributed cloud, IoT and other emerging businesses.
Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Conduct functional and technical analysis within Ericsson organization and strategic customers to understand MI-driven business needs and opportunities
Contribute to rapid and iterative development of validated minimum viable solution addressing these needs. This includes working with petabytes of 4G/5G-networks, IoT and exogenous data, and proposing/selecting/testing predictive models, recommendation engines, anomaly detection systems, statistical model, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other machine learning systems
Conduct studies and find creative usage of new and/or existing data sources. Work with Data Architects to leverage existing data models and build new ones, as needed.
Collaborate with product development teams and partners in Ericsson Businesses to industrialize machine learning models and solutions as part of Ericsson offerings including providing source code, workflows and documents
Work with new technologies and champion them in MI Communities within Ericsson.
Assist MI Competence build-up in Ericsson Businesses and Customer Serving Units
Help to develop new and apply/extend existing, concepts, methodologies, techniques for cross functional initiatives
Engage with external ecosystem (academia, technology leaders, open source etc.) to develop the skills and technology portfolio for MI’s needs
To be successful; one should have:
MS, or PhD in Electrical Engineer, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Physics, or related field
Applied experience: 2+ years of Machine Learning experience in data science.
Proven experience writing production-grade software
Extensive experience in model development and life-cycle-management in one or more industry/application domain
Strong Programming skills in various languages (C++, Scala, Java, R) with proficiency in Python and/or C++
Proven skills in Machine Learning, e.g., linear/logistics regression discriminant analysis, bagging, random forest, Bayesian model, SVM, neural networks, etc.
Strong skills in the use of current state of the art machine learning frameworks such as Scikit-Learn, H2O, Keras, TensorFlow and Spark, etc.
Demonstrated ability to implement new algorithms and methodologies from leading open source initiatives and research papers addressing their functionalities, scalability and overall industrialization viability
Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Cassandra etc
Strong knowledge in Statistics, e.g., descriptive analysis and supervised and unsupervised analysis
You may have:
Certifying MI MOOCS, a plus
Applications/Domain-knowledge in Telecommunication and/or IoT, a plus.
Ability to build and nurture internal and external communities
Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation is a plus
Ability to work independently with high energy, enthusiasm and persistence
Good communication skills in written and spoken English
Experience in writing and presenting white papers, journal articles and technical blogs on the results
Ability to work in a collaborative environment, i.e., working with complex multiple stakeholder business units, global customers, technology and other ecosystem partners in a multi-culture, global matrix organization with sensitivity and persistence

job_description:
The Role:
BuzzFeed is looking for a dynamic, motivated, digital sales person with a passion for social content-driven advertising. You'll introduce our social advertising products to brands and agencies, and collaborate with our product and account service teams to see to it that the programs are implemented to maximum long-term client satisfaction. You should have a previous experience and an entrepreneurial leaning that will allow you to quickly get up to speed on our products and begin generating revenue.

You Will:

Introduce our products to brands and agencies through meetings, speaking opportunities, and written materials
Reach and exceed individual sales goals while contributing to overall team goals
Prospect, penetrate and create new relationships with advertising agencies and clients
Develop relationships at all levels from CMO to Brand Managers to Agency Buyers
Provide feedback to our product and business teams about the needs and successes in the market
Collaborate with our Canada editorial teams to introduce sponsorship opportunities around new editorial launches
Identify and understand trends within social media
Strong focus on being able to analyze data and use it to grow the business

You Have:

4+ years of previous digital sales experience
Experience at a leading publisher or social media platform
Strong track record of success driving revenue through discovering, prospecting, creating new business and growing and retaining existing business
Strong writing skills
Strong negotiation, influencing skills and an ability to persuade at all levels of an agency or client
An entrepreneurial spirit
An understanding of social ad products like Facebook Sponsored Stories and Promoted Tweets
Passionate about social advertising and new media
Demonstrable knowledge of the online advertising industry
Ability to work in a fast moving company and industry
Skilled in crafting presentations and written pitch materials a plus

About BuzzFeed

BuzzFeed is the leading independent digital media and tech company delivering news and entertainment content to a global audience. We have offices in 19 cities around the world and more than 1600 employees including reporters, video producers, data scientists, engineers, brand strategists, and more. We fuse hard work and fun, through a culture of experimentation, teamwork, equality, and humble confidence. As an employee, you'll enjoy perks like office events, snacks, career development courses, and no work on your birthday! But most importantly, you'll work with inspiring colleagues to build tools and create content that helps connect people all over the world.

3+ Years' experience building scalable front-end infrastructure software or distributed systems for commercial online services.
Track record delivering front-end software that is correct, stable, high performance, secure, and accessibility compliant.
Skilled in developing rich applications with HTML, CSS, JS, Node
Proficiency in developing front-end software, with deep experience in one or more relevant front-end frameworks (React, Angular, Thyme Leaf etc.),UI Test Automation frameworks, MVC frameworks, Struts or Spring desired.
Proficient in a broad range of software design approaches and common UX patterns. Knows when (and when not) to use front-end software design patterns (e.g., asynchronicity, data binding14, modules, MV*15, objects, promises).
Able to dive into the source code of front-end libraries to debug, patch, and extend them when necessary
Proficient in view layout and rendering technologies (e.g., responsiveness, progressive enhancement, browser/device support). Knows when it is appropriate to make graceful fallbacks.
Knowledge of engineering and operational excellence best practices.
Understands how to optimize the delivery of code and assets (e.g., images, fonts) to a browser (e.g., lazy loading assets, using CDNs, caching, compression, etc.).
Understands how to be efficient with resource usage (e.g., application impact on memory and CPU, caches appropriately, respectful of customer’s devices, etc.).
Knows how to instrument software with real user metrics to reflect the customer experience

As a member of the Demand Forecasting team, you'll play a key role in solving some of the world's most complex technical challenges associated with Forecasting. You should love solving hard problems, and strive to innovate and simplify. Join our team of top-notch software engineers, who work hard, have fun, and make history.
Does designing and delivering high performance, highly available and extremely scalable front end applications in a very complex and exciting environment inspire and motivate you? Amazon's Forecasting group is searching for a Front End Engineer to join our team. We are pioneers and innovators in the fields of demand analysis and forecasting insight, and are looking for the right Front End Engineer to shape the UX vision for customers of those insights. If you want to learn how to leverage technology to predict the future, this is the team for you.

As a Front End Engineer, you will be given the opportunity to work closely with a talented team of software engineers, product managers, data scientists, and data engineers to deliver new features to Forecasting customers. You will design complex front end systems to solve problems, improving the team's internal processes for front end development, testing, code deployments and operations. As a technical leader, you will be expected to drive your team's design discussions around web security (i.e. XSS, CSRF), choice of web technologies and to design elegant, responsive, fail-safe user interfaces alongside scalable, maintainable systems to support these web applications.

In our team you will have the opportunity to:

Build fascinating new web services and products
Work directly with your customers and shape the vision of the web stack
Create and drive metrics to measure complexity
Brainstorm, prototype, test, and iterate on new ideas
Work with the latest technologies and tools
Learn from others and help grow those in your team
See the positive impact of your work on real customers
Thrive in a start-up, innovative environment
Brainstorm, design, and implement front end components and user experience for Forecasting Customers

If you have a passion for driving quality, improving customer experience and designing front end systems that are secure, reactive and maintainable, we'd love to talk to you!

TemporaryUniversity Health Network (UHN) is looking for an experienced professional to fill the key role of Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Multi Organ Transplant Program located in Toronto General Hospital Research Institute, Toronto, Canada.

Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning.

The University Health Network, where “above all else the needs of patients come first”, encompasses Toronto Rehabilitation Institute, Toronto General Hospital, Toronto Western Hospital, Princess Margaret Cancer Centre and the Michener Institute of Education at UHN. The breadth of research, the complexity of the cases treated, and the magnitude of its educational enterprise has made UHN a national and international resource for patient care, research and education. With a long tradition of groundbreaking firsts and a purpose of “Transforming lives and communities through excellence in care, discovery and learning”, the University Health Network (UHN), Canada’s largest research teaching hospital, brings together over 16,000 employees, more than 1,200 physicians, 8,000+ students, and many volunteers. UHN is a caring, creative place where amazing people are amazing the world.
University Health Network (UHN) is a research hospital affiliated with the University of Toronto and a member of the Toronto Academic Health Science Network. The scope of research and complexity of cases at UHN have made it a national and international source for discovery, education and patient care. Research across UHN's five research institutes spans the full spectrum of diseases and disciplines, including cancer, cardiovascular sciences, transplantation, neural and sensory sciences, musculoskeletal health, rehabilitation sciences, and community and population health. Find out about our purpose, values and principles here.
A Hepatologist and Clinician-Scientist at UHN's Multi Organ Transplant Program at the Toronto General Research Institute is seeking a Postdoctoral Fellow. The research program employs a bench-to-bedside paradigm that connects clinical outcomes with basic research using tools from systems biology, including bioinformatic analysis of ‘omic datasets (e.g., transcriptomic, miRNA, methylation, intestinal microbiome) from patient samples, followed by in vitro and in vivo validation. Specific topics of interest are Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC), Non-Alcoholic Steatohepatitis (NASH) and liver regeneration in the setting of liver transplantation. This is a unique opportunity to perform independent projects within a translational program, and significant potential for research productivity.
Responsibilities
Guide and perform wet lab experiments and data analysisDesign and guide animal studies for validation purposesWriting grant proposals and peer reviewed papersAnalysis and review of previous data obtained in the lab pertinent to the projects
Requirements
Ph.D. degree with extensive wet lab experienceExcellent knowledge and experience in molecular biology and basic science techniquesPrevious experience in animal studies is not mandatory but is preferableBasic knowledge in bioinformatics tools and analysisExcellent communication skills (verbal and written) and ability to work effectively independently and as a team memberMust be highly motivated and creative

GenomeDx Biosciences is a dynamic entrepreneurial molecular diagnostics company focused on cancer genomics. Whether in the cloud with big data, or on the phone with patients, our innovators are working hard to deliver usable genomic information into the hands of physicians and patients: information for life.
Our team is constantly learning from each other, from patients and from urologic oncology professionals in world-renowned cancer institutions. Our team works in multi-disciplinary, collaborative project teams that enable us to respond effectively to an evolving, growing, data-driven environment.
We are currently seeking a dynamic Bioinformatician to join our team in Vancouver.
**Accepting co-op or intern applications**
GDx Innovator
The GenomeDx Data Science and Engineering team is a passionate group of scientists and software engineers striving to use the best science and engineering knowledge to develop data pipelines and software that make genomic data actionable to cancer patients and their doctors. We develop and deploy machine learning models based whole transcriptome gene expression data to reveal new insights in cancer biology. We also develop software/apps that facilitates better data visualization and interpretation for colleagues, physicians, and patients.
As a Bioinformatician, you will work closely with a team of technical and production professionals. You will be a key member in analyzing genomic and clinical data, developing genomic models using machine learning, and providing analysis support to our colleagues and external collaborators. You will also be part of our data-related software design, development, and maintenance. This role requires a broad knowledge of bioinformatics, statistics, and programming, paired with effective communication skills, a strong sense of diligence, and timeliness.
What you are great at doing:
Maintaining our Decipher data/bioinformatics pipeline (normalization, signature calculation, and post processing).
Applying machine learning approaches to develop signatures and models using genomic data.
Performing gene and transcript expression quantification and differential expression analysis of large patient cohorts.
Performing bioinformatic analyses to interpret and visualize genomic datasets (heatmap, KM, etc).
Understanding and providing bioinformatics support for clinical/analytical validation of genomic models and signatures.
Automating and streamlining analysis code in simplified functions/applications.
Obtaining and processing external genomic and clinical data (GEO).
Annotating genomic data with the latest genome builds.
Contributing to manuscript drafting for peer-reviewed journals.
What you need to be successful:
Bachelor’s degree from a quantitative field with strong programming experience (bioinformatics, data science, statistics, applied math, computer science, EE). Graduate degree is a plus.
Work experience in bioinformatics a plus.
What you will bring to the team:
Experience working with source control tools (Git) in a collaborative programming environment.
Experience working with R, especially Bioconductor packages. Experience building and testing customized R packages.
Skilled at SQL.
Skilled at Linux environment operations (bash/shell) and work with remote servers via command line.
Experience with Cloud computation platform (GCP and AWS) is a plus.
Working knowledge of genomic databases (Ensembl, UCSC etc.)
Familiarity with cancer biology and genomics.
Curiosity and eagerness to learn.

Job Description

We are currently looking for a Data Engineer.
In this role, you will work in a client project environment with an AI-Agile Team composed of a Product Manager, consultant, Delivery Team Lead and Data Scientist and contribute to the translation of complex AI/data science algorithms into scalable software. Core duties are:
Design, code, create tests, and integrate new features and functionality
Design, build, and productize complex data pipelines
Learn the different AI/data science components/models in order for the algorithm to be properly translated in production code
Participate in scrum project meetings and update stories using project management tools
Apply CI/CD practices to prevent integration problems as well as ensure that the code is releasable at any point in time
Participate in the estimation of the Stories based on defined Acceptance Criteria and Definition of Done
Some of the technologies we are using and are looking for:
Cloud: AWS, Azure or GCP
Languages:Python, Java, C++, SCALA and Javascript (nice to have)
Big Data:Hadoop, Spark, Hive
Relational Database:MySql, postgres SQL, Oracle, MS-SQL
NoSql: Cassandra, Elastic search, Mongo DB

Qualifications


You have 3+ year experience in building B2B solutions in a cloud environment (must have)
You have experience with Operations Research / Machine Learning / Deep Learning (asset)
