One or more AWS certifications (AWS Certified Solutions Architect, AWS Certified SysOps Administrator, AWS Certified Developer) is preferred!
Experience integrating, testing, and releasing automation and monitoring DevOps solutions in AWS
Competency with scripting tools and their application to monitoring and troubleshooting
Familiarity with or exposure to Nagios or equivalent network monitoring tools
Understanding of networking concepts (DNS, TCP/IP, UDP, etc)
Knowledge in network security technologies and tools including IPSEC, OpenVPN, SSL, NAT, Firewall, HIDS/NIDS

job_title: Professional Services Consultant III - Learning & Development - Heavy Equipment
job_description:
CasualAccélérez votre carrière
Technologies globales Drive
Avec des revenus de plus de 2 milliards de dollars, CDK Global est un chef de file mondial en approvisionnement de solutions intégrées de technologies de l’information et de marketing numérique à l’intention des détaillants automobiles et des secteurs connexes. Axée sur la réussite du commerce automobile de bout en bout, CDK fournit des solutions à des concessionnaires situés dans plus de 100 pays à travers le monde, servant approximativement 28 000 détaillants et la plupart des fabricants automobiles. Les solutions CDK Global automatisent et intègrent les processus critiques depuis la publicité numérique prévente ciblée, jusqu’à la vente, le financement, les assurances, l’approvisionnement en pièces, les réparations et l’entretien des véhicules, avec une orientation accrue vers l’utilisation de l’analyse de données et de l’intelligence prédictive.
Nous sommes assez importants pour faire une différence, mais assez modestes pour que votre voix soit entendue. En bref, nous sommes un organisme au sein duquel chacun importe. Il vous est possible d’exercer une influence sur la réussite de notre entreprise ainsi que sur celles de nos clients, peu importe la carrière que vous choisissez de poursuivre.
Accelerate Your Career
Drive global technology
With more than $2 billion in revenues, CDK Global is a leading global provider of integrated information technology and digital marketing solutions to the automotive retail and adjacent industries. Focused on enabling end-to-end automotive commerce, CDK provides solutions to dealers in more than 100 countries around the world, serving approximately 28,000 retail locations and most automotive manufacturers. CDK Global solutions automate and integrate critical processes from pre-sale targeted advertising to the sale, financing, insurance, parts supply, repair and maintenance of vehicles, with an increasing focus on utilizing data analytics and predictive intelligence.
We’re large enough to make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. This means that we are an organization where every person matters. You can make an impact on the success of our business and that of our customers regardless of what career you decide to pursue.
From data scientists to sales and client service experts, we’re hiring to support your growth and ours - Green light your career.
CDK Global is seeking a Professional Services Consultant with a background in learning & development!
Position Overview:
. Research, write, edit, and produce training materials for classroom and/or online self-paced delivery.
. Possess a developing knowledge of CDK Heavy Equipment products, process and/or skill sets.
. Further your understanding and learning of dealership operations and our Industry.
. Have a strong understanding of how to use the software used for learning design and development, and our CDK development standards.
. Position equally requires ability to administer schedule and maintain rotation of offerings.
What to expect in this role:
. You can expect to participate in meetings, conduct research and conduct interviews to understand audience needs.
. You will spend a good amount of time acquiring information and planning for instructional deliverables.
. You will share your work with subject matter experts, business stakeholders and peers for regular review and feedback.
. You will collaborate with other team members including Project Managers, Program Managers, Professional Services Consultants, Product Owners, and business leaders to complete deliverables.
. You will work in an agile environment, which requires you to participate in rapid development and adapt to shifting priorities.
Requirements:
. BA/BS in Education or a related field preferred
. 2-5 years’ experience in learning, development and/or training
. Training and product experience with CDK Heavy Equipment preferred
. Experience developing course curriculum and researching training content
. Ability to present in front of groups and demonstrate subject matter expertise
. Must be able to travel 15% (United States, Canada)
CDK Global sait que des passions vous animent en dehors du travail. La famille, les amis, les événements sportifs et des tas d’autres choses occupent votre vie. C’est pourquoi nous offrons un ensemble exhaustif d’avantages sociaux non seulement pour prendre soin de vous, mais aussi de votre famille. Tous les avantages offerts entrent en vigueur dès le premier jour de votre embauche et incluent un REER avec contribution équivalente, des congés payés pour vous remettre en forme ou faire don de votre temps au sein de votre communauté, et le remboursement de frais de scolarité, pour n’en énumérer que quelques-uns.
Chez CDK, nous nous enorgueillissons de la diversité de nos effectifs. Nous estimons et célébrons le caractère unique de chaque individu et les points de vue variés qu’ils apportent. Nous offrons des chances d’accès égales en matière d’emploi sans égard à la race, la couleur, la religion, le genre, l’identité ou l’expression du genre, l’orientation sexuelle, l’origine nationale, la génétique, l’état de handicap, l’âge, la situation matrimoniale, ou l’état de protection d’anciens combattants.
CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work. You have family, friends, sporting events, and lots of things going on. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to not only take care of you but your family as well. All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment including RRSP matching, paid time off to re-energize, donate your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement to name a few.
At CDK, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or veteran status. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Location: Montreal, QC, CA
Company: Corning
Corning is one of the world’s leading innovators in materials science. For more than 160 years, Corning has applied its unparalleled expertise in specialty glass, ceramics, and optical physics to develop products that have created new industries and transformed people’s lives.

Corning succeeds through sustained investment in R&D, a unique combination of material and process innovation, and close collaboration with customers to solve tough technology challenges.

Corning's Manufacturing, Technology and Engineering division (MTE) is recognized as the leader in engineering excellence & innovative manufacturing technologies by providing diverse skills to Corning’s existing & emerging businesses.

We anticipate & provide timely, valued, leading edge manufacturing technologies and engineering expertise. We partner with Corning’s businesses and the Science & Technology division. Together we create and sustain Corning’s manufacturing as a differential advantage.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
Subject Matter Expert participating in software engineering projects and HPC science projects to provide software development and modeling support to Corning technology community and to enable effective innovation, process and product development and competitive advantage of Corning products.
Day to day Responsibilities
Work independently or as part of the team on various aspects of research software engineering:
New Corning product prototypes;
Professional support of internal R,D, E&M tools;
Software development support of Corning products;
New Corning internal R, D & E information products.
Assist in identifying software development opportunities and converting them into projects as appropriate.
Write and maintain relevant support documentation.
Prepare and deliver relevant user training.
Participate in collaboration with Montreal universities and technology incubator firms.

REQUIRED SKILLS
BSc+ in computer science, mathematics, data science, physics, engineering or related discipline.
2+ years of software development, data science or modeling experiences, preferably, in scientific computing or HPC fields.
Strong programming skills in one or several mainstream languages such as C, Java., Python, C++, C#, or Fortran (C is highly desirable).
A foundation in software design principles and an ability to design and create code as necessary.
Background in or familiarity with one or more scientific disciplines (e.g. physics, chemistry, or engineering) and some knowledge of data science.
Ability to communicate with and understand the complex requirements of scientists, engineers and professional staff in the deployment of scientific computing solutions.
Working knowledge of Linux and Windows operating systems.
Ability to analyze, optimize and debug scientific code.

DESIRED SKILLS
Experience with agile development approaches, automated unit testing / test-first design.
Experience with revision control systems (e.g., Git).
Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., Python) and any other programming languages (e.g., HTML, Java Script, and PHP).
Familiarity with Microsoft Visual Studio (and .NET or WPF).
Knowledge of databases and SQL.
Working knowledge in data science and capability for independently preparing data (ETL functions of cleaning, consolidating, transforming data) for machine learning purposes.
Knowledge of mathematical and statistical computing programming languages (MATLAB, R).
Experience compiling and running codes on high-performance computers.
Knowledge of MPI, OpenMP, or other parallel/distributed computing paradigms.
Experience providing user support or code development support in scientific computing environment.
Experience working with cloud-based services such as AWS and Azure.
Knowledge of Android, iOS mobile platforms.
Familiarity with FPGA.
Leadership skills and ability to create positive work environment is a plus.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills and ability to work as a team player are required.
Proactive and solution-oriented problem solver.
Customer focused and committed to helping engineers & researchers and projects to be successful.
Ability to bridge gaps between “domain” language (engineering, science) and “computing solution” language.
Ability to undertake multi-projects.
Clear dedication to excellence and advancing beyond the current state.
Strong personal motivation.

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS Individual may travel multiple times per year for one to two weeks per visit to other Corning locations or customers (domestic and international) or to pursue training opportunities (conferences, classes).
LOCATION Montréal (Ville St-Laurent), Québec
TYPE Permanent, Full time

job_title: Local Privacy and Security Officer (LPSO) ICES UOttawa | Privacy Officer mHealth
job_description:
$30.30 an hourWe are seeking a dynamic and innovative privacy professional to join our team as the site Local Privacy and Security Officer (LPSO) for the Institute for Clinical Evaluative Sciences (ICES) uOttawa under the direction of the Local Site Director and the ICES Central Chief Privacy Officer and as the Privacy Officer for the mHealth research team. This is a full-time position, located primarily at the Civic Campus of The Ottawa Hospital.
LPSO (.9 FTE)
The LPSO will support the ICES uOttawa team in the day-to-day maintenance and operation of a secure, compliant, and effective facility. The incumbent will be responsible for the maintenance of, and adherence to, all ICES privacy and security policies and procedures.

Key Duties & Responsibilities:
The successful candidate will be responsible for the day-to-day- implementation, monitoring, and enforcement of privacy and security policies and procedures for the Facility:
Provide an ongoing presence at the facility to help ensure its physical security.
Act as the primary contact between ICES Central Privacy and Compliance Office, and the ICES uOttawa facility.
Ensure privacy and security policies and procedures are implemented at the local facility, in collaboration with the ICES Central Chief Privacy and Compliance Office.
Receive, review and coordinate approval process for Privacy Impact Assessments (PIA) forms, Project Activations Worksheets (PAW) and proposals for each project that is planned for ICES uOttawa.
Review new projects for adherence to privacy policies and REB status (approval and reporting requirements) prior to submission for review to ICES Central Program Offices.
Monitor and enforce organizational compliance with all data security and privacy protections.
Develop and deliver privacy and security training programs specific to the ICES Central Chief Privacy and Compliance Office, approved policies, practices and procedures and to the ICESuOttawa Facility policies.
Ensure that all ICES uOttawa Facility personnel, adjunct, visiting and affiliated scientists, and students are familiarized and comply with ICES privacy and security policies and procedures.
Work with stakeholders to ensure privacy policies and procedures are being met; assess and audit assigned work to ensure adherence.
Maintain logs and inventories as defined in ICES uOttawa policies and procedures for compliance and accuracy.
Gather necessary information to facilitate privacy and security audits and investigations of privacy and security incidents.
Escalate complex privacy and security processes and issues to the Privacy and Compliance office in accordance with ICES policies and procedures.
Manage various ICES uOttawa committees, including preparing agenda, slides, meeting materials and taking minutes for various ICES uOttawa meetings.
Act as member of various committees as privacy subject matter expert.
Produce activity reports for all privacy/security related matters at the ICES uOttawa Facility as required for ICES Central, formal reports for IPC, TOH REB and MOHLTC as requested.
Liaise with the Change Advisory Board (CAB) and assist in the implementation of the ICES Change Management Policy.
Provide necessary information for and assist with processing of financial transactions.
Act as the facility contact for other OHRI/TOH departments (physical plant services and IT), staff, students, and outside organizations/agencies (including ICES Central, contractors).
Coordinate local project and grant review processes, including from intake to final approval.
Intake and onboarding of students and faculty and maintain student log.
Oversight of facility and equipment to ensure efficient and effective operations:
Responsible for ensuring compliance to ICES policies, and local administrative procedures related to business continuity and emergencies and associated escalations and notifications.Assist with preparation of annual reports for submission to partner organizations.
Prepare and submit HR paperwork and assist with new staff onboarding as required.
Assist the OHRI Contracts Team:
to identify and assess privacy risk exposure arising out of the conduct of specific clinical research projects, with a view to ensuring the protection of OHRI, its research community and research participants;
by refining, as required, the risk-based framework used to identify the need for a privacy or data-sharing agreement for a particular research project; and,
to draft, review and negotiate data-sharing agreements, as requested/required.

Other administrative duties as assigned by the Site Director and Facility Administrator.
Privacy Officer mHealth Research Team (.1 FTE)
CANImmunizeis a free, bilingual mobile app that helps Canadians across the country keep their immunization information at their fingertips. The app allows people to securely store and manage their families’ vaccination records, provides appointment reminders and vaccination schedules by home province or territory as well as reliable information about vaccination requirements for children, adults and travellers.
Given the sensitivity of the data to be stored, rigorous assessment of the security of the platform and the impacts of the platform on the privacy of its users will be completed and submitted to the IOPC for review.
Key Duties & Responsibilities (until March 31, 2019):
The Privacy Officer as the public face of the mHealth Research Team will:
Provide ongoing privacy support to the team
Address privacy inquiries/complaints from users, and ensure accurate tracking and management of issues
Ensure that privacy policies and safeguards are being applied and enforced
Required Qualifications (Education/Experience):
University degree combined with several years of privacy related experience in a research or academic setting.
Law degree and/or Certified Information Privacy Professional /Canada (CIPP/C) is preferred but not required.
Knowledge and demonstrated ability applying the principles of health information and project management (handling of sensitive personal health information and research ethics and release of information processes).
Excellent organizational skills.
Knowledge of federal and provincial privacy legislation.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Ability to deal with deadlines and set priorities.
Ability to work independently or as part of a team.
Preferred Qualifications:
Bilingualism would be considered an asset
Compensation:
Salary range for this position is $30.301hr (min) to $43.691/hr (max)
Commensurate with skills and experience of the successful candidate.

Please send a complete CV:

Kim Adams
Director, Research Administration and Human Resources
Ottawa Hospital Research Institute
Address: The Ottawa Hospital, Loeb Building, 725 Parkdale Ave, Ottawa, Ontario K1Y 4E9
Email: kadams@ohri.ca
Fax: 613-761-4920

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those invited for an interview will be contacted. The Ottawa Hospital Research Institute is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, accommodations due to a disability are available throughout the selection process.

Positive outlook with a ability to work in a fast paced environment

Ciena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted (the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show) are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. But those companies rely on Ciena, another vanguard of innovation, to create and advance the underlying networks that bring their breakthroughs to our doorsteps. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.

What will you do at Ciena?

You will join the growing Blue Planet Analytics team based in Montreal and Ottawa (Canada). Our team is developing an adaptive network driven by Artificial Intelligence that will disrupt the telecommunications industry.
We want to hire professionals who aspire to work on world-class challenges. We will consider junior and senior candidates with skills in data science, software engineering and/or telecommunications. Since we are inventing new products that have never been made before, we are looking for individuals who can learn about new technologies continuously and solve hard problems with minimal guidance.

Responsibilities

Develop intelligent data-driven applications for telecommunications use-cases
Develop core components of Ciena’s Big Data and Fast Data platform

General Activities

Write software, together with unit tests and integration tests
Integrate components from open source projects with our home-grown code base
Participate in Agile Scrum meetings
Celebrate accomplishments!

Collaboration with stakeholders

Daily collaboration with software designers, testers and data scientists
Co-supervision of co-op students and research students from universities
Occasional interactions with management and customers

Areas of impact

Product engineering
Science, research & intellectual property

Experience

Scala, Java or Python programming (other languages an asset)
Object-oriented, functional, distributed programming. Algorithmic complexity, scalability.
Apache Hadoop, Spark and NiFi ecosystem
DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes) and cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure)
Familiarity with telecommunications networks is an asset
Familiarity with data science is an asset



LI-CN


Rewarding experience. Meaningful outcomes.
Making a difference in people's lives through design and implementation of leading network technologies. That's what motivates us.

A distinct way to work
Free thinking, free discussion, and collaboration are the norm. Expect more satisfying outcomes - both personal and professional.

Ciena values the diversity of our workforce and respects its employees as individuals, regardless of race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender or age.
Ciena is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise Ciena in a timely fashion of the specific needs / accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to any specific needs / accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

What you can expect from us
You will receive notification of your successful application
Successful applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an initial discussion
If suitable you will be considered for the short list and our formal interview process

STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.

Job Description Summary
Business Analyst - Strategic Pricing is responsible for developing, recommending and implementing strategic and tactical pricing and discounting plans for all products and/or product groups globally. This position will also support the implementation of SAP ERP and will ensure a smooth transition of strategic pricing data from current ERP to a new SAP system.

Job Description

Duties and Responsibilities
Collaborate with Product Marketing Management, Research and Development, and Operations to develop and recommend gross margin targets for new and existing products
Conduct margin analysis, competitive analysis and develop pricing proposals.
Participate as a key member of the Global Pricing Meeting, ensuring accurate data preparation and analysis to support decision making
Execute pricing plans globally, create value communication and competitive positioning statements for use in direct sales training and tools
Manage pricing information for distributors and third party procurement sites
Collaborate with Global Sales on promotional programs that impact pricing
Collaborate with Finance to manage transfer pricing and fair market value pricing for royalty payments
Ensure third party distribution channel databases are accurate and consistent with current company price lists
Ensure SAP ERP pricing configuration and data meets the business needs of all the different product groups.
Manage Product Pricing and Price List generation from SAP for all the global territories and eProcurement customers

Qualifications
Must have minimum MSc in cell biology or other life sciences field.
MBA or other financial qualification/certification is a plus
Minimum 5 years relevant experience in an analytical role.
Proven business acumen and analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proven ability to communicate with and effectively coach non-financial colleagues.
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, requiring significant cross-functional coordination and teamwork.

This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

To apply please select the apply button. You will then be directed to a login screen asking you to set up an account. You must set up an account in order to apply.
Create an account by selecting the create account button. You will then be asked for your email and to create a password. Your Password must be eight characters long, contain at least one special character, one capital letter, and a number.Once you have created your password you will be asked to upload your resume. Uploading your resume will provide the ability to auto-populate your application with information from your resume. If you prefer to manually complete all of the fields in the application you can do this by clicking next. You can upload your cover letter as an attachment in the attachments screen. Thank you for your interest in STEMCELL!

Are you are someone who is passionate about creating solutions with massive impact, solving challenging problems, and working in unexplored areas, continuous improvement and Agile development?

The role of the Senior Machine Learning Engineer is a proven 'doer' who develops, implements and extends data-intensive machine learning software for finance applications. You will have the opportunity to become a leading expert at Prophix in delivering transformative machine learning solutions. You will design and implement core components of our algorithms, as well as model and monetize the large amounts of data that Prophix generates daily.

Working together with our Data Scientist and R&D teams, you will apply Machine Learning to help get things done. As part of a vibrant and growing team, you will be at the forefront of the AI revolution!
 Key Responsibilities:
Working with a team of data scientists, product managers, and software engineers to develop and support the software for new Machine Learning products.
Develop computer algorithms with a top-notch R&D development team.
Analyze and improve existing algorithms using by increasing efficiency, profiling, memory locality.
Explore and research new methods for future product development.
Be a key component in creating a product that is ensured to be the future of our marketplace.
What you will bring to Prophix:
3+ years hands-on industry work experience designing and building large-scale data, machine learning, and analytics applications and pipelines that are well-designed, cleanly coded, well-documented, operationally stable, and timely delivered.
5+ years total Machine Learning experience, including years of academic research
Experience with R, Python data analysis libraries (pandas, sklearn, numpy, scipy, and matplotlib), and Spark MLlib.
Experience with tensorflow or other backends, keras or other frameworks, scikit-learn, OpenCV, Pandas.
Proficiency with Spark, Hadoop, Kafka, Hive, and SQL.
Solid software engineering skills, with proficiency in Python and experience with Scala, Java, C/C++.
Knowledge of NEON/SSE and vector processing.
Knowledge of GPU programming (e.g.GLSL).
Enjoy working in a self-organizing team environment.
Think bigger and further than the solution appears to require.
Excellent analytical, conceptual and communications skills in spoken and written English.
Fast learner, high capacity for abstract thinking and structured approach to work.
The will to learn new things and bring in new ideas to fruition.
MS / D. in Computer Science or related field.
What People Say About Prophix
About working with Prophix…“As a customer, you can tell how an organization is run by how its employees behave. --------------------------------------------------------------
Principal Deep Learning Natural Language Generation Researcher
--------------------------------------------------------------

Overview
--------

The new MarketMuse Montréal Machine Monograph Lab (M4 Lab) is seeking a Research Scientist to help create the next generations of Natural Language Generation technologies. This is an applied research position where the researcher will work on generative deep learning models oriented to create context-aware draft content conditioned on existing semistructured data, for use in our clients' content marketing. This role requires deep understanding of deep learning, information theory, computational linguistics, and hands-on experience with a modern deep neural training framework such as Tensorflow or PyTorch.

About Us
--------

Marketmuse Inc. is a rapidly growing institutionally-backed content planning technology firm with offices in Montreal, Boston, and New York City. We are the premier provider of enterprise content planning technologies and are recognized as a leading technology for content marketing functions. MarketMuse's new M4 Lab will be a hub for our advanced machine learning and data sciences teams working on bleeding-edge research to improve the quality of content our software helps our clients create, ranging from short blog posts to long whitepapers.

Responsibilities
----------------


Apply quantitative, analytical, and creative skills to design, develop and test a Natural Language Generation system along with other team members, in an environment with many supporting technologies and users eager to provide corrective training data
As research project lead, you would be a Principle Investigator on bleeding edge research
Explore new research ideas with regard to NLG, formulate R&D projects, and architect scalable implementations
Research, design and develop novel algorithms
Collaborate with architects, software developers, data science management, and product management to design and program innovative strategic and tactical solutions that meet market needs with respect to functionality, performance, reliability, realistic implementation schedules, and adherence to development goals and principles
Gather and determine requirements for new features from internal colleagues
Develop and document intellectual property
Publish select scientific discoveries in academic journals or conferences

Required Skills
---------------


Experience with generative deep learning techniques in a text, language, or NLP domain
Deep understanding of models and techniques such as recurrent neural networks, seq2seq models, distributional semantics, attention mechanisms, and variational autoencoders
Experience with attention mechanisms, conditional language models, and RNNs
Hands-on experience implementing new research ideas with a neural network training framework such as Tensorflow, Keras, or PyTorch
Keep up to date on the latest research for deep learning for NLG, NLP, and summarization
Strong problem solving skills
Experience with fast prototyping and iterative experimentation
Experience working effectively with software engineering teams
Knowledge of information theory, multivariate calculus, and multilinear algebra solid enough to specify novel relevant deep learning and machine learning algorithms
Teach and mentor other ML-knowledgeable coworkers in advanced deep learning techniques
Excellent communication, teamwork, and technical writing skills

Desired Pluses
--------------


Experience with any of VAE-GANs, cGANs, or RL-GANs
Experience with neural corpus summarization

Required Education and Experience Level
---------------------------------------


PhD in Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Statistics, Computational Linguistics, or a very related field; other exceptional candidates with extensive ML/DL/NLP/NLG backgrounds may also be considered
At least 2 years of research experience in some combination of academia or industry with respect to ML/DL/NLP/NLG

job_description:
The Analytical Co-op Student will work with CDRD scientists and staff to provide analytical support for multiple drug development projects. The individual in this role will contribute to collaborative research, and conduct experiments in a team-oriented product development focused environment. We are currently seeking to fill one, 8-month term position with the possibility of extension.

What can you look forward to?

You will:
 Develop and implement analytical methods for characterization of small molecules and biomolecules.

 Perform analysis of small molecules from biological matrices.
 Present and discuss data and results at Group meetings.
Document test procedures and summarize results in reports.

Should you apply?

 Currently enrolled in an undergraduate/graduate co-op program in Chemistry, or Health Science disciplines at Canadian University.

What can we offer you?

Beyond drug development, we take pride in a training program that is dedicated to providing every opportunity for our students to grow and develop their technical and soft skills. Our training program has over 200 alumni with a 95% employment rate and incorporates mentorship, event opportunities and a speaker series.

In addition to being a training platform for scientists and business people, we also take additional steps to build a work culture that champions innovation, partnership and a social aspect. With an enthusiastic WE@CDRD Events committee, we host monthly socials, holiday parties and company events.

Our Commitment to You
CDRD supports employees to strike a balance between their work and personal lives. At CDRD, our human resources practices and strategies have been developed to build an inclusive culture regardless of race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital or family status, or disability.

Submit the following:

job_title: Senior UX Researcher, Online Store Editor
job_description:
About the role

At Shopify, we care deeply about making commerce better for everyone. This mission began when our founders started an online business selling snowboards. Existing software was expensive and so hard to use that it made their dream of entrepreneurship feel impossible. So they changed their focus and started developing Shopify to enable anyone with something to sell to easily start, run, and grow their business.
Today, Shopify empowers more than 600,000 merchants from all over the world to succeed at entrepreneurship. Our mission is ambitious and we're always looking for great people to join us.
About the UX Research Team
The UX Research team guides and informs the company towards designing and building better products and experiences for people using a variety of research methods. Researchers work with a multidisciplinary team of developers, product managers, content strategists, designers, and marketers to incorporate people-centric thinking from the beginning of a project to its inevitable iterative improvement. We ask thoughtful research questions, conduct contextual research, frame problems, synthesize insights, evaluate concepts or prototypes, and assist with launches and releases.
We value diversity and learning from one another, so you’ll be joining a team of researchers from various backgrounds (e.g. anthropology, psychology, human-computer interaction, industrial design). You’ll have opportunities to learn, lead, and contribute to meaningful work.
Online Store Team
We’re a multidisciplinary team of designers, researchers, content strategists, developers and data scientists, all working to empower our merchants towards designing online stores that reflect the vision they have for their business. To do so, the Online Store Team develops the themes that merchants can choose from to design their stores, the editor in which they can customize those themes, the space in which they can manage those themes, domains, and information architecture, as well as the storefront features that offer end consumers a seamless online shopping experience. Together, our goal is to redefine what it means to design custom online stores that reflect the varied visions and needs of our 600,000 merchants.
You'll be working on:
Proactively articulating research questions and priorities with teammates, then creatively using a range of research methods to transform those into insights
Synthesizing, summarizing and evangelizing findings to impact product, UX, and marketing decisions
Making sure your insights lead to tangible changes in the products that we ship
Collaborating closely with designers, developers, product managers, and other disciplines to design, implement, and track new products or experiences
Sharing knowledge, identifying, and solving wider problems with other UX researchers
Helping merchants grow their businesses with better marketing tools and selling in more ways (e.g. point of sale, new sales channels)
You'll need to have:
A proactive and self-starting attitude
Research experience in a product development or service design context
Hands-on experience scoping and prioritizing research questions, research planning, data gathering, analysis, summarizing, and sharing findings
Experience applying a range of research methods with creativity, scrappiness, and critical thinking
A desire to continually experiment with and develop new methods
Examples of projects where your research insights led to better informed design decisions (e.g. to guide product roadmaps, strategy decisions)
Examples of how you influenced teams or companies to become more people-centred
Empathy for non-technical people performing high-stakes tasks
A love for asking questions, seeking answers, and working with others to solve difficult design problems
Bonus points if you have:
Experience doing research on/with multinational businesses
Familiarity with combining qualitative and quantitative data
Spoken at conferences or written about research, UX, design, or strategySkills, hobbies, or experience that have given you a unique perspective on UX research
Experience starting your own business

STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.

Job Description Summary
The Human Resources Generalist works closely with the Senior Human Resources Business Partner, to deliver and execute a broad range of HR services and support to the assigned business units. Responsibilities include HRIS management, compensation and benefits, employee relations, disability management, conflict resolution, recruitment, training and development, and performance management in accordance with the established HR strategies, programs, policies, practices and processes.

The successful candidate will be a broadly skilled HR professional looking for a growth opportunity with the end goal of serving as a trusted advisor to employees at all levels. You are self-motivated to learn and grow your HR knowledge base in all practice areas, demonstrate the required confidence to deliver training and presentations to an audience, thrive under pressure and independently problem-solve through critical analysis.

Job Description

Duties and Responsibilities
Work in partnership with the Senior Human Resources Business Partner, to deliver superior client service for the assigned business units in all HR practice areas by understanding the current and future business needs in order to provide proactive, day-to-day HR services and support aligned to those needs.
Establish effective employee relationships at all levels based on trust, experience and credibility by providing front-line HR consultation, advice and counsel.
Respond to employee requests, enquiries and concerns in a timely and solution-oriented manner.
Coach and support people managers in the application of HR policies and practices.
Support the HR functional teams in the planning, implementation, execution and roll-out of HR programs and processes.
Promote, manage and maintain employee relations programs and approaches by understanding the work environment and driving employee engagement.
Provide counsel and guidance on performance management and corrective actions.
Provide HRIS (Workday) systems administration support to employees.
Assist with candidate immigration and relocation activities.
Facilitate training workshops, new hire orientation sessions and deliver presentations as needed.
Assist with employee onboarding and exit processes.
Administer disability claims and return to work programs.
Review, prioritize and process HR administrative tasks.
Analyze HR metrics through data retrieval from the HRIS systems and recommend improvements to the HR programs, processes and service levels.
Continually build and maintain knowledge and understanding of employment laws and regulations, ensuring legal compliance and employment standards.
Support the Senior Human Resources Business Partner and other HR colleagues in managing the workload and special projects as needed.
Perform other duties as required.
Qualifications
Degree in Commerce, Business Administration, Human Resources Management or related field. CPHR designation is required.
Minimum 3 years of relevant progressive HR experience in an HR Advisor or HR Generalist role.
Ability to build strong relationships, including interfacing and communicating effectively with employees at all levels across the organization.
Adept in dealing with sensitive and highly confidential HR issues with tact and discretion.
Demonstrated knowledge and practical experience in applying B.C. employment laws and standards are mandatory.
Proven attention to details, clarity and accuracy in written language, data and analysis.
Ability to facilitate, influence and negotiate in order to reach consensus, resolve conflict and achieve desired outcomes. Excellent judgment, analytical and problem-solving skills are essential.
Highly flexible, good tolerance for ambiguity and time-driven deadlines and able to quickly adapt to changing priorities.
Ability to plan, organize, prioritize time and workload to accomplish tasks and meet deadlines.
Excellent communication skills (verbal, written, and presentation) coupled with strong interpersonal skills both in one-on-one and in group settings.
Proficient working knowledge of HRIS systems (e.g. WorkDay), Gmail, Google Drive, Google Docs and MS Office program.
Passionate about meeting or exceeding goals and expectations.
Team orientated –‘one-team’ behavior is a must.

This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

About the role

Money. How it’s exchanged, saved, kept secure, invested and grown is at the core of every business. Yet managing it can be the most barrier-ridden, complex, challenging aspect of running a business.
Shopify plans to change that.
We have the opportunity to become the central financial solution for our merchants. Shopify has already redefined commerce, raising the standard for how businesses of all sizes operate, market, and sell their products and services. Now it’s time to redefine financial services. With over 600,000 merchants operating in 175 countries, we have the data, insights and economies of scale. We’re already building foundational solutions like merchant capital and Shopify payments and we’re just getting started.
The role:
We’re looking for a General Manager that’s able to balance a deep product understanding with sound commercial expertise. This is an incredibly unique opportunity and we need a visionary leader with a history of leading and executing on world class financial solutions. Today you may be at a large financial services company driving change at scale; or you may be leading a fintech start-up.

You’ll be doing things like:
Setting the vision, strategic direction and roadmap for Shopify’s financial solutions offering
Rally and build a cross-functional team of R&D (engineering, UX and product management) and commercial leaders that will realize the vision
Forge and nurture key partnerships amongst partner organizations
Build relationships across Shopify to better understand the problems we’re solving and opportunities for collaboration
Discover uncharted territory as we build, adapt and localize product in new international markets
Leverage a team of data scientists to inform your decision-making
You’ll need to have:
A background in financial services, with a specific focus on fintech; ideally with direct experience in payments processing globally
A senior leadership track record of building and enabling high-impact teams
Influential and strategic communicator with the ability to leverage deep industry contacts to develop and advance key partnerships
Strong experience in complex negotiations
An understanding of macro economics and capital markets
Highly self aware and open to the perspectives of others

Test Development Engineering Intern - SCI002953
About Us
SCIEX – An operating company within Danaher’s Life Sciences platform

SCIEX helps to improve the world we live in by enabling scientists and laboratory analysts to find answers to the complex analytical challenges they face. Our leadership in LC-MS and CE-MS have made us a trusted partner globally to those who are focused on basic research, drug discovery, food and environmental testing, forensic toxicology, clinical research and diagnostics. With over 40 years of innovation, we continue to redefine what is achievable in routine and complex analysis.

We are seeking smart, team-oriented people who have purpose and are committed to helping us deliver Answers for Science. Knowledge for Life. ™ Our global team, located on every continent, is our greatest strength, bringing diverse perspectives and breakthrough thinking. Description

Support design and development of functional test fixtures for electronic sub-assemblies used in Mass Spectrometers.
Work collaboratively with test engineering team.
Assemble test fixtures and universal test systems, including mechanical, cabling, wiring, PCB assembly, etc.
Perform integration testing of the test fixtures and systems.
Create/update/maintain documentation (schematics, BOM , assembly drawings) for test fixtures and systems and perform ECRs/ECOs to release them.
Perform functional testing on electronic sub-assemblies.
Create work instructions and test procedures.
Debug and troubleshoot test fixtures, test systems and electronic sub-assemblies/Unit Under Test (UUT).
Collect functional test data and perform statistical analysis.
Work with design team to review and provide input on test specifications and test requirements.
Provide support for test fixtures and systems located at remote sites and train test personals on test hardware, software and proper troubleshooting techniques.

Qualifications
Currently enrolled (in good standing) in 3rd year Electrical (Electronics) Engineering or Computer Engineering programs.
Experience: Relevant Summer Job, University or Personal Project Experience.
General electronics knowledge with ability to read and interpret electrical schematics.
Knowledge with Instrumentations such as Power supplies, Oscilloscopes, DMMs, Generators, Digital Input Output (DIO) Cards, Data Acquisition (DAQ) Cards, etc.
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills.
Excellent problem solving skills.
Ability to work independently and in a team.
Excellent time management skills with ability to juggle multiple tasks and meet tight deadlines.
Proficient with Microsoft Office.
Basic mechanical skills with ability to use hand tools/power tools to assemble mechanical parts.
Soldering skills with ability to use soldering tools would be an asset.
PCB design skills with knowledge of PCB schematic capture and layout tools would be an asset.
Knowledge of NI LabVIEW and TestStand software would be an asset.

About Tektronix Canada


We are the measurement insight company committed to performance, and compelled by possibilities. Tektronix designs and manufactures test and measurement solutions to break through the walls of complexity, and accelerate global innovation. Together we empower engineers to create and realize technological advances with ever greater ease, speed and accuracy. Tektronix solutions have supported many of humankind’s greatest advances of the past 70 years. Health. Communication. Mobility. Space. With offices in 21 countries, we are committed to the scientists, engineers and technicians around the world who will define the future.

The Geohazards and Geomorphology team is made up of dedicated specialists that use expert knowledge, principles and practice in geohazards, Earth surface processes, and landforms to assist clients achieve economic, environmental and safety goals by recognizing and minimizing the impact of terrain constraints, mitigating hazards, reducing risk, and providing engineered solutions.

Our team gathers professionals with specific background and experience in slope hazards, erosion processes, water crossing assessment, ecohydraulics, terrain mapping, hazard and risk mapping (qualitative and quantitative), image analysis and interpretation, GIS analysis, surface water and debris flow modeling. Our current clients include pipeline, rail, mining, and forest companies, as well as municipal, provincial and federal governments, and First Nations.

We are fully supported by geotechnical and civil engineers, biologists and environmental specialists recognized locally and around the world for their expertise.

The Geohazards and Geomorphology team is expanding and is currently seeking a Geohazard Specialist to join our dynamic group of scientist and engineers . This position will report to the Manager of Geohazards and Geomorphology and will be responsible for supporting the execution of geohazard projects.
Required Qualifications, Experience and Skills:

Experience working in a consulting environment; Four years or more of relevant experience in applied geomorphology, related to the assessment of geotechnical and hydrotechnical hazards; Minimum Bachelor’s Degree from a relevant Engineering or Earth Sciences program with specific education, training or experience in geomorphology and geohazards; Demonstrated experience in understanding terrain models and specialized training in at least one aspect of Geomorphology, Engineering Geology or similar; Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to produce reports and proposals; Demonstrated skill at air photo interpretation; Excellent working knowledge of ArcGIS; and, Ability to work effectively with others and collaborating in a multi-disciplinary team. Registered (or qualified to register) with the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists in Alberta, British Columbia and/or Saskatchewan.

Desirable Qualifications, Experience and Skills:

M.Sc. degree in a field complimentary to current staff expertise; Proficient at statistical and analytical methods of analysis with emphasis on quantitative methods in geomorphology; Expertise using specialized equipment and/or software (LiDAR, Geophysical tools, Satellite image interpretation software, GIS software, survey equipment, geological or geotechnical modelling software etc…) and willingness to take responsibility for those skills, including training other staff to use them; and,

Specific Duties and Responsibilities:

Design, collect and analyze (or interpret) data from soil, sediment, and bedrock surveys; Design and implement geomorphological field studies; Study the effects of landsliding, erosion, sedimentation and neo-tectonic activity on the landscape; Record and interpret geological and geomorphological information from maps, reports, stratigraphic logs, air photographs, satellite imagery, geological surveys and other sources; Participate in the study and mitigation of hazards including floods and landslides; Prepare geomorphological maps, diagrams, cross-sections and reports from field and office studies; Support the development of proposals in response to client requests for expertise, develop relationships with clients that are based on knowledge, experience and trust; and, Fieldwork involves periods of time away from home. This may include long hours, working on remote locations and rustic conditions.

Candidates will ideally be based in Calgary, Alberta. Local candidates will be preferred and no relocation package will be offered

Our commitment to excellence extents do our workplace where we offer a flexible work environment, competitive compensation and benefits including a generous RRSP program and an employee Share Ownership Plan, in-house training programs, a strong emphasis on health and safety, support for continuing education and professional development and the opportunity to work with and learn from senior technical experts and professionals.

For more information, please visit our website at www.snclavalin.com

While SNC-Lavalin would like to thank all those that apply, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

About the role

About the Role
As we continue to grow our UX team in Montreal, we’re looking for a user experience leader to help us take on the next set of challenges. Somebody capable of building opinions by defining goals, direction and strategy, but also comfortable getting into the weeds and working directly with their team. At Shopify, leaders sketch too. They thrive on change and operate on trust, leveraging the diverse perspectives of the people on their team in everything they do.
We’re fascinated by how you think, how you break down problems, and how you come up with solutions. We look for those who question, who are never satisfied, and always seek to do better and make better. Those who want to deeply understand why people do things.
We’re looking for an experienced UX Manager to deliver high quality product experiences. You will explore and understand complex merchant needs in order to build a vision for your area and help your team work iteratively towards achieving it. You'll ship high fidelity designs of new features and quickly prototype solutions to visual and interaction problems. You’ll own your projects from start to finish, and collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of designers, content strategists, user researchers, developers, and product managers to deliver the best possible experience for our merchants.
Within our broader Logistics group, this person will lead UX for our Returns team. As the UX Manager for Returns, you’ll lead your team in building out this new area at Shopify from the ground up. You will create the system and process of returns at Shopify, all while providing mentorship and creating growth opportunities for a multidisciplinary UX team of product designers, content strategists, and user researchers.
About UX at Shopify
The UX design team creates tools that give even the most inexperienced entrepreneur the best chance to succeed. At the same time, we design solutions that help some of the world’s leading businesses manage enormous complexity. Making commerce better for everyone, no matter where they’re located or their level of experience, is our passion. It’s what we come to work every morning excited to tackle.
Our team is made up of over 400 designers, content strategists, researchers, and front-end developers across 6 offices. The UX team has a special role in building understanding and empathy for merchants. We believe in testing, iteration, and in giving people the room to experiment and grow.
We’re always on the lookout for people who are excited to work on complex and challenging problems at a global scale in a friendly, collaborative environment. If this sounds familiar, we’d love to hear from you.
What you'll be working on:
Establishing a user experience vision for the Identity team and lead your team to achieve it iteratively by working with your peers in product management, engineering, and data science.
Developing a baseline knowledge in all our UX disciplines (content strategy, research, design, and user experience development) and deep expertise in your product’s problem area (Returns).
Working with the Product Manager and Engineering Lead on your projects to balance technical, business, and merchant requirements.
Growing and mentoring your team of direct reports including product designers and content strategists, with a dotted line reporting to UX Researchers. You’ll help them work towards their career goals and build the next generation of UX leadership at Shopify.
Planning and recruiting for the long term to build a fully-functioning multidisciplinary UX team.
Working with your peer UX Managers as well as senior UX leadership to contribute to the growth of the UX organization’s team and processes.
You're the ideal person for this role if you have examples of how you've:
Been responsible for the performance management and career growth of one or more reports on a product design team. It’d be great if you’ve led folks from multiple disciplines like content strategy or research.
Led the UX or product design direction of a complex feature or product with multiple user jobs.
Worked collaboratively with peers outside of UX (like product managers, engineers, or data scientists) to prioritize the needs of your users.
Managed relationships with a variety of different stakeholders to balance business and user needs.
Helped a product team achieve a healthy balance of exploring a problem thoroughly while still shipping value early and often.
Thrived in an environment of rapid growth and change.
Tools of our trade:
We work with industry-standard tools and software like Sketch, Invision, and good ol’ pen and paper to define work at low and high fidelity.
This is a permanent, full-time role onsite in our Montreal, Canada office. Relocation is an option from anywhere in the world.
We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. Holly is looking forward to reading your application – thanks for your interest!

job_description:
About you

You're a talented and creative engineer, passionate about massive scale, quality, craftsmanship, and you're looking to push the boundaries of what is possible. You're not only an engineer however, you also bring a strong sense of interaction design to the team as well. Working as a full stack developer, you will specialize in building crafted products across the front-end and back-end as well as scaling and improving the core web platform infrastructure that powers our apps.

Work inside a multi-disciplinary product team
Prototyping new features
Go from idea to implementation
Take responsibility of the existing software and how it evolves to support new features
Maintain high-level performance quality

Minimum qualifications


Experience with building and shipping web products in a continuous fashion
Ability to collaborate across engineering and design teams
Strong knowledge of JavaScript
Strong knowledge of Python

Preferred qualifications


Experience working directly with Data Scientists and Data Engineers
Experience developing products with machine learning components
3+ years of Python development experience
1+ years of React development experience
B.S. or M.S. degree in Computer Science

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.

Job Description Summary
This position involves executing basic functions concerning stability program and shelf-life extensions at STEMCELL Technologies. This position provides the opportunity to exercise independent judgement in evaluating complex problems and applying current methodologies and best practices to resolve identified issues

Job Description

Duties and Responsibilities
Assists in processes governing stability studies, protocol preparation and SOP/Process improvements.
Assist in workflow from initiation to completion of stability studies for raw materials, in-process materials and finished products
Responsible for receipt, storage and inventory control of stability samples internally and externally
Prepare stability schedules and maintain stability data base
Assist in preparation of stability reports as requested and upon study completion
Assist in preparation of new and revision of existing SOPs related to stability management
Perform other Quality Control functions as assigned by Quality Control management
Promote a safe and cooperative working environment
Qualifications
BSc or technical degree with 2-4 years related experience; or MSc with 0-2 year post graduate experience.
Good report writing and ability to understand and adhere to standard operating procedures, regulations and industry standards.
Excellent communication skills both one on one and in a group setting.
Highly organized and detail orientated.
Willingness to learn and assume the responsibilities.
Good interpersonal skills.
Ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment

This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

About Us
SCIEX – An operating company within Danaher’s Life Sciences platform

SCIEX helps to improve the world we live in by enabling scientists and laboratory analysts to find answers to the complex analytical challenges they face. Description
This position is part of the CTO – Chief Technology Office, as part of the Sustaining Engineering team and entails oversight and execution of the design change process at Sciex. This includes leading the CCB (Change Control Board and supporting our ECR (Engineering Change Request) process to support changes to our world-class, state-of-the-art analytical instruments. In this capacity, the candidate will work with high-performance, multi-disciplinary teams participating in the review of changes being requested by various business functions. The individual will also help to optimize and streamline the process through collaboration and data analysis, while following established guidelines, procedures and design practices.

Primary Responsibilities:
Oversight of the Design Change Process for all platforms across Sciex
Responsible for continuous improvement of the change control process
Facilitate and chair Change Control Board meetings
Evaluation of reasons for change to ensure justification and timeliness of changes align with business goals
Create awareness of on-going HW and SW changes to ensure synchronization of activities in new product development and sustainment of existing products
Establish and conduct visual daily management on all ECRs through lifecycle
Ensure ECRs progress in a timely manner from initiation to closure
Update Design Change Process work instructions as needed
Ensure ECRs are executed with objective evidence to support changes.
Manage the Standards Library and process standards requests

#LI-SL1.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical (Preferred) or Electrical Engineering
Over 5 years of experience in a design / engineering environment, preferably in a regulated industry with knowledge of CM standard EIA-649
Expert knowledge and experience in PLM (product lifecycle management) systems such as ENOVIA
Experience generating ECO (Engineering Change Orders)
Working knowledge of CATIA and reading/updating drawings and 3D models
Familiarity with analytical instruments or medical device development is an asset.
Thorough knowledge of part number creation, design change rules, revision control, BOM creation and BOM updates
Detail-oriented, strong organization skills and ability to build relationships across a fast-paced global environment
Ability to influence others in a positive and collaborative manner
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
Possess a sense of urgency and capability to meet deadlines and drive to closure

STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Job Description Summary
The Program Manager, Calibration within the Facilities department is responsible for developing and leading STEMCELL’s Calibration Management Program and the overall processes that impact the quality of the measurement results or affect the GMP compliance of the facilities, utilities, manufacturing, and laboratory equipment. This role requires a certified individual who has demonstrated success in establishing GMP compliant calibration programs with hands-on experience inspecting and calibrating equipment, in addition to delivering training to staff as a subject matter expert, to expand STEMCELL’s overall calibration capabilities at our facilities.

Job Description

Duties and Responsibilities
Lead the development of the corporate in-house calibration management program in line with ISO, GMP, USP requirements and industry best practices to increase efficiencies and compliance.
Establish an in-house metrology laboratory.
Develop and maintain calibration management documentation, including SOPs, calibration methods, measurement data templates, and reports.
Liaise with equipment owners/representatives to provide guidance for establishing calibration ranges and tolerances based on process requirements and compliance standards.
Perform calibration in-house and/or coordinate and supervise qualified external service providers, as required.
Perform investigations and impact assessments in response to out-of-tolerance/equipment failure conditions and document outcomes in STEMCELL’s QMS. May include providing recommendations for product impact assessments.
Develop statistical requirements for corporate calibration management program
Perform statistical analysis of measurement/test data, execute troubleshooting activities, recommend solutions, and lead process improvements for the program.
Train and develop direct and indirect team members on the calibration management program, including technical procedures and developing a proactive calibration mindset in stakeholder groups.
Define, lead and execute on the assigned calibration projects and related tasks, including defining the scope, timelines, resource planning, etc.
Participate in corporate, customer, and regulatory audits.
Implement and adhere to company policies, SOPs, Quality and Safety Programs, ISO compliance, Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) and Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) standards and regulations when fulfilling all equipment related activities.

Qualifications
Bachelor of Science or Engineering and/or diploma in instrumentation, certified as Calibration Technician (e.g. ASQ CTT).
Minimum 15 years of relevant experience, preferably in a regulated GMP manufacturing environment, leading a calibration program and team.
Proven ability of defining and implementing corporate calibration strategies
Experience in participating in compliance audits
Strong aptitude in mechanical, electrical, controls, and/or electronics.
Comprehensive knowledge of equipment calibration and related applications, including commissioning, test standards, troubleshooting, repairs and optimization of utilities, manufacturing and/or laboratory equipment.
Thorough understanding of regulatory documentation requirements and standard practices, ISO compliance, Good Laboratory Practices (GLP), Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), and Design Control and Workers Safety.
Internal customer-focused mindset with strong interpersonal and influencing skills. Proven track record in collaborating within a project environment.
Excellent communication skills (verbal, written and presentation) both in one-on-one and in group settings.
Attention to detail combined with the ability to execute at a high level with significant independence.
Team orientated – ‘one-team’ attitude is a must.
Confident, results-oriented.

This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

job_title: IT Developer, Applications/Integrations - Hiram Walker & Sons Ltd - Windsor
job_description:
Company Name: Hiram Walker & Sons Ltd.
Location: Windsor, ON

Hiram Walker & Sons Limited, a Pernod Ricard Company, is the place where ambition thrives. As part of a global enterprise, we are proud to be delivering the market such exciting brands as Wiser's Whisky, Polar Ice Vodka, Malibu Rum, and Lamb's rum. The IT Application Development team at Pernod Ricard North America is responsible for the development of a wide array of line-of-business tools for internal business customers. New enterprise-grade technologies are employed to build cutting-edge applications with strong user experiences in the Canadian, American, and Travel Retail markets.
This role will be responsible for:

Application Development and support lifecycle, including developing new applications and enhancing existing ones, performing complex problem solving and issue resolution, documenting application changes as well as issues and resolutions, partnering with IT functional leads on application enhancements and support, and providing technical collaboration with third party agencies and vendors as needed.
APIs/Integrations Development: designing, coding, integration testing, and implementation of integration development projects. This role will require delivering detailed design for APIs and micro-services development within the integration space. Being able to understand large enterprise level architecture, provide design recommendations, and work with cross functional application teams to provide the best solution to meet the project needs are crucial for the role
Data Management and Machine Learning: working with the Business Intelligence/Data warehousing team for building reliable ETL processes between the PRNA Data Warehouse and the systems it interacts with. Working with vendors/data scientists to understand the ML algorithms implemented by them, supporting the corresponding processes and subsequently building new ML solutions.
KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Responsible for developing new solutions for mobile, web applications, security and API/integrations.
 Responsible for developing enhancements and break-fixes for traditional web applications, mobile applications, and reports, in both new and existing systems
 Responsible for developing ETL/ELT solutions and related data integrations using cloud based tools (E.g. Azure Data Factory
 Responsible for working with the IT Architect, Applications to build standards for Machine Learning/AI within the application development team.
 Responsible for system support including answering incoming tickets, e-mails, and phone messages, complex problem solving, resolving data discrepancies, and documenting all issues and resolutions.
 Responsible for off-hours support as required.
 Provide technical collaboration and assistance to 3rd party agencies and vendors leading projects or providing IT services as appropriate mobile and web initiatives.
 Assist application functional leads in design sessions with business users related to application enhancement work and in preparing functional specification documents.
 Perform system testing on application enhancements and break-fixes before they are rolled out to the business for UAT.
 Assist Application Manager in evaluating capabilities of application tools and new technologies to direct proper application development strategy.
 Coordinate with Infrastructure team and vendors to resolve product issues by raising service requests where required.
 Assist functional leads with application training for business users.
 Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field.

Experience/ Background:

2-3 years of experience in Java development
2-3 years of experience in JavaScript development (ES6 Standards)
2-3 years of experience in web application development
2-3 years of experience in mobile (hybrid) application development
1-2 years of experience in API or RESTful web service development
1-2 years of experience is SQL design and development in a relational database environment
1 year of experience in Al/Machine learning (Python)
Skills/Competencies

Excellent problem solving and design skills as well as a strong troubleshooting background.
Excellent communication skills (both written and oral) as well as ability to work independently or in a fast-paced team environment.
Ability and willingness to learn new applications rapidly.

Excellent understanding of Java software development in a web-based environment. (JSP, Servlets)
Excellent understanding of web technologies including but not limited to:CSS3, SASS, AJAX, XML
Strong understanding of RDBMS, and specifically Oracle, PL/SQL language.
Strong understanding of RESTful APIs.

Strong understanding of Tomcat Server in a production environment.

Experience with Sencha/Angular/Ionic and Cordova/PhoneGap an asset.
Experience with Eclipse, Maven, Nexus, GIT, Bitbucket, Jira, Bamboo an asset.
Experience with MuleSoft technologies a plus.
Experience with User Interface and User Experience design a plus.
Experience with advances Oracle analytic functions, large dataset query tuning and aggregation, preferably in Oracle 12c a plus.
Experience with Microsoft PowerBl a plus.
Experience with SQL Server, Azure Data Factory, Informatica a plus.
Experience with Python and Machine Learning principles/Al technologies a plus.
