Turnstone Biologics is a clinical-stage, immuno-oncology company focused on the development of next-generation oncolytic viral immunotherapies for patients with a broad range of solid tumors. Turnstone’s unique, first-in-class oncolytic viral immunotherapies harness anti-tumor immunity by combining the potent tumor-killing effects of an oncolytic virus with a tumor-targeted T-cell vaccine. Our robust pipeline of early-stage biologics, based on our MG1 oncolytic virus platform, are in development for multiple solid tumors and are being evaluated in combination with other immunotherapies, including checkpoint inhibitors, to drive unprecedented, durable T-cell immune responses. Turnstone continues to build a world-class, high-performing company that embraces being a learning organization with a sense of urgency. Turnstone has a seasoned board of directors and venture capital partners, and highly active R&D efforts led by a world-class scientific management team. Turnstone is co-located in Ottawa, and Hamilton, Canada and New York, USA.
Position Overview:
Under the direction of the Sr. Scientist in Hamilton, the Post-Doctoral Fellow/Research Associate will play key roles in the design, execution, and analysis of experiments to further the development of Turnstone Biologics’ growing pipeline. This is an exciting opportunity to work along side senior researchers and project teams to perform discovery and development research that will ultimately inform clinical development.
Our company’s technology is based around replicating oncolytic virus vaccines engineered to target tumours and launch massive tumour targeting immune responses. Your role will be to join a dynamic team of immunologists and molecular biologists who strive to further understand, and improve, the oncolytic vaccine platform. If you are interested in translating your immunology/oncology experience into next-generation cancer therapies, and are meticulous and driven to achieve; then this opportunity may be just what you are looking for.
Responsibilities:

Lead various aspects of in vitro and in vivo studies including but not limited to: organizing teams, scheduling and executing experiments, collecting, interpreting and communicating results
Prepare data/figures to present to senior research staff
Generate study reports in a timely manner
Contribute to a team-centric culture that embraces scientific excellence, integrity, and urgency

Qualifications & Experience:

PhD in immunology/biology/oncology or related field, with 0-2 years experience in an academic or industrial laboratory
Robust understanding of innate and adaptive immune system is required
Hands-on experience using multi-colour flow cytometry to assess T cell phenotype/function/activation
Experienced in mammalian cell culture. Work with viruses or other BSL-2 agents is preferrable
Working knowledge of common molecular techniques is an asset (e.g. PCR, western blot, sequencing)
Must have good analytical and problem-solving abilities
Self-starter with a strong work ethic, and attention to detail
Ability to quickly adapt to shifting priorities
Knowledge and experience with standard software (e.g. FlowJo, Microsoft Office Suite, Graphpad Prism)
Knowledge and commitment to Occupational Health and Safety Procedures in a laboratory

 To Apply:
Please forward applications via email only to hr@turnstonebio.com including a cover letter and resume. In the e-mail subject line, please indicate the position title POST-DOCTORAL FELLOW/RESEARCH ASSOCIATE-IMMUNOLOGY.
Turnstone Biologics welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected will be invited for an interview.

Test Development Engineering Intern-SCI002953

About Us
SCIEX – An operating company within Danaher’s Life Sciences platform

SCIEX helps to improve the world we live in by enabling scientists and laboratory analysts to find answers to the complex analytical challenges they face. Our leadership in LC-MS and CE-MS have made us a trusted partner globally to those who are focused on basic research, drug discovery, food and environmental testing, forensic toxicology, clinical research and diagnostics. With over 40 years of innovation, we continue to redefine what is achievable in routine and complex analysis.

We are seeking smart, team-oriented people who have purpose and are committed to helping us deliver Answers for Science. Knowledge for Life. ™ Our global team, located on every continent, is our greatest strength, bringing diverse perspectives and breakthrough thinking. With the power of the Danaher Business System behind us, it’s our people who have made us the industry leader. Come join our winning team. Visit us at www.sciex.com.

Description
Support design and development of functional test fixtures for electronic sub-assemblies used in Mass Spectrometers.
Work collaboratively with test engineering team.
Assemble test fixtures and universal test systems, including mechanical, cabling, wiring, PCB assembly, etc.
Perform integration testing of the test fixtures and systems.
Create/update/maintain documentation (schematics, BOM , assembly drawings) for test fixtures and systems and perform ECRs/ECOs to release them.
Perform functional testing on electronic sub-assemblies.
Create work instructions and test procedures.
Debug and troubleshoot test fixtures, test systems and electronic sub-assemblies/Unit Under Test (UUT).
Collect functional test data and perform statistical analysis.
Work with design team to review and provide input on test specifications and test requirements.
Provide support for test fixtures and systems located at remote sites and train test personals on test hardware, software and proper troubleshooting techniques.

Qualifications
Currently enrolled (in good standing) in 3rd year Electrical (Electronics) Engineering or Computer Engineering programs.
Experience: Relevant Summer Job, University or Personal Project Experience.
General electronics knowledge with ability to read and interpret electrical schematics.
Knowledge with Instrumentations such as Power supplies, Oscilloscopes, DMMs, Generators, Digital Input Output (DIO) Cards, Data Acquisition (DAQ) Cards, etc.
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills.
Excellent problem solving skills.
Ability to work independently and in a team.
Excellent time management skills with ability to juggle multiple tasks and meet tight deadlines.
Proficient with Microsoft Office.
Basic mechanical skills with ability to use hand tools/power tools to assemble mechanical parts.
Soldering skills with ability to use soldering tools would be an asset.
PCB design skills with knowledge of PCB schematic capture and layout tools would be an asset.
Knowledge of NI LabVIEW and TestStand software would be an asset.

STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.

Job Description Summary
The QC Analyst will perform day to day operations related to analytical testing of raw materials, in-process and finished products in QC Analytics group to ensure the STEMCELL’s Quality Standards are met and testing is completed timely and accurately. The QC Analyst may also participate in method troubleshooting and validation, laboratory and equipment maintenance, creation of analytical methods and procedures, and all other activities as required. The QC Analyst will collaborate effectively with other members of QC team and other cross functional groups.

Job Description

Duties and Responsibilities are to:
Perform the day to day operations to ensure timely product testing and product disposition according to QC procedures, including data analysis and report preparation.
Perform second analyst data review to ensure accuracy of data reported.
Operate and maintain specialized lab equipment as required (e.g. pH, Osmometer, HPLC, GC, etc.).
Participate in laboratory cleaning and maintenance.
Create and maintain various documents including SOPs, test methods, specifications, protocols and reports to support the Quality Management System according to STEMCELL compliance requirements (ISO and cGMP) and customer needs.
Participate in Out-of-Specification (OOS) investigations and assess other non-conformances
Participate in the method development and validation (as required) and QC technology transfer.
Perform non-routine analysis and testing under supervision which pertains to method troubleshooting, customer complaint investigations, support of process development and research.
Communicate efficiently with supervisors and coworkers and promote a safe and cooperative working environment.


Qualifications / Requirements
BSc degree (preferably chemistry) with 0-2 years of industrial experience in biotechnology industry or equivalent
Be able to perform testing and other activities according to QC procedures following strict GMP and ISO regulations
Attention to details is mustOpen to learning of new procedures and methodologies
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Effective planning and organizational skills with the ability to effectively multi-task and deal with changing priorities.

This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

MEA Forensic Engineers & Scientists is looking for an energetic and organized Client Relations Manager. The successful candidate will have a direct impact on the growth of a specialized engineering firm operating in a unique business space.
MEA has been providing engineering services to legal and insurance clients since 1982 and has investigated more than 50,000 accidents across North America. Offices in Toronto, Vancouver and Los Angeles are staffed with engineers and scientists who examine evidence, conduct complex analyses, prepare detailed reports, and provide testimony at arbitration, deposition, and trial. Currently MEA has 63 employees who enjoy a collegial atmosphere and a culture of honesty, integrity and continual learning.
We are looking for someone to join our marketing team, help attract new clients and strengthen our existing relationships.
Summary:
The Client Relations Manager will work closely with a team of managers, engineers and their counterparts in the Vancouver and Los Angeles offices, to plan and execute marketing and business development activities in order to strengthen MEA’s position as a leading forensic engineering firm and attract new insurance and legal clients.
Specific Duties and Responsibilities:Help develop a cohesive and strategic marketing approach for MEA’s Toronto office.Build marketing plans for MEA engineers that will help them connect with new clients and maintain existing relationships.Organize seminars by MEA engineers for legal and insurance audiences.Arrange and attend marketing events like trade shows, golf tournaments, and legal and insurance networking events.Coordinate client appreciation events.Help create marketing materials like trade articles and website content.Identify key client trends based on a client database.Plan and organize in-house events designed to promote team work and collegiality.
Requirements:


A degree in marketing, business administration, business development, project management or a related field.At least 3-5 years of marketing or business development experience.The organizational and planning skills required to manage multiple projects and deadlines.Strong interpersonal and communication skills.A curious and resourceful nature with a willingness to tackle a variety of different tasks.Ability to track and aggregate data using spreadsheets or other software.Experience with CRM software a plus.Experience working in professional services, insurance, legal or consulting industry preferred.

Job Description Summary
The Leasing Coordinator is responsible for organizing and maintaining STEMCELL’s comprehensive lease portfolio, related documentation and reporting on key performance indicators, leasing trends and operating costs. This role functions as a key contact for information gathering and distribution to/from STEMCELL and various external parties (landlords, property management personnel and sub-tenants) by acting as a communication bridge. The Leasing Coordinator is an integral member of the Facilities Team and reports to the Vice-President of Facilities. This position is based at our W7th location.

Job Description

Duties and Responsibilities
Act as a primary contact for landlords and sub-tenants in ensuring compliance with lease agreements
Create timelines of key dates for leasing activities, ensuring that real estate projects are forecasted appropriately.
Prepare cost reports associated with individual leases and conduct annual reconciliation activities with landlords and sub-tenants.
Create, distribute and maintain leasing reports, including but not limited to: operating costs, transaction services, key performance indicators etc.
Create and maintain a quarterly real estate and lease review report detailing the key lease and operating parameters of the company’s global facilities
Tracks expenses related to small renovation projects and provides cost accounting support to the projects.
Prepares tenant allowance reimbursements requests and statutes of declaration forms at the end of construction.
Execute transaction forms and letters, including but not limited to: exercise letters, extension letters, waivers, employee occupancy, etc.
Organize and coordinate the execution of documents; ensure the correct distribution and archival of documentation.
Prepare cost sharing agreements.
Perform other duties as required.

Qualifications
BBA, BComm or education in real estate and property management is preferred. MBA is an asset.
Minimum of 3 to 5 years of contract and/or lease administration experience.
Ability to communicate professionally – verbal and written.
Ability to review lease agreements and contracts.
Proficient at Excel and Powerpoint to create data graphics for presentations and reports.
Proven ability to work independently and/or with a team.
Attention to detail and accuracy while juggling priorities and deadlines.
Strong organizational and follow through skills; ability to prioritize tasks and projects.
Ability to maintain confidentiality.

Job Description Summary
The QC Analyst is responsible for testing of finished products, in-process products and raw materials, including all analysis and documentation. They QC analyst will be involved in development and validation of test methods. May also perform experiments related to troubleshooting, customer complaint investigations and other product-related problems.

Job Description

Duties and Responsibilities
Perform QC tests on Cell Separation products and antibodies according to approved procedures, including data analysis and report preparation.
Perform laboratory procedures including nanoparticle characterization (e.g., sizing, surface properties, composition)
Participation in and compliance to Quality Management System.
Participate in the development of QC testing procedures.
Cell culture and processing for various applications.
Operation of Flow cytometer and data analysis.
Participate in method development and validation, as required.
Draft technical documents such as SOPs, validation protocols and, test methods, specifications, reports to support the Quality Management System as a whole according to STEMCELL compliance requirements (ISO13485 and cGMP) and customer needs.
Lead root cause investigations and assist in the execution of corrective and preventative actions for process-related non-conformances.
Perform non-routine analysis and testing with direction from supervisor (eg. troubleshooting, customer complaint investigations)
Participate in Out-of-Specification (OOS) investigations and other non-conformances or troubleshooting investigations.
General laboratory and equipment maintenance and monitoring.
Participate in multi-department teams to resolve problems, increase efficiencies and improve processes

DDS is a global company providing scheduling and dispatch solution to taxi and transit customers. We lead the market of Taxi and Paratransit solutions with a significant market share in both Taxi and Transit. Today, our most significant market share is in North America, while our EMEA operations have the fastest growth. DDS Wireless believes that transit industry is about to change rapidly, with different modes of transportation coming together into a multi-modal solution. With a strong presence in both Taxi and Transit markets, we are ideally positioned to lead the market in realizing the potential of multi-modal transportation.
DDS Wireless is currently seeking a talented individual to join our team of dedicated professionals. The Finance team have the following opportunity available for an Algorithm Development Engineer.
Reporting to the Software Development Manager in our Richmond office, you will achieve project objectives by focusing on encapsulating human scheduling and dispatching strategies with high fidelity to solve large-scale, combinatorially explosive transit problems.
Specifically, the mandate is the following:
An understanding micro-service architectural framework that facilitates extension of the overall system with new services with clearly defined interfaces.
Contributing to the design and implementation of new core services responsible for continuous optimization and dispatch of transit schedules.
Learning the transit process and working closely with senior computer scientists in a team.
Solving real-world problems with an emphasis on algorithmic simplicity and elegance.
Developing newer and faster technologies in travel time prediction using GIS historical and live data.
Additional duties as assigned

job_title: Senior Manager, Business Intelligence Predictive Analytics
job_description:
Job Field:
Business Support
Job Type:
Full time
Length of Assignment:

Who We Are

BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6, 500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients’ businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia.

Further information is available at www.bgis.com

Why Choose BGIS?

Whether you’re a seasoned professional or a recent graduate, we hire the best and brightest to inspire change for a sustainable future and drive innovation through best practices and technology within our communities and the real estate management services industry.

At BGIS, you will be part of a diverse, team-oriented workplace, with opportunities to drive your career development forward. Our goal is to ensure that our workforce is a reflection of the diversity that exists within the community in which we operate and serve. We offer a competitive and value-driven compensation and benefits package, great employee programs, a healthy work life balance, and more. Join our team and become part of a leading global corporate real estate company today!

SUMMARY

BGIS is the Canadian industry leader in FM management for enterprise level outsourcing contracts. Through our processes, technology and IoT strategies BGIS gathers hundreds of thousands of data points from our wide portfolio of clients; data that includes energy consumption, space utilization, customer satisfaction, costs, age and types of assets which include all major building categories. As we expand our building automation strategies, space utilization monitoring methods and engage in social media platforms the data we have access to will provide insight into everything from running times of assets to creating integrated workplace strategies to developing an understanding of client satisfaction not possible with yesterday's methods.

The Business Intelligence group will turn this data into strategic solutions which we can deploy to our clients. Our industry faces mounting cost pressure for energy, continued pressure to cut cost and elevate occupant experience. As a society, we face the challenge of preserving the environment and helping our clients adapt to new ways that people want to work.

BGIS is charting this course by investing in an analytical program where teams made up of data analysts and business experts partner to turn the significant volume of data our operations generate every day into business models to identify opportunities to enhance customer value, create financial models to be used in business transformation business cases, and create insightful operational reporting.

Senior Manager, BI & Predictive Analytics will partner with data analysts and business experts partner to turn the significant volume of data our operations generate every day into business models to identify opportunities to enhance customer value, create financial models to be used in business transformation business cases, and create insightful operational reporting.

KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

People Leadership

Demonstrates strong, competent leadership for team members to guide them in reaching their full potential and meeting their objectives, which supports achievement of our corporate goals. Specifically these responsibilities include but not limited to:

Full involvement with recruiting talent
Provides mentoring, coaching and guidance to all team members
Objectively recommends compensation adjustments
Manages all aspects of performance
Manage small internal team of data scientists to develop their business knowledge of BGIS and their client portfolio.
Coach them to develop relationships with account teams and clients to further develop their business acumen.
Predictive Analytics

Work closely with Director of Business Analytics to build predictive/prescriptive models and insightful data visualizations which deliver value for BGIs clients, and advanced dashboards.
Manage team that models data in preparation for use with data visualization tools such as MS Power BI, Tableau, Qlik or others as they are adopted by either CGIS corporate or specific accounts.
Work closely with all members of Corporate Business Analytics teams to define requirements for ad hoc descriptive and predictive analytics
Work with internal constituents and the Corporate Analytics team to:
Define use cases,
Develop requirements to progress from an analytical study, to assessing the value generated from that study,
Upon successful study result, scale into a steady state application
Data Management

Partner with web/app developers, internal business intelligence team, and data governance teams to ensure all product and customer data is thoroughly and accurately captured, cleaned, and made available on timely basis to internal databases.
Client Presentations

Prepare and deliver presentations to clients detailing the conclusions reached from both regular analytics and special one-time studies.
Work closely with business leads to ensure that conclusions presented are clearly understood by the client and lead to pragmatic solutions by the account team.
KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

Master’s degree in Business Analytics and 5 - 10 years of relevant working experience
Experience in driving data governance practices at a medium sized company
Experience creating use cases for analytical studies
Expert level knowledge of advanced data mining and statistical modeling: Predictive modeling techniques (e.g., binomial and multiple regressions); Classification techniques (e.g., Clustering, Principal Component Analysis, factor analysis); Decision Tree techniques
Proficiency and continuous skills development in leading edge data analytical tools, e.g. Mathematica, R, Python
Proficiency and continuous skills development in leading edge data visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Birst, MS BI Stack - Power View, Power Pivot, Power Maps
Programming and querying skills: MS SQL, VB, Visual Studio.NET, HTML/DHTML, XML, XSL, CSS
Hands on experience on processing extremely large data sets. Hands on data base administration experience a plus
Good business acumen with strong ability to solve business problems through data driven quantitative methodologies.
Strong project management skills with experience in managing and delivering large, complex analytic projects
Team oriented, energetic, collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible style, with the ability to tailor data driven results to various audience levels
Excellent communication, facilitation and negotiation skills.
Ability to communicate complex comprehensive topics at all levels.
Effective persuasion and interpersonal skills
Self-motivated / self-starter, strong work ethic
Solid organizational and prioritization skills
Bilingual in English and French (an asset)
Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation

None required

About the role

About the Role
As we continue to grow our UX team in Ottawa, we’re looking for a user experience leader to help us take on the next set of challenges. Somebody capable of building opinions by defining goals, direction and strategy, but also comfortable getting into the weeds and working directly with their team. At Shopify, leaders sketch too. They thrive on change and operate on trust, leveraging the diverse perspectives of the people on their team in everything they do.
We’re fascinated by how you think, how you break down problems, and how you come up with solutions. We look for those who question, who are never satisfied, and always seek to do better and make better. Those who want to deeply understand why people do things.
We’re looking for an experienced UX Manager to deliver high quality product experiences. You will explore and understand complex merchant needs in order to build a vision for your area and help your team work iteratively towards achieving it. You'll ship high fidelity designs of new features and quickly prototype solutions to visual and interaction problems. You’ll own your projects from start to finish, and collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of designers, content strategists, user researchers, developers, and product managers to deliver the best possible experience for our merchants.
Within our broader Core Foundations group, this person will lead UX for our Identity team. As the UX Manager for Identity, you’ll lead your team in planning, resourcing, and executing projects related to user accounts, roles, and permissions, all while providing mentorship and creating growth opportunities for a multidisciplinary UX team of product designers, content strategists, and user researchers.
About UX at Shopify
The UX design team creates tools that give even the most inexperienced entrepreneur the best chance to succeed. At the same time, we design solutions that help some of the world’s leading businesses manage enormous complexity. Making commerce better for everyone, no matter where they’re located or their level of experience, is our passion. It’s what we come to work every morning excited to tackle.
Our team is made up of over 400 designers, content strategists, researchers, and front-end developers across 6 offices. The UX team has a special role in building understanding and empathy for merchants. We believe in testing, iteration, and in giving people the room to experiment and grow.
We’re always on the lookout for people who are excited to work on complex and challenging problems at a global scale in a friendly, collaborative environment. If this sounds familiar, we’d love to hear from you.
What you'll be working on:
Establishing a user experience vision for the Identity team and lead your team to achieve it iteratively by working with your peers in product management, engineering, and data science.
Developing a baseline knowledge in all our UX disciplines (content strategy, research, design, and user experience development) and deep expertise in your product’s problem area (Identity).
Working with the Product Manager and Engineering Lead on your projects to balance technical, business, and merchant requirements.
Growing and mentoring your team of direct reports including product designers and content strategists, with a dotted line reporting to UX Researchers. You’ll help them work towards their career goals and build the next generation of UX leadership at Shopify.
Planning and recruiting for the long term to build a fully-functioning multidisciplinary UX team.
Working with your peer UX Managers as well as senior UX leadership to contribute to the growth of the UX organization’s team and processes.
You're the ideal person for this role if you have examples of how you've:
Been responsible for the performance management and career growth of one or more reports on a product design team. Bonus points if you’ve led folks from multiple disciplines like content strategy or research.
Led the UX or product design direction of a complex feature or product with multiple user jobs.
Worked collaboratively with peers outside of UX (like product managers, engineers, or data scientists) to prioritize the needs of your users.
Managed relationships with a variety of different stakeholders to balance business and user needs.
Helped a product team achieve a healthy balance of exploring a problem thoroughly while still shipping value early and often.
Thrived in an environment of rapid growth and change.
Tools of our trade:
We work with industry-standard tools and software like Sketch, Invision, and good ol’ pen and paper to define work at low and high fidelity.
This is a permanent, full-time role onsite in our Ottawa, Canada headquarters. Relocation is an option from anywhere in the world.
We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. Holly is looking forward to reading your application – thanks for your interest!

Manager Bioassay

Location: Montreal, Quebec

www.engeneinc.com
THE COMPANY

enGene Inc. is a high growth biotechnology company developing a robust, proprietary non-viral vector
platform to deliver genes to mucosal cells lining the gut and other mucosal tissues. The vector system
can be administered to the intestine via the oral or enema route. enGene is developing its unique gut-
optimized gene delivery formulation into an orally available “Gene Pill”, which has the potential to be a
platform for oral delivery of a wide range of protein drugs. The company’s primary focus is targeting
its technology to enable localized delivery of immune-modulating proteins to the gut for treating
various immune disorders.
STRATEGIC PHARMA ALLIANCES AND INVESTORS

With its exciting cutting-edge technology, enGene successfully established alliances with two of the
world’s top ten largest pharmaceutical companies: Janssen Biotech and Takeda Pharmaceutical.

enGene is also supported financially by top-tier institutional investors including Forbion Capital
Partners, Fonds de Solidarité FTQ, Pharmstandard International S.A., Lumira Capital and Johnson &
Johnson Development Corporation.
ROLE
EnGene is currently seeking a qualified highly motivated candidate who will play a key leadership role
in the BioAnalytical group. The successful candidate will report to the Senior Director of Pre-Clinical
Development. He/she will lead a team responsible for developing, optimizing, validating and
performing assays to generate pre-clinical data for drug development. He/she will work closely with
junior and experienced scientists in a dynamic, fast-paced and highly collaborative environment.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for the development and implementation of best industry practices for bioanalytical
assays using appropriate technologies to support nonclinical and clinical drug development
programs.
Keep up-to-date with the latest molecular biology, cell biology, and other relevant assay
technologies for bioanalytical assays.
Effectively communicate progress to supervisor and interact with internal/external business
partners to meet project goals and timelines.
Participate in and oversee a team that performs assay development and optimization, and
schedule activities to meet timelines.
Work with scientific personnel internally to analyze data, troubleshoot issues and suggest further
experiments to achieve acceptable assay parameters in a timely manner.
Participate in regular inter-departmental meetings with Quality Control management and SMEs to
ensure alignment on analytical platforms and quality requirements of methods.
Oversee assay transfer to CROs, validation, sample testing, troubleshoot technical issues, manage
timelines and prioritization, review validation and sample analysis protocols/reports to ensure
quality, regulatory compliance, and interpretation of bioanalytical data.
Represent bioanalytical and biomarker development on program teams and contribute to proper
bioanalytical support for these programs; frequently act as a resource and provide guidance to
colleagues.
Guide internal RAs working on bioanalytical projects, either in an advisory capacity or as a direct
supervisor and interact with a diverse team of dedicated scientists developing new assays, as well
as evaluating and recommending new assay platforms to accelerate bioanalysis of projects.
Facilitate a proactive management approach, with open communication lines and ensure good
documentation and up-to-date training of laboratory personnel.
Author/contribute/review protocols, non-clinical and clinical study reports, regulatory documents,
and manuscripts for publication.
Provide mentoring and career development for direct reports.
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATION
PhD in molecular biology/genetics, life sciences or equivalent, with 5 years post PhD experience
including 3+ years in industry/regulated laboratory, in bioanalytical assay development, or
MS in Science with 10+ years of industry/regulated laboratory experience, in bioanalytical assay
development.
Strong experience in developing and validating regulated bioanalytical and biomarker assays using
a variety of technology platforms.
Hands-on experience and understanding of molecular biology, and up-to-date genetic technologies
is essential; experience in cell biology, flow-cytometry and immunological assays is preferred.
Solid experience in working with CROs on bioanalytical projects, managing timelines and
deliverables in support of preclinical and clinical drug development studies.
Knowledge of global regulatory guidelines, expectations and corresponding industry’s best
practices and working experience in a regulated laboratory environment is an asset.
Experience with software for data analysis or other statistical analysis software.
At least 3 years leading a team and managing bioanalytical assays.Experience in supporting assay development, validation, and sample testing either in house or at
external CROs, using bioanalytical and biomarker assays in regulated nonclinical and clinical
studies. Experience in inflammatory bowel diseases is an asset.
Hands on experience in a broad range of molecular biology and bioanalytical assay methods/
platforms (e.g. RT-qPCR, potency)
SKILLS
Ability to develop solutions to diverse problems, including identifying methods for experimental
design which may require complex planning and cross-functional collaboration.
Excellent verbal and written communication, collaboration across disciplines, and organization
skills and ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic team environment.
Goal-oriented, quality-conscientious, and team-focusedExcellent technical scientific writingDemonstrated hands-on team leadership skillsComplex problem-solving abilityProven ability to work under pressure and with short deadlines to accomplish objectives
Demonstrated ability to think strategically when planning, managing teams, and managing
processes
Attention to detail and accuracyAble to present complex problems and conclusions to a variety of audiences.Bilingualism (English and French).

Job Description

We are a fast growing mobile DSP (Demand Side Platform) building out a next-generation real-time bidding platform. We are a small team of hard working individuals who are not scared to roll up our sleeves to solve problems. We pride ourselves on our ability to jump into any problem no matter the difficulty.

Our ideal candidate is someone who loves to learn, who is not confined to one language, can jump in anywhere to solve problems, and does not back into a corner when faced with a complex technical challenge. This is a software engineer position for our distributed real-time bidding platform. Although experience is desired in this domain, it is not a requirement. The only requirement is that you have development experience and an aptitude to always learn and improve.

Your role will require you to architect, design, test and deploy components that fit well within our micro services architecture eco system. Our components need to be robust and highly optimized in order to handle high volume of traffic.

Responsibilities:
Work on Real-time Bidding (RTB) and programmatic advertising platform
Design and code real-time distributed systems

Identify bottlenecks and propose solutions to resolve them

Learn and integrate with new tools

NoSQL databases
Familiarity with the RTB Advertising space
Some background in statistics

Who We Are

Native Touch is a smart mobile focused start-up, with an entrepreneurial culture. We are looking for employees who thrive in that environment, want to challenge themselves, and have a positive impact on the business. Our team members are a great mix of organized, disciplined and results focused individuals. But more importantly, we are visionaries with fun and creative minds.

Since 2010, Native Touch’s clients have taken us along for the ride while experimenting, measuring and scaling their evolving mobile ad spends both at Enterprise and Consumer levels. We have a growing technical team of skilled engineers and scientists developing solutions in the mobile advertising and marketing fields. The commercial team at Native Touch is made up of media strategists focused on helping brands innovate in the mobile media landscape. We have momentum and are looking to add the right talent to our strong, skilled team in the role of a Software Engineer. This position is located in Montreal.

Work for a successful start-up and enjoy the benefits of using your technical skills and creativity, working on a broad range of projects, and earning a competitive compensation package.

Job Description
Located in Vancouver B.C. TICit Hub is an enterprise SaaS provider for the Inspection Industry working with large Oil and Gas as well as Mining and Agriculture companies.

Our clients include global giants such as BP, Chevron, Exxon and Shell. Our applications track and monitor cargo movements across the globe, helping the industry reduce loss and waste. In addition, our unique data provides insights into the worldwide commodity market that no other company can match.
We are looking for talented full stack engineers; if you have a passion for software development, we’d love to hear from you as we have a mixture of problems we need to solve across the industry.
In this role, you will be a critical component in the evolution of TICit Hub's technology and products. To support our growth ambitions, we are developing a completely new set of SaaS applications and services as well as new data products for commodity and market traders.
Using the latest web technologies, we are enabling quick-learning team players to shine in a fast-paced environment. Seismic Monitoring Services Division

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced senior science and product development manager to join our rapidly expanding team.
You will manage a team of scientists, software engineers and geophysical data analysts tasked with the design, development and delivery of turnkey passive seismic monitoring solutions for a wide range of applications.

Responsibilities:
Alongside the product team you will work to help lead geophysical product development
Participate in geophysical product definition and management
Lead delivery of standard geophysical products to external clients
Lead scientific research and publishing function
Generate geophysical product roadmaps that closely align with company business objectives and oversee all aspects of their implementation including technology research, prototyping, development, testing, technology transfer and technical sales/marketing support

Turnstone Biologics Inc. is the leading virus-based immunoncology biotechnology company developing novel oncolytic vaccine therapeutics for cancer patients. Our first-in-class platform technology attacks tumours using a two-pronged approach: targeted and robust tumour killing using an oncolytic virus, in combination with a cancer vaccine that generates long-lasting anti-tumour immune responses. Turnstone is building a world-class, high-performing team that embraces being a learning organization with a sense of urgency. Turnstone has a seasoned board of directors and venture capital partners, is enrolling clinical studies, has a rich development portfolio, and highly active R&D efforts led by a world-class scientific management team. Turnstone is co-located in Ottawa, Canada and New York, USA. For more information, please visit www.turnstonebio.com or email info@turnstonebio.com.
How do you know if you’re the right fit?
Imagine coming to work every day where over-communication, transparency, teaching, listening, asking, thinking, working hard, and having fun are normal – actually, expected? Imagine having a coach, mentor, peers, and partners where candid feedback, self-improvement, risk taking, failing, learning from that failing, and succeeding are what we call ‘another Thursday at Turnstone’? At Turnstone, the science drives decision making, and our drugs are designed with the patient in mind. Like the disease we’re fighting, our platform is complex, and transformative. If you’re a passionate person, and our science excites you – this opportunity may be for you.
If you are interested in being a part of a growing Technical Operations team, then this role may be for you! As the Manager of Formulation and Drug Product Development, you will provide leadership, plan, direct, and coordinate all Drug Product development efforts to support our viral-based platforms. Reporting to the Director of Bioprocess Development & Manufacturing Sciences, you and your team will be responsible for:

Manage DP development for entire portfolio of viral products
Plan and direct lab experiments, with 1 reporting FTE by end of 2019
Manage DP development at our external CRO partners
Drive development of improved viral delivery systems (IV infusion, IT or IM injections) to enable optimization of pharmacy DP handling and administration
Work closely with the Analytical Development team to ensure appropriate and robust assays are developed to enable stability testing of our DPs
Lead all aspects of pre-formulation and formulation development across a range of DP images (liquid, and lyophilisation)
Drive to definition of DP critical quality attributes through forced degradation studies and advanced analytical tools
Travel required, 10%
Participation in regulatory strategy and document authoring/reviewing for interactions with FDA, EMA, and Health Canada
Present trended data, and recommendations in a cross functional Project Team

What’s in it for you?
In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop your ability to think both strategically and drive fast-paced execution. With our company size and growth we will give you plenty of opportunities for you to be an inspirational and collaborative co-functional leader. Passionate about being a part of a critical function of a growing company and continuous learning? We will have plenty of that for you!

We are in the early stages of building strategies, structures and process so this role will be busy and expanding. We also have opportunities for you to be a mentor to other team members. You would have the opportunity to create something new and ‘WOW!’ all of us and grow right along with the company.
The Details
This role is best suited for someone with the following:

7+ years of overall experience within the biotech/pharmaceutical industry
Scientist with advanced degree (MSc or PhD)
Educated in one of the following fields: chemistry, biochemistry, virology, biotechnology
Experience working with live virus formulations
Experience designing, and planning accelerated studies to evaluate degradation pathways to define CQAs
Strong interpersonal skills, and ability to manage several projects
Leadership experience preferred

To Apply:
Please forward applications via email only to hr@turnstonebio.com including a cover letter and resume. In the e-mail subject line, please indicate the position title Manager, Formulation and Drug Product Development.
Turnstone Biologics welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected will be invited for an interview.

Unity is seeking an experienced, accomplished in-house Sourcer. We are a high-energy, highly collaborative team that moves in a fast-paced environment doing impactful work for Unity, one of the world's most innovative and exciting companies.

We're working to grow a technology business that is pushing the boundaries of conventional content creation, engaging some of the world's most talented Software Engineers, Designers, Data Scientists (and many more) to build a platform that reaches billions of people worldwide.

Responsibilities


Identify and engage diverse, talented individuals who can contribute meaningfully to teams at Unity
Build a pipeline of top diverse talent through direct sourcing
Qualify potential candidates for technical fit
Collaborate with other sourcers throughout the world
Work closely with hiring managers, recruiting & HR leadership, and in house recruiters

Requirements


Technical sourcing experience
Ability to build and maintain a long-term pipeline for hard-to-fill roles
Experience with diversity and inclusion sourcing strategy and hiring and/or have a passion for making a difference
Experience using Recruiting Software, websites, boolean searches and advanced sourcing techniques to manage candidate pipelines, talent pool and analyze data to create insights

Bonus Points


Excellent communication skills - to deliver complex information effectively, and engage colleagues from around the world within Unity
Self starting attitude and organizational skills to work autonomously, in line with our empowered working culture
Curious about designing creative sourcing strategies that address both short-term and long-term hiring needs across all job levels

Who we are

Unity is the creator of the world's most widely-used real-time 3D (RT3D) development platform, providing content creators around the world with the tools they need to build rich, interactive 2D, 3D, VR and AR experiences. In fact, apps made with Unity reach 2.7 billion devices worldwide, and were installed more than 24 billion times in the last 12 months.

The global engineering team keeps Unity at the forefront of technology and — working alongside partners like Magic Leap, Google, Facebook, Oculus and Microsoft — ensures optimized support for the latest technology and platforms. Unity is powering the real-time revolution, expanding beyond games and breaking into other industries including automotive, film, architecture, engineering, construction and more.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

#LI-ER1 #SEN

Unity recherche un sourceur expérimenté et accompli. Nous sommes une équipe très collaborative et énergique qui évolue dans un environnement en évolution rapide et réalise un travail percutant pour Unity, l'une des sociétés les plus innovantes et les plus passionnantes au monde.

Nous travaillons au développement d'une entreprise technologique qui repousse les limites de la création de contenu conventionnelle en faisant appel à certains des plus talentueux ingénieurs en génie logiciel, concepteurs, scientifiques du monde de l'information (et bien d'autres encore) pour créer une plate-forme pouvant atteindre des milliards de personne dans le monde.

Responsabilités


Identifier et engager des individus talentueux et divers qui peuvent contribuer de manière significative aux équipes d'Unity
Construire un pipeline de talents diversifiés grâce à un sourçage direct
Qualifier les candidats potentiels pour un ajustement technique
Collaborer avec d'autres fournisseurs à travers le monde
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les responsables du recrutement, les responsables du recrutement et des ressources humaines et les recruteurs internes.

Compétences


Expérience en sourcing technique
Capacité à construire et à maintenir un pipeline à long terme pour des rôles difficiles à pourvoir
Expérience en stratégie d'approvisionnement en matière de diversité et d'inclusion et d'embauche et/ou passion pour faire une différence
Expérience dans l'utilisation de logiciels de recrutement, de sites Web, de recherches booléennes et de techniques d'approvisionnement avancées pour gérer les pipelines candidats, le groupe de talents et l'analyse de données afin de créer des connaissances

Atouts


Excellentes compétences en communication - pour fournir efficacement des informations complexes et impliquer des collègues du monde entier au sein d'Unity
Attitude de départ et compétences organisationnelles pour travailler de manière autonome, conformément à notre culture de travail responsabilisée
Curieux de concevoir des stratégies d'approvisionnement créatives qui répondent aux besoins d'embauche à court et à long terme pour tous les niveaux d'emploi.

Qui sommes-nous

Nous sommes une entreprise orientée vers le produit, nous sommes curieux et créatifs. Afin de permettre à Unity d'évoluer avec les progrès, d'être plus conviviale et d'élargir ses marchés, nous réinvestissons continuellement dans le développement. Avec plus d'un milliard d'installations par mois, Unity rejoint autant les joueurs que les amateurs. En plus de nos jeux vidéo, nos logiciels sont utilisés dans des secteurs aussi variés que la médecine, la visualisation et le commerce. Ces logiciels contribuent à démocratiser le développement des jeux, permettent de résoudre des problèmes et favorisent la réussite d'un grand nombre de développeurs à l'échelle mondiale.

Aujourd'hui, Unity compte plus de 15 succursales dans le monde et ses employés sont répartis dans 23 pays. Les employés de Unity Technologies sont passionnés et dynamiques, il ne suffit plus de savoir faire le travail, nous sommes à la recherche de candidats qui souhaitent se dépasser, surmonter des obstacles et qui ont de grands rêves!

Unity est un employeur axé sur l'égalité des chances qui s'engage à favoriser un environnement inclusif et innovateur avec les meilleurs employés. Par conséquent, nous fournissons des opportunités d'emploi sans tenir compte de l'âge, la race, la couleur, l'ascendance, l'origine nationale, la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l'identité sexuelle ou l'expression, l'orientation sexuelle ou tout autre statut protégé. S'il y a des préparatifs que nous pouvons faire pour vous aider à avoir une expérience d'entrevue confortable et positive, veuillez-nous le faire savoir.

Les chasseurs de têtes et les agences de recrutement ne peuvent pas soumettre résumes/CV par ce site Web ou directement aux superviseurs. Unity n'accepte pas des chasseurs de têtes non sollicités et des résumés (CV) d'agence. L'unité ne payera pas d'honoraires à aucune agence tierce ou entreprise qui n'a pas signé d'ententes avec Unity.

Product Compliance Engineer-SCI002864

About Us
SCIEX – An operating company within Danaher’s Life Sciences platform

SCIEX helps to improve the world we live in by enabling scientists and laboratory analysts to find answers to the complex analytical challenges they face. Our leadership in LC-MS and CE-MS have made us a trusted partner globally to those who are focused on basic research, drug discovery, food and environmental testing, forensic toxicology, clinical research and diagnostics. With over 40 years of innovation, we continue to redefine what is achievable in routine and complex analysis.

We are seeking smart, team-oriented people who have purpose and are committed to helping us deliver Answers for Science. Knowledge for Life. ™ Our global team, located on every continent, is our greatest strength, bringing diverse perspectives and breakthrough thinking. With the power of the Danaher Business System behind us, it’s our people who have made us the industry leader. Come join our winning team. Visit us at www.sciex.com.

Sciex offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to associates' and their families' lives.

Sciex is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Join our winning team and Follow us on LinkedIn!

Description
Ensure adherence to product compliance based on corporate policy, international regulations and standards. Includes liaising with other teams.
Generate data and reports relating to product compliance for use in reporting SCIEX status to countries and regions.
Research and collect component compliance documentation.
Generate and update test reports for new or existing products pertaining to product safety, electromagnetic compatibility, packaging and environmental compliance.
Assist senior team associates testing new or existing products or assemblies for compliance.
Support the operation of the product compliance lab to maintain accreditations.

Qualifications
Master/ Bachelors’ Degree in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering
Over 5 years of experience in a design or product compliance environment.
Experience generating detailed engineering reports.
Working knowledge of international compliance standards (e.g. CSA, CEN, IEC, UL) and their application.
Over 3 years of experience involving product safety and/or EMI/EMC testing is an asset.
Familiarity with analytical instruments or medical device development is an asset.
Strong knowledge and use of Microsoft Excel and Word.
Strong research skills.
Detail oriented.
Strong communication skills.
Leadership - ability to lead small teams on specific initiatives.
Strong project management skills to estimate, report status, and deliver individual assigned tasks.
Strong self-starter.
Experience working in an ISO 9001/17025/13485 based quality management system environment.

At Danaher, we are dedicated to building and sustaining a truly diverse and inclusive culture. These are not just words on a page—Diversity and Inclusion is a top priority for the company, and it ties deeply to each of our core values. Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law.

Danaher Corporation Overview
Danaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide. Our world class brands are leaders in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including life sciences, medical diagnostics, dental, environmental and applied solutions. Our globally diverse team of 67,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our competitive advantage. We generated $18.3B in revenue last year. We are ranked #162 on the Fortune 500 and our stock has outperformed the S&P 500 by more than 1,200% over 20 years.
At Danaher, you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate. Our brands allow us to offer dynamic careers across multiple industries. We’re innovative, fast-paced, results-oriented, and we win. We need talented people to keep winning. Here you’ll learn how DBS is used to shape strategy, focus execution, align our people, and create value for customers and shareholders. Come join our winning team.

Are you passionate about data and not afraid of searching for a needle in a stack of hay? Does developing pricing techniques give you goosebumps? Do you get excited when discovering a new piece of data that could potentially drive better business results or make customers happy? Can you create Harry Potter like magic with Excel?

Join an exciting team of actuaries, data scientists and engineers at the forefront of a company who is starting to leverage data to better drive decisions at every level of our organization. Our aim is to change how we do insurance and you can help us.

We have:
An open mind for new ideas and methodologies – you will prepare basic reports in product pricing and/or underwriting analysis as well as maintain monitoring reports for analyzing company underwriting and claims experience.
A great team and collaborative work environment – you will work closely with the team and underwriting departments to provide pricing support for personal insurance products
Advanced pricing and collaboration tools – you will develop actuarial pricing techniques that support the nationwide pricing initiatives for Leisure and Lifestyle products and maintain the quality and integrity of our actuarial database
A culture of personal and professional development – with the size of our department and company, you will have broad opportunities to gain experience in different areas/roles.

We expect:
Strong mathematical and statistical background
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Proficiency in programming
Experience with MS Access, SAS and VBA is an asset

Your skillset includes:
Bachelor degree in Actuarial Science, Math or Statistics
Minimum of 2 CAS exams
Minimum of 1 year of Actuarial work experience
Ability to communicate well and present ideas/decisions clearly

Additional Information

Aviva Canada is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during all phases of the hiring process including the application process. If you require an accommodation because of a disability, we will work with you to meet your needs. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance. If you are selected for an interview and require an accommodation, you are encouraged to advise the Talent Acquisition Partner who will consult with you to determine an appropriate accommodation
