job_title: Quality Control Analyst, Master Cell Bank
job_description:
STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.

Job Description Summary
Currently, we have an opening for a QC Analyst, Master Cell Bank in our Quality Control Department, for the Vancouver office. The QC Analyst must be proficient in laboratory techniques and have direct working experience in handling cell cultures and performing related tasks using aseptic technique. Responsible for preparing and testing master and working cell banks; sub-cloning and isotyping of hybridomas; and testing of finished products, in-process products and raw materials, including all analysis and documentation. May also perform experiments related to troubleshooting, stability testing and product-related issues.

Job Description

Duties and Responsibilities
Perform all aspects of cell culture and maintenance from thawing through cryopreservation of cells following good cell culture practice guidelines.
Perform a variety of cell based and analytical assays to evaluate in-process materials and products according to established Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
Perform specialized tissue culture assays and techniques including monitoring cell proliferation, confluence, morphological assessment, cell health and stability of mammalian and human cell lines.
Perform sub cloning of hybridomas and evaluate supernatant antibody specificity.
Media and reagent preparation for conducting any assay as described. Preparation of cells to meet various project demands.
Participate in the development or improvement of QC testing procedures, including writing or revising SOPs and working documents, reports or templates.
Participation in and compliance to QMS.
Investigate and document out-of-specification results and non-conformances to support and maintain Quality Systems requirements.
Analyze data and accurately complete QC testing reports using good documentation practices.
Apply a quality mindset and critical thinking skills to all aspects of work conducted.
Communicate with supervisors and coworkers to promote a safe and cooperative working environment.

Qualifications

BSc or technical degree in Biology, Biochemistry or relevant area with emphasis on Cell Biology
Minimum 2 years lab-based work experience in a cell culture environment
Excellent laboratory skills including aseptic technique
Experience with live-cell imaging, ELISA, iso-typing is highly desirable
Ability to work with precision and accuracy
Excellent attention-to-detail and record-keeping skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Familiarity with ISO 13485 standards, Quality Systems and writing Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)
Demonstrated ability to work cooperatively in a team setting
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and Google Applications

This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

Job SummaryRBR creates instruments to measure the blue planet. From the ocean abyss to the polar ice cap, our sensors track water parameters such as temperature, depth, salinity, dissolved gases, and many others. Leading scientists and engineers from around the world are using RBR equipment to answer important environmental questions. RBR equipment is enabling researchers to develop innovative measurement solutions that are deployed in the surf zone, mounted on underwater drones, dropped out of planes, towed behind boats, and sent to the bottom of the ocean.Are you a scientist or engineer that wants to do more? Do you want to get involved with more innovative projects? Do you want to travel to more conferences, visit really cool labs and connect with great people? Do you want to throw really accurate and valuable equipment into the ocean, out of a plane, or strapped to the back of a robot - perhaps never to be seen again? Do you want to have a fun career while doing meaningful work to make a difference to people and the planet?We are seeking a creative and outstanding West Coast Technical Sales Manager to support our customers and continue to fuel our rapid growth. The ideal location would be British Columbia, Seattle, or southern California; working from a home office or creating a satellite RBR office close to a key customer group. You will be joining a great team of respected technical sales and engineering professionals in this fantastic opportunity for personal and professional growth, and to make a difference to the future of our world.RBR has a rich 45 year history as a privately-owned Kanata, Ontario based company that is continuing to experience strong growth. We have achieved 20% annual growth over the last five years and, with your help, we expect this to continue as we overtake the market leader and expand our product line and international reach. RBR has been recognized twice as one of Canada’s Fastest-Growing Companies by Growth 500 and has won a Best Ottawa Business Award.Come join us! We provide a balanced work environment complete with a competitive compensation package including bonus and benefits.Now that we have you interested, take a look at the required key responsibilities and qualifications.Job Type / CategoryPermanent Full-Time based in British Columbia, Seattle, or Southern CaliforniaKey Responsibilities: Executes the full technical sales cycle, including:Prospecting new business opportunitiesSetting up and managing customer meetingsResponding to customer inquiriesPresenting unique, competitive capabilities of relevant instrumentationWriting basic quotations as well as complex proposalsFollowing up all communicationsEngage in collaborative projects with customers and present results at technical conferencesDevelop and host technical workshops for academic and commercial customersTravel approximately one week each month to customer meetings, conferences and workshopsRequired Education, Skills and QualificationsUndergraduate or graduate degree in oceanography, marine science, engineering or related fieldThree years relevant scientific research, engineering, or technical sales experience in North AmericaExperience collecting and analyzing ocean science dataEnergetic personality and confidence when approaching new people and organizations to forge new relationshipsConfident public speaking, demonstrated technical writing, and ability to develop and present information in a clear and compelling mannerMotivated self-starter with drive to pursue new areas and gain understandingIntegrity and ethical approach in decision-making, communications, and actionsExcellent command of the English language (oral and written)Must demonstrate "Sales DNA" is in your bloodTo apply, please prepare a cover letter that references RBR, how you are uniquely qualified for this role, what makes you exceptional and what will make you an outstanding part of the RBR team.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Oceanography: 1 year (Required)

Job Description

-

WD30055887296

What you will do:
In this role you will be part of a growing team of
engineers working in a tight knit, highly focused, agile development team.

The
TSP Intrusion Innovation team, based in Toronto, is creating proof-of-concept
intrusion detection products based on leading edge sensing and communication
technologies that would be used in commercial or residential settings.

You will be involved in the design, development, debugging and testing
of sophisticated distributed computing systems utilizing both distributed
embedded systems and cloud based computing resources to derive valuable
information and insight from these sensors. A high degree of focus will be
placed on user interaction and engagement of these systems.

You will work within a multi-disciplined
engineering team consisting of electronics engineers, firmware engineers,
software engineers, programmers and scientists focusing on developing
proof-of-concepts aimed at creating new and improved products and solutions for
our customers.

Architect and rapidly design/develop
applications and solutions to support ‘proof-of-concept’ development.

Maintain a ‘learn fast’ attitude with a focus
on quickly progressing through a concept phase.

Be involved in concept design, brainstorming,
research, etc. required to create new concepts for consideration.

The software that the team works on will not typically become
production software. The successful
candidates will have a ‘hacker’ mentality that can envision and deliver code
quickly and iteratively to changing priorities and objectives. We are looking
for innovative, non-linear coders who have the ability to look at things from a
different angle and thrive in unstructured environments.

How you will do it:
Assume a
design/architecture lead role for back-end cloud and overall solution
development. Provide leadership and mentoring to other developers

Provide continuous feedback and idea
generation for improved product development

Identify and develop opportunities for
patents and intellectual property

The Sr. Cloud Software Developer will lead in the design, architecture,
and prototyping of proof-of-concept intrusion detection systems and will also
participate in other critical activities such as difficult problem solving,
research into new important technologies, etc.

Moderate supervision with a requirement to highlight problems and help
in finding solutions

Occasional Domestic and International
Travel Required

Will follow workplace EHS procedures and maintain a safety workplace

Report all workplace accidents and incidents to your manager

Will work toward
achieving environmental and sustainability goals for the site

Qualifications

What we look for:
Required Skills/Experience

Significant direct
experience (3+ years) and expertise in software development with cloud-based
systems.

Extensive experience with building RESTful APIs and deploying Cloud
Services. Experience in multiple cloud environments (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud,
etc).

Preferred Skills/Experience

Experience with connected devices/IOT
(protocols, environments, ecosystems), analytics, big data, or deep learning/AI
is desired.

Experience with developing serverless solutions leveraging Managed IoT solution
offerings is preferred.

Experience in Big Data technologies
(e.g. Storm, Spark, Kafka, Flume etc.) is a plus

Excellent
problem solving skills. Most of the problems that the team will be responsible
for solving will be the most challenging type

without cookbook solutions.

Ability to apply innovative
thinking and exploration of non-traditional ideas in solving business problems.
Adapts readily to changing work demands; maintains composure under pressure.

A team player with a strong group and organizational
identity. Must be collaborative

and inclusive.

Mobile Application development experience is a benefit.

Knowledge/experience
in Software project management, Agile Development, networking protocols, or
Software testing is desired.

Description

XPERI is looking for a Principal Scientist/Engineer to join our highly skilled Machine Learning team within the Office of the CTO. The ideal candidate is expected to assume a technical leadership role in cutting edge research that will drive the next generation of XPERI AI/ML products.

She/he will have a proven record of having worked on advanced research topics in areas such as Pattern Recognition, Image Recognition, Natural Language Processing, Information Theory, Data Science, Deep Learning, Probability/Statistics, Classification, Large-Scale Optimization, and Audio/Imaging signal processing. Strong understanding of how research is turned into successful products is also required for this position. In addition, the candidate is expected to demonstrate a structured and very detail-oriented approach to their work and follow rigorous scientific and engineering approaches.
The ideal candidate will be self-motivated and focused, comfortable collaborating with geographically dispersed teams, passionate about AI and ML, a team player, and eager to make a difference as a member of a motivated team of ML researchers and practitioners. Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, excellent written and spoken communication skills, and a strong drive to solve problems and disrupt the status quo are also required for this position.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Develop state of the art algorithms, theories, and methods that can solve real-world, large-scale AI/ML problems.
Maintain and update existing ML algorithms/theories/methods.
Generate technical documentation and test procedures in support of produced research.
Collaborate with other teams of the organization to ensure successful commercialization, deployment, and maintenance of developed algorithms and methods.
Contribute to the IP portfolio of the company.
Be an active member of the AI/ML community by writing papers, attending conventions, etc.
Stay up to date with the latest relevant research and trends and perform critical analysis of the competitive landscape.
Maintain detailed records of work and produce technical reports and presentations for other groups of the organization.
Education and Experience
Graduate degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field with at least 6 years of experience for Master’s holders or at least 3 years of experience for PhD holders.
Proven record of having developed state of the art algorithms, theory, and or methods in one of the areas of interest listed in the job description.
Experience with at least one Machine Learning framework such as Caffe or TensorFlow is preferred.
Strong coding skills in at least two of C/C++, Python, R, Scala.
Linux and experience with CUDA are a plus.
Good understanding of fixed-point coding and/or hardware implementations is preferred.
Familiarity with at least one version control system, preferably Git.
A record of patents and/or publications is preferred.
Agile/Kanban development expertise is preferred.
Familiarity with Atlassian Data Center applications is preferred.
Other Skills and Abilities
Fluent knowledge of Microsoft Office.
Project management skills.
Windows/PC and/or Mac regular user.
Experience with applications such as Zoom, Slack, OnTrax.
Demonstrated interest and passion for any of audio and/or imaging applications, IoT, AR/VR/MR, Autonomous Driving, etc.
Demonstrated ability to multi-task and work with little supervision.
Work Environment
This position involves working mainly in a typical desk/office environment, but it can also involve working in a lab setting. Travel to other XPERI offices may be required occasionally.
Location
Can be located in any of the following offices: Vancouver, BC | San Jose, CA | Calabasas, CA | Santa Ana, CA | Poway, CA

job_title: Senior Software Developer - Natural Language Understanding
job_description:
Overview
Join the Intuit Platform Natural-Language Understanding (NLU) team as Senior Software Developer to accelerate the next generation of conversational experiences across Intuit’s products. As part of the team, you will work with product managers, data scientists, and machine learning engineers to rapidly deliver natural language solutions for Intuit’s Conversational UI and Search products. NLU is at the intersection of exciting progress in machine learning, computer science and user experience. Be ready to learn fast and boldly innovate beyond the currently accepted normal.
Responsibilities
Working together with the team: deeply understand customer problems and deliver major features to delight them
Go-to expert for major features and tech stack
End to end ownership of major features in ML data ingestion/training pipelines and web applications: design, develop, test automation, document, delivery, and operate

Roughly 80% hands-on coding. Deliver and review for awesome code with attention to quality, scalability, maintainability and performance.
Design and plan technical solutions so the team can work together with speed
Accurately scope effort, identify risks and clearly communicate trade-offs
Identify and resolve cross team dependencies to unblock the team
Proactively look for ways to improve code, processes and team
Qualifications
BS/MS in computer science/engineering or equivalent work experience
Expert software development fundamentals and their practical application
Strong problem solving and communication skills
5+ years of experience developing web applications
Expert knowledge of backend software development using Java Spring to expose and consume RESTful web services, Async message queues/topics
Understand machine learning principles (e training, validation, etc.) and/or information retrieval principles (indexing, relevance, etc.)
Basic knowledge of machine learning techniques (i.e. classification, regression, and clustering)
Working knowledge of data querying and data processing tools (e SQL, Python, NumPy)
Working knowledge of AWS development and operations
Nice to have: High level understanding of Natural Language Understanding
Nice to have: experience building chatbots
Nice to have: experience building search engines
Hungry to continuously learn
Boldly innovate beyond what is the currently accepted

Accelerate Your Career
Drive global technology
With more than $2 billion in revenues, CDK Global is a leading global provider of integrated information technology and digital marketing solutions to the automotive retail and adjacent industries. Focused on enabling end-to-end automotive commerce, CDK provides solutions to dealers in more than 100 countries around the world, serving approximately 28,000 retail locations and most automotive manufacturers. CDK Global solutions automate and integrate critical processes from pre-sale targeted advertising to the sale, financing, insurance, parts supply, repair and maintenance of vehicles, with an increasing focus on utilizing data analytics and predictive intelligence.
We’re large enough to make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. This means that we are an organization where every person matters. You can make an impact on the success of our business and that of our customers regardless of what career you decide to pursue.
From data scientists to sales and client service experts, we’re hiring to support your growth and ours - Green light your career.
CDK Global is pursuing candidates who possess expertise in Sales, Accounting and/or Fixed Operations within the automotive industry.

. Confer with client on best practices and workflow in support of major CDK solutions. Leveraging expertise and exercising discretion to ensure that the CDK configurations align with the client business requirements.
. Determines utilization and process workflow gaps to close that will maximize application use to drive dealership’s efficiency, profits, sales, productivity and revenue.

Qualifications and Experience:
. Bachelor Degree or equivalent experience
. Minimum 5 years industry or dealership experience required.
. Travel - 80% plus
. Prefer French-English bilingual
CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work. You have family, friends, sporting events, and lots of things going on. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to not only take care of you but your family as well. All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment including RRSP matching, paid time off to re-energize, donate your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement to name a few.
At CDK, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or veteran status. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

XPERI is looking for a Principal Scientist/Engineer to join our highly skilled Machine Learning team within the Office of the CTO. The ideal candidate is expected to assume a technical leadership role in cutting edge research that will drive the next generation of XPERI AI/ML products.

She/he will have a proven record of having worked on advanced research topics in areas such as Pattern Recognition, Image Recognition, Natural Language Processing, Information Theory, Data Science, Deep Learning, Probability/Statistics, Classification, Large-Scale Optimization, and Audio/Imaging signal processing. Strong understanding of how research is turned into successful products is also required for this position. In addition, the candidate is expected to demonstrate a structured and very detail-oriented approach to their work and follow rigorous scientific and engineering approaches.
The ideal candidate will be self-motivated and focused, comfortable collaborating with geographically dispersed teams, passionate about AI and ML, a team player, and eager to make a difference as a member of a motivated team of ML researchers and practitioners. Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, excellent written and spoken communication skills, and a strong drive to solve problems and disrupt the status quo are also required for this position.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Develop state of the art algorithms, theories, and methods that can solve real-world, large-scale AI/ML problems.
Maintain and update existing ML algorithms/theories/methods.
Generate technical documentation and test procedures in support of produced research.
Collaborate with other teams of the organization to ensure successful commercialization, deployment, and maintenance of developed algorithms and methods.
Contribute to the IP portfolio of the company.
Be an active member of the AI/ML community by writing papers, attending conventions, etc.
Stay up to date with the latest relevant research and trends and perform critical analysis of the competitive landscape.
Maintain detailed records of work and produce technical reports and presentations for other groups of the organization.
Education and Experience
Graduate degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field with at least 6 years of experience for Master’s holders or at least 3 years of experience for PhD holders.
Proven record of having developed state of the art algorithms, theory, and or methods in one of the areas of interest listed in the job description.
Experience with at least one Machine Learning framework such as Caffe or TensorFlow is preferred.
Strong coding skills in at least two of C/C++, Python, R, Scala.
Linux and experience with CUDA are a plus.
Good understanding of fixed-point coding and/or hardware implementations is preferred.
Familiarity with at least one version control system, preferably Git.
A record of patents and/or publications is preferred.
Agile/Kanban development expertise is preferred.
Familiarity with Atlassian Data Center applications is preferred.
Other Skills and Abilities
Fluent knowledge of Microsoft Office.
Project management skills.
Windows/PC and/or Mac regular user.
Experience with applications such as Zoom, Slack, OnTrax.
Demonstrated interest and passion for any of audio and/or imaging applications, IoT, AR/VR/MR, Autonomous Driving, etc.
Demonstrated ability to multi-task and work with little supervision.
Work Environment
This position involves working mainly in a typical desk/office environment, but it can also involve working in a lab setting. Travel to other XPERI offices may be required occasionally.
Location
Can be located in any of the following offices: Vancouver, BC | San Jose, CA | Calabasas, CA | Santa Ana, CA | Poway, CA

job_title: Fisheries Ecology and Management Biologist, Department of Biological Sciences, Faculty of Science
job_description:
Position Overview
The Department of Biological Sciences in the Faculty of Science invites applications for a Fisheries Ecology & Management Biologist. This Full-time Fixed Term position is for approximately 2 years (based on length of grant funding), with the possibility of extension.
This role will compile all extant relevant data for Alberta East slopes fisheries, peer-reviewed and grey literature sources. Assess the data for quality based on data source and collection methods. Develop data sets and models to be used to conduct several advanced metacommunity analyses: occupancy models, population viability analyses, and network analyses all requiring advanced and specialized skills. The models will allow for the assessment of each population to risk of extirpation through population decline, introgression with non-native genotypes, and by the specific habitat covariates that are most related to its abundance/presence in the model. The research associate will develop a unique set of mechanistic hypotheses linking stressors and habitat characteristics and their interactions to native salmonid population health. These hypotheses will be tested, by the research associate, using natural experiments that present contrasts that currently exist in the East Slopes landscape. These analyses will provide the models necessary for the research associate to develop an innovative decision framework to prioritize competing management and conservation methods, guide novel restoration methods and design an effective strategic monitoring plan for the East Slopes fisheries.
Position Description
Summary of Key Responsibilities (job functions include but are not limited to):
Build, maintain and manage large and complex fisheries and landscape databases
Apply specialized knowledge to design and carry out novel advanced and complex statistical analyses in R using leading-edge Bayesian approaches
Apply specialized knowledge to design and carry out complex occupancy modelling, population viability analyses and network analyses to design and build innovative decision analysis tools, develop novel restoration techniques and strategic monitoring plans for freshwater fisheries
Lead the research team in identifying priority research areas and disseminate results to the team, external partners and resource management agencies
Lead the research team in the publication of research results in technical peer-reviewed publications
Maintain well-documented spatial databases
Meet with supervisor regularly (e.g. monthly meetings, as well as interactions on a day to day basis) to provide update on status of research results
Presentation of results to the research group in regular lab meetings and to agency collaborators
Presentation of results of the research to national and international conferences
Qualifications / Requirements:
PhD in Fisheries Ecology.
Advanced skills and knowledge of complex statistical and modelling approaches to population and landscape dynamics.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Must be comfortable in leading a diverse research team and have good interpersonal skills.
Ability and willingness to teach and mentor early career scientists (e.g. graduate students) and resource management agency biologists.
Application Deadline: January 22, 2019
We would like to thank all applicants in advance for submitting their resumes. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue on through the selection process will be contacted.
Additional Information
This position is part of the AUPE bargaining unit, and falls under the Technical Job Family, Phase II.
To find out more about management and staff opportunities at the University of Calgary and all we have to offer, view our Management and Staff Careers website. For more information about the Faculty of Science visit Careers in the Faculty of Science.
About the University of Calgary
The University of Calgary is Canada’s leading next-generation university – a living, growing and youthful institution that embraces change and opportunity with a can-do attitude. Located in the nation’s most enterprising city, the university is making tremendous progress on its Eyes High journey to be recognized as one of Canada’s top five research universities, grounded in innovative learning and teaching and fully integrated with the community it both serves and leads. The University of Calgary inspires and supports discovery, creativity and innovation across all disciplines. For more information, visit ucalgary.ca.
The University of Calgary recognizes that a diverse staff/faculty benefits and enriches the work, learning and research experiences of the entire campus and greater community. We are committed to removing barriers that have been historically encountered by some people in our society. We strive to recruit individuals who will further enhance our diversity and will support their professional success while they are here. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however preference will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents of Canada.

At Plenty of Fish we are designing new features and redesigning our applications to make the experience of our millions of current users, and the 50,000+ new daily users, even better.

We are on the hunt for a data-driven Senior Technical Product Manager to drive the design, development, and strategy for a key part of our core product experience in our mobile and web applications used by millions of people every day. We are looking for someone who can understand complex social dynamics and ecosystems, identify new opportunities to deliver great value and excite our users, who is adept at defining and executing a product roadmap, and who will inspire key stakeholders to work towards a common vision.

Sound like you? Great. We want to hear from you.

What will you do?

As one of the largest brands in the Match Group (the owner of Tinder, OkCupid, Match.com), you will be responsible for defining the product vision and executing the product roadmap to achieve that vision for our core product experience.

You create and define "What" and the "Why" as you consume information, both qualitative and quantitative, processing it into a vision and communicating and championing it, while working with the development and design teams who focus on the "how" and "when".

This includes:

End-to-end ownership of your product domain
Leading your cross-functional team to discover and write the job stories, specs, and acceptance criteria for new features and improvements
Conducting rapid iteration, starting with prototyping, all the way through to production A/B experiments then full roll out
Prioritizing the backlog and day to day work for your cross-functional team (Design, Business Analysts, Data Scientists, Engineers, and Ops) to deliver business and customer value on a regular cadence
Monitoring key benchmarks, analytics, and experiment results every day to ensure the health of your product

What does our ideal candidate look like?


Typically 10+ years of experience with 5+ years of direct technical product management experience
Proven history of making data-driven decisions to prioritize and ship products successfully in a high pace environment
Experience building and leading a cross-functional, agile team with many competing priorities and outcomes
Self-starter and independent decision maker
A natural communicator and active listener, who can inspire a team and share a vision to execs
Advanced technical acumen with the ability to dive deep into technology with the Software Engineering team
Strong research, analytical, and problem solving skills
A strong networker, who is active in the tech community

Bonus Points:

Computer Science Degree or equivalent experience as an Engineer
Experience launching a social network or marketplace platform product
Experience with Design Thinking
Engineering Management experience
Startup experience

Why POF?

At Plenty of Fish, the foundation of our success has always been our people, and their dedication to making connections and conversations happen for our users.

Since 2003, we've been growing a team of passionate, driven individuals to build and enhance our platform that's used by millions of people all over the world, every single day.

We've gotten to where we are by cultivating a high-performance culture, operating responsibly, and investing in our technology and our people. At Plenty of Fish, we embrace our work, and relish a cause for celebration.

job_title: Technicien en santé animale (6 mois) / Animal Health Technician (6 months)
job_description: Temporary*** ENGLISH FOLLOWSMissions et responsabilitésLe département biologie (in vivo) de Prometic Biosciences inc. est à la recherche d’un technicien en santé animale pour travailler au sein de son équipe de Laval, Québec. Sous la direction du Chercheur principal, Biologie In Vivo, le titulaire du poste en concert avec le superviseur et l’équipe, effectuer des tests analytiques, à l’animalerie et en laboratoireLes responsabilités du technicien en santé animale comprendront notamment:Utiliser des techniques in vivo de routine liée aux études toxicologique et pharmacologique: manipulation d'animaux de laboratoire, chirurgie, administration de médicaments, dosages biochimiques, criblage, analyse en laboratoire, etc.S’assurer de l’état des animaux et apporter les soins appropriés.Analyser et compiler les résultats produits et les présenter à son superviseur et / ou à l'équipe ou au département.Mettre à jour la base de données de l'entreprise et la base de données du projet à laquelle il est affecté.Rédiger et conserver des dossiers de laboratoire sur les expériences antérieures et les protocoles utilisés.Travaillez avec des pratiques de laboratoire sécuritaires pour lui-même et ses collègues.Maintenir une fonctionnalité de laboratoire complète - entretien et inventaire des machines, des outils de travail, etc.,Élaborer et mettre en œuvre de nouvelles techniques.Effectuer des recherches sur la littérature.Autres tâches / responsabilités connexes requises ou assignées par le superviseur.Expérience, formation et compétences souhaitéesLe candidat sélectionné Technicien en santé animale I doit être titulaire d’un DEC avec peu ou pas d'expérience. job_title: Recherchiste principal-e en TALN / Senior NLP Researcher
job_description:
PermanentSitués à Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Péking, Londres, Paris, Montréal, Toronto et Edmonton, les laboratoires Noah’s Ark forment le laboratoire de recherche phare de Huawei Technologies en intelligence artificielle. Notre mission est de contribuer de façon significative à notre société mais aussi à la société globale en innovant en exploration des données, intelligence artificielle et domaines reliés. Menée principalement par des projets à long-terme ayant des impacts manifestes, la recherche dans nos laboratoires tente de pousser à la fine pointe nos technologies pour les exploiter dans nos produits et services à chaque étape innovante.
Le laboratoire Noah's Ark Montréal offre un nombre de postes scientifiques en recherche dans notre équipe grandissante de la parole et sémantique.
QUALIFICATIONS DE BASE
Détenir un doctorat en informatique, génie, mathématiques appliquées, statistiques ou discipline connexe;
Posséder au moins 3 années d’expériences pertinentes en recherche liée au traitement automatique des langues naturelles (TALN), telle la traduction automatique, les systèmes de dialogue, l’identification de la parole et la synthèse texte-parole;
Détenir au moins 1 an d’expériences avec les outils d’apprentissage profond comme TensorFlow ou Pytorch.

QUALIFICATIONS PRÉFÉRÉES
Solides contributions à des conférences distinguées en TALN.
__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Noah’s Ark Lab is the flagship AI research lab of Huawei Technologies, located in Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Beijing, London, Paris, Montreal, Toronto and Edmonton. Our mission is to make significant contributions to both the company and society by innovating in data mining, artificial intelligence, and related fields. Mainly driven by long term and big impact projects, research in the Lab also tries to advance the state of the art in the fields as well as to harness the products and services of the company, at each stage of the innovation process.
Noah's Ark Lab Montreal offers senior research scientist positions in our growing Speech and Language group to conduct applied research, to advance state-of-the-art in related fields, to collaboratively develop advanced products and services with other groups in the company.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
PhD in computer science, engineering, applied mathematics, statistics or a related field;
3+ years of a relevant experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP) research, such as machine translation, dialog systems, speech recognition and text-to-speech (TTS);
1+ year of experience with deep learning tools such as TensorFlow or Pytorch.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Strong research track record at top NLP and speech conferences.

Finn AI is a rapidly growing fintech company. We build simple, easy-to-use conversational AI platforms exclusively for banks so their customers can manage their money and improve their financial well-being. With customers across four continents, our conversational AI platform is changing the financial lives of people around the world.

Headquartered in beautiful Vancouver BC, Canada - we are growing rapidly with people based in Toronto, New York, and Florida. Our culture is open and we work collaboratively to achieve our goals. Since we are a small (but mighty) team, it is not uncommon to have other Finnians reach out and offer assistance when a deadline looms. In fact, our brand of teamwork is one of the best things about working here.

If you are interested in joining a team of bright and energetic people who are fascinated by conversational AI and the potential it has to deliver meaningful value to people around the world, then read on.

We are looking for a Software Engineer, Application Development to join our Internal Tooling team. This is a unique opportunity as the successful candidate will participate in three burgeoning, cutting-edge aspects of the digital economy:

Being part of FinTech - one of the fastest growing sectors within the digital economy

Working with artificial intelligence and machine learning

Building tools and resources that have an immediate, visible impact

As a Software Engineer at Finn, you will:
Perform end to end engineering of assigned feature and product area from design, develop, test, release, deploy, upgrade and production

When required, participate in production support, including deployment, training, setting up and incident response, in a timely fashion

Develop automation tools to aid development, testing and delivery of customer and product requirements

Perform timely execution of project and sprints, including estimates, status update, and reviews

Strive to be full-stack developers, capable of contributing to the backend, frontend, database, configuration, automation and infrastructure

Collaborate with other engineers, content experts, and UX designers to develop features consistent with our core philosophy and architecture

Uphold the quality of the product or features, including unit test, functional test, integration, performance, security, and scalability

Understand and contribute to company best practices for code quality and velocity
Actively participate in architectural design and decisions, communicate Significance/Impact of a Solution with Management

Produce documentation on the code, system design, architecture and solutions

Your background includes:
Good team player contributing to creating a good team culture in a diverse environment

Strong Experience with Node.js, express, and Python

Ability to define problems and challenges to address as well as experiments to perform

Ability to conduct research and analysis, clearly identify and communicate findings and recommendations.

Good verbal and technical writing skills to document and present your ideas to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

Familiar with software engineering related technical documentation conventions, formats and terminologies

Resourceful and able to get help when needed

Experience in agile methodologies, processes and modern software development toolchains

Experience in common SaaS software testing, automation, build and infrastructures

Experience in current web and microservices technologies and languages

Experience in web application performance, security, and scalability

Experience in good software engineering practices, design patterns, and common systems architecture

Experience in containers and container platforms such as Docker, ECS, and K8s
Familiar with cloud infrastructure services, including AWS, Azure, and GCS

Bonus points:
Experience in designing NLP tools and machine learning systems for business applications

Identify familiar with linguistic rules and features of the language, and adapt language augmentation strategies to cover such cases

Very strong theoretical understanding of deep learning architectures

Ability to apply the latest advances in deep learning to the NLP problem

Experience with chatbot and messaging servers such as FB, Whatsapp

Experience with messaging apps, including web and mobile apps

Experience with creating and documenting versioned API services

About Finn AI:
Finn AI is an award-winning, AI-powered virtual assistant built for personal banking and finance. We put a personal banker in every bank customer’s pocket, helping them to manage their money wherever they are, whatever they need - via a simple, natural conversation.

Our team of data scientists, engineers, and financial industry experts helps banks and credit unions transform customer engagement and increase financial literacy while delivering the convenience and savings of a digital-first experience.

Today we have successful public deployments in three languages with a growing global customer base that includes ATB Financial, Bank of Montreal (BMO), Banpro Grupo Promerica, and Commonwealth Bank.

Package:
Competitive compensation rates and vacation time

Stock options in a fast-growing company

Medical, dental, and extended health benefits

Flexible working hours, a collaborative, team-based environment


To meet our compliance obligations we require successful candidates to undergo security screenings including a criminal record check before coming on board. We focus strictly on offenses that are directly relevant to employment at Finn AI and abide by all applicable human rights and privacy legislation.

Questions? Ask us- we’re here to help.

Vancouver

Department

Engineering

Employment Type

job_title: Sr. Implementation Consultant - French bilingual, Canada - One Eighty Software Expertise
job_description:
Accélérez votre carrière
Technologies globales Drive
Avec des revenus de plus de 2 milliards de dollars, CDK Global est un chef de file mondial en approvisionnement de solutions intégrées de technologies de l’information et de marketing numérique à l’intention des détaillants automobiles et des secteurs connexes. Axée sur la réussite du commerce automobile de bout en bout, CDK fournit des solutions à des concessionnaires situés dans plus de 100 pays à travers le monde, servant approximativement 28 000 détaillants et la plupart des fabricants automobiles. Les solutions CDK Global automatisent et intègrent les processus critiques depuis la publicité numérique prévente ciblée, jusqu’à la vente, le financement, les assurances, l’approvisionnement en pièces, les réparations et l’entretien des véhicules, avec une orientation accrue vers l’utilisation de l’analyse de données et de l’intelligence prédictive.
Nous sommes assez importants pour faire une différence, mais assez modestes pour que votre voix soit entendue. En bref, nous sommes un organisme au sein duquel chacun importe. Il vous est possible d’exercer une influence sur la réussite de notre entreprise ainsi que sur celles de nos clients, peu importe la carrière que vous choisissez de poursuivre.
Accelerate Your Career
Drive global technology
With more than $2 billion in revenues, CDK Global is a leading global provider of integrated information technology and digital marketing solutions to the automotive retail and adjacent industries. Focused on enabling end-to-end automotive commerce, CDK provides solutions to dealers in more than 100 countries around the world, serving approximately 28,000 retail locations and most automotive manufacturers. CDK Global solutions automate and integrate critical processes from pre-sale targeted advertising to the sale, financing, insurance, parts supply, repair and maintenance of vehicles, with an increasing focus on utilizing data analytics and predictive intelligence.
We’re large enough to make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. This means that we are an organization where every person matters. You can make an impact on the success of our business and that of our customers regardless of what career you decide to pursue.
From data scientists to sales and client service experts, we’re hiring to support your growth and ours - Green light your career.
Position Summary
The Sr. Implementation Consultant (IC) is responsible to effectively and efficiently deploy CDK software to our customers working as a key member of the installation team and to train all customers’ users either remotely or on-site.
Position Responsibilities & Essential functions
Provide technical subject matter expertise by engaging with Client Implementation Manager (CIM) to understand business requirements, identify product and product setup requirements to achieve the agreed contractual aims. This includes verifying that the technical solution sold to the client is installable as sold and providing feedback to the CIM on technical gaps and risks.
Guide and advise the customer in terms of best practice operational processes and system usage practices to achieve best ROI for the selected product set
Establish (working with the CIM) the base software installation pack and configure the system to operate as expected.
Perform system integration testing where necessary to ensure the solution delivers what ‘s expected by the client
Manage and execute data migration activities (if required) to ensure the existing customer data is imported, validated and signed off by the customer prior to go-live
Verify with the client through UAT that the system is configured correctly
Execute the cut-over to production on the agreed go-live date
Provide on-site support to end users to guide, advice, train and verify that users are able to undertake their role using the products
Based on business experience and knowledge make best practice recommendations to the CDK configurations and/or client process to maximize client utilization and business results
Collaborate with the CIM and Sales to propose additional CDK software and business solutions to the client based on solid knowledge of the clients processes and business requirements
Escalate to client manager any issues with client engagement during testing and training, or any issues that could derail project success
Qualifications & Job Requirements
French bilingual required
Automotive dealership experience required - One Eighty Software expertise
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience preferred
Experience with executing customer-facing implementation or product delivery projects
Demonstrated experience managing multiple priorities and balancing competing priorities
Excellent interpersonal/communication and presentation skills
Ability to travel 75% of the time
CDK Global sait que des passions vous animent en dehors du travail. La famille, les amis, les événements sportifs et des tas d’autres choses occupent votre vie. C’est pourquoi nous offrons un ensemble exhaustif d’avantages sociaux non seulement pour prendre soin de vous, mais aussi de votre famille. Tous les avantages offerts entrent en vigueur dès le premier jour de votre embauche et incluent un REER avec contribution équivalente, des congés payés pour vous remettre en forme ou faire don de votre temps au sein de votre communauté, et le remboursement de frais de scolarité, pour n’en énumérer que quelques-uns.
Chez CDK, nous nous enorgueillissons de la diversité de nos effectifs. Nous estimons et célébrons le caractère unique de chaque individu et les points de vue variés qu’ils apportent. Nous offrons des chances d’accès égales en matière d’emploi sans égard à la race, la couleur, la religion, le genre, l’identité ou l’expression du genre, l’orientation sexuelle, l’origine nationale, la génétique, l’état de handicap, l’âge, la situation matrimoniale, ou l’état de protection d’anciens combattants.
CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work. You have family, friends, sporting events, and lots of things going on. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to not only take care of you but your family as well. All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment including RRSP matching, paid time off to re-energize, donate your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement to name a few.
At CDK, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or veteran status. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Deeplite is dedicated to the fundamental advancement in the field of artificial intelligence. We are tackling inference optimization of deep neural networks (DNNs), making them faster & energy-efficient from cloud to edge computing. The project is in development phase, where we are implementing academic works and our patent portfolio into our technology. In this role, you will help us to develop and deploy our engine into real world. This is a hands-on role!

We're looking for strong computer science fundamentals and an enthusiasm for system architecture, data and supporting others. You should be passionate about leading conversations on system architecture, implementing clean code, and determined to have a huge impact at Deeplite.

Responsibilities


Participate in the analysis and design phases of the solution
Support the development by working in direct collaboration with the team lead and architects
Design and implement high-quality code
Participate to the tests and deployment of software
Document code and design
Partner with our research scientists in developing underlying infrastructure for production quality models and model pipeline

Qualification


BSc or higher degree in computer science, or related technical field
3-5+ years work experience
Excellent Python skills with dedication to writing clean understandable, testable code with an eye towards maintainability
Ability to lead technical architecture discussions and help drive technical decisions, as well as implement day-to-day changes
Proficiency in a Linux environment and git
Experience with continuous integration and deployment tools
Experience with design and build microservices architecture
Huge plus if experience with deep learning concepts and AI framework such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Caffe, etc.

This is a unique opportunity to change the way DNNs are used in industry and create new opportunities for AI technologies. Your work has the potential to power products and services that millions of users depend on.

STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.

Job Description Summary
The Project Coordinator, Process Development Operations supports the activities of the Process Development Operations Team. This position is responsible for coordinating activities, processes, projects and workflows which support product and process development and improvement through technology transfer and commercialization activities at STEMCELL technologies.

Job Description

Duties and Responsibilities:
Coordinate technology transfer activities, by chairing milestone meetings, preparation of the pre and post documentation for the meetings, promoting collaboration with designates from other departments to trouble shoot and resolve issues and ensure that the product launch adheres to the timeline.
Manage the R&D and PDV product tracking data by maintaining the data quality in the PLM database, and the generation and reporting of metrics pertaining to technology transfer.
Support PDV/operation projects by coordinating the project activities, generation of documentation, and report project progress to the project manager.
Support departmental quality management system and design & development processes through the facilitation of information flow through the process, training and assistance with development procedures, and identifying solutions to remove roadblocks while being compliant to the process.
Provide a channel of communication and centralized information for the program leaders, team members and the organization for the Process Development programs coordinated
Provide regular updates at appropriate levels of detail for different audiences; this may include presenting at team meetings and contributing to corporate or Operations department communications
Ensure departmental work files are up to date, well organized and accurate. Maintains the filing system for the Process Development department.
Participates in other activities as assigned
Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree preferred, with a minimum of 2 years of relevant coordination experience supporting a team or program. (preferrably an undergraduate degree with a BSc or previous experience at a technology company.
Advanced knowledge of Google and MS Office suite of products.
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Highly professional and adaptable with proven judgment and discretion
Proactive, flexible approach with the ability to work cohesively with stakeholders across the organization
Demonstrated initiative and organizational skills, with keen attention to detail
Energetic and enthusiastic with a proven ability to contribute to a positive working environment.
Exceptional time management skills accompanied by good judgment in order to prioritize, multitask and work independently in a fast-paced work environment.
Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities
Project management training, database design and use of MS project/Lucidcharts would be considered a strong asset.

This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.

To apply please select the apply button. You will then be directed to a login screen asking you to set up an account. You must set up an account in order to apply.
Create an account by selecting the create account button. You will then be asked for your email and to create a password. Your Password must be eight characters long, contain at least one special character, one capital letter, and a number.Once you have created your password you will be asked to upload your resume. Uploading your resume will provide the ability to auto-populate your application with information from your resume. If you prefer to manually complete all of the fields in the application you can do this by clicking next. You can upload your cover letter as an attachment in the attachments screen. Thank you for your interest in STEMCELL!

Bachelors or Masters Degree in Computer Science or related field
8+ years of solid experience working in the industry as a Software Engineer, Software Developer, or a related occupation
2+ years of experience in the job offered or a related occupation must involve: designing and developing large-scale, distributed software applications, tools, systems and service.
Strong problem solving, debugging and troubleshooting skills

Just think about what it takes to process the tens of millions of financial transactions that are generated each day as millions of purchases are made, as thousands of suppliers are paid, as inventory moves in and out of warehouses, and as vendors are paid! Are you interested in solving these high volume challenges while pushing the leading edge of cloud computing in the enterprise? Then have we got the opportunity for you! Millions of transactions will actually flow through the code and systems you help develop on a daily basis!

We need strong, innovative engineers to help us mould cloud computing technologies (SQS, S3, EMR, DynamoDB) into the secure, scalable global enterprise financial integration platform that will serve Amazon for the next decade. The complexity of our project requires a team of developers who are interested in working on large scale, highly distributed systems and who can bring new ideas with the confidence to put them to the test as we change the transmission on the rapidly moving bus that is Amazon.

We want hard-core computer scientists who love designing algorithms, choosing optimal data structures, and writing code. Good software design skills are critical to our success. You must be seriously interested in quality. In our space, the academic topics of cloud computing, continuous business activity monitoring, performance optimization, data mining, systems engineering, machine learning, workflow and high-volume transaction processing meet the practical, real-world demands of global financial reporting. We do a lot of tough thinking here and we have great fun doing it.

We are looking to build a cohesive, team-oriented group of developers with someone who shares a passion for developing great software and has the desire to take their technical career to the next level. If you like solving big hairy complex problems, in a challenging environment, we would love to talk with you:
You should be a self-starting, self-directing software development engineer who is creative and passionate about designing, developing, implementing and operating multi-tiered, highly configurable distributed software applications, tools, systems and services. You will be expected to work in a heterogeneous environment of different languages and technologies and bring flexibility, speed and quality to our team. You should have a solid background in the fundamentals of software development, and have a deep understanding of Java/C++ with strong OOAD fundamentals. You will also assist in gathering requirements and will be expected to translate those requirements into technical specifications and design documents.

We are looking for smart engineers who can effectively deal with ambiguity and work independently to clarify requirements and deliver results in a time bound manner. You will be building systems that deal with huge amounts of data in a reliable, accurate and expedient manner. If you have an inclination to learn about Financial transactions and how accounting works for a business, and want apply your technical skills to solve problems in that space, this is the opportunity for you.

ContractDo you believe in the power of teamwork and sharing ideas? Do you take pride in delivering exceptional quality and service with everything you do? Do you seek out ideas for improving the status quo? If you want to make a difference and love being surrounded by the best and the brightest, Maxxam might be the place for you!
Imagine being surrounded by the brightest minds in the industry.
Maxxam Analytics is looking for a
18 MONTH CONTRACT LABORATORY SUPERVISOR – REMOTE LAB
Join our talented team of experts in the scientific field to advance your technical knowledge and advance your career. Every day we go above and beyond to deliver innovative solutions to help our clients make important decisions that directly impact the community and the environment.
DESCRIPTION:
Maxxam has an opportunity for a Laboratory Supervisor at one of our remote laboratories in the Wolf Lake Area. Wolf Lake is located approximately 55 km north of Bonnyville in northeastern Alberta.
Supervisors are key players in instituting corporate Quality and Safety policies and ensuring that our client’s analytical and service needs are met by training employees and managing their performance.
JOB DUTIES:
Act as a technical resource for laboratory staff
Work with Quality Assurance Staff/Manager to address corrective actions for analytical issues and internal audits
Monitor turnaround time (TAT) and production targets to ensure deadlines and customer expectations are met; adjust work procedures, work flow and resources as required
Lead and develop staff; this includes recruitment of new employees, setting objectives, evaluating performance and expectations, coaching and mentoring, and working jointly with employees in the development of their career path
Daily interaction with the client; provides accurate, consistent and timely information about ongoing projects as well as rush orders
Communicate and ensure standard operating procedures (SOPs) and quality assurance (QA) protocols are followed
Co-ordinate requests or recommend resource planning
Model and enforce high standards of work practices and safety conscious behavior
Ensure staff comply with all health and safety policies and procedures
Measure and report effectiveness of department activities to manager on a regular basis
Develop relationships with internal departments and determine how the operation can meet and exceed their expectations
You are the ideal LABORATORY SUPERVISOR if:
You have a Technical Diploma or Bachelor of Science
You have at least 2 years in a leadership role in an analytical laboratory, preferably in the petroleum or environmental fields
Have a proven ability to organize employees and workflow to maximize production and maintain expected TAT
Have a strong sense of customer service with a proven ability to effectively and appropriately address client concerns
Have the ability to operate independently, while meeting corporate and client targets for data delivery, quality practices and adherence to safety standards and protocols
Possess excellent up-to-date knowledge of laboratory processes, analytical techniques and LIMS
Must have a valid Class 5 Alberta Drivers’ License with less than 6 demerits
Must provide driver’s abstract at time of interview
WORKING CONDITIONS:
Local candidates from the Cold Lake/Bonnyville area preferred
Consideration will also be given to candidates who are willing to relocate to Cold Lake/Bonnyville
Shift Schedule is Monday through Friday - 7:30AM – 4:00PM
Fleet vehicle will be provided for transportation to/from site
Maxxam is the Canadian market leader in analytical services and solutions to the energy, environmental, food and DNA industries and a member of the Bureau Veritas Group of companies – a world leader in testing, inspection and certification services.
Join our talented community of scientists and experts and apply today by submitting your updated cover letter and resume at www.maxxam.ca/careers

Learn from the best. Be the best.

Dyson is a global technology company. We transform every category we enter with radical and iconic reinventions that work, perform and look very different. Our team of more than 3,500 engineers and scientists are about better ideas and better technologies, to solve the problems that others often ignore.
Dyson currently has five main areas of technology - floorcare, environmental control, hair care, Airblade™ hand dryers and lighting - and is sold in more than 75 countries. We have committed a $3 billion investment in future technology and will develop four new portfolios of technology in the next four years.
In Canada, the Dyson office opened in 2006 with 10 employees and two vacuum models. Within two months it had secured the number one market share. There are now over 100 people focussed on getting Dyson technology in the hands of Canadians. Based in downtown Toronto, our Head Office borders the financial and theatre districts, surrounded by some of Canada's most inspiring urban engineering. From our open-plan office to social get-togethers, everything is designed to build the team spirit and hunger that drives our success.
Accountabilities
Reporting to the Director, Professional Sales, you will conduct targeted outbound sales calls to potential new customers and handle inbound inquires via phone and email. You will harness your entrepreneurial spirit to find new ways to find perspective customers and figure out the best way to reach them.
More specifically, you will –
Make outbound calls to prospective customers using information from Dyson database, trade events, our sales team and purchased data
Engage and interact with decision makers at a senior level, building rapport and assessing needs
Book appointments for outside sales team and update via CRM system – salesforce.com
Manage inbound calls and emails, determine needs and enter information into CRM system
Analyze trends in CRM data, constantly looking for new business development avenues and process improvements
Be a key player in business development projects as directed by Sales Director
Skills
A dynamic, enthusiastic and driven sales professional who –

Has some post-secondary education and at least 1 year of B2B outbound sales experience
Is a target-driven self-starter and a strong sense of urgency
Is able to demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills in both English and French, including excellent phone etiquette
Is an innovative thinker who enjoys learning and solving problems
Is a natural influencer, and is looking to learn and grow into an outside sales role with us
Has strong computer skills, with a comprehensive knowledge of MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Dyson Canada is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live. If requested, we will provide reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process for persons with disabilities.

Benefits
Dyson Canada monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries, vacation and retirement savings contributions. Beyond that, you’ll enjoy profit-related bonuses, life insurance, and family health and dental benefits. But financial incentives are just one of the rewards of a Dyson career. Professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular coaching and learning. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our creative engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fueling and realizing ambition.
Dyson Canada is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live. If requested, we will provide reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process for persons with disabilities.
Winner of 2019 Eluta.ca Greater Toronto's Top Employers award.

job_title: Field Service Technician - Laboratory Products/Technicien de Réparation
job_description:
About Mettler Toledo
Working at Mettler Toledo means you are impacting the world in important ways. Our precision measuring devices span the world's laboratories, production facilities, and retail stores. We manufacture, sell, and service instruments that detect, measure, and weigh - from the infinitely small to the largest of vehicles or airplanes.

We help feed the world. We impact how food is produced, packaged and made safe.
We help keep you healthy. Our instruments make it possible for scientists to develop new drugs and bring life-saving medicines to the world.
Mettler Toledo products are important to the production and consistent quality of every kind of consumer product.
No matter how far human kind goes to explore new frontiers, Mettler Toledo is there to help make it happen.Our Opening and Your Responsibilities

We have one of the largest global service and sales organizations among precision instrumentation companies, and we need to add to this team immediately in Montreal, QC. We are currently hiring a Laboratory Field Service Technician. In this role, you will perform installations, preventive maintenance, certifications, troubleshooting, diagnosing, and repairing Mettler Toledo laboratory equipment including balances and peripherals at customer locations. This product category includes auto-titrators, density meters, refractometers, and thermal analyzers.

Your responsibilities would include:
*
Maintaining inventory necessary to meet a high first-time-fix-rate
*
Travelling overnight 75% - 80% of the time
*
Working evenings and weekends occasionally
*
Lifting and carrying 50+ pounds occasionally
*
Standing and squatting for long periods of time
*
Working out of your home at or near MontrealWhat You Need to Succeed
*

Worked in field service or have related experience in an engineering or manufacturing environment
*

Installation, preventive maintenance, and repair skills and can keep track of job assignments and a detailed schedule.
*

The ability to identify the root causes of service issues the first time using your keen knowledge of the products and your comfort with hand tools and calibration equipment.
*

Excellent customer service skills, detail orientation, and great verbal and written communication skills.
*

The discipline to update service records on time and ensure data integrity.
*

The desire and ability to promote and sell services and products. Generating sales leads is a requirement.
*

An Associate's degree with a focus on electronics or a combination of degree and relevant work experience.
*

A valid driver's license and a safe driving history
*

We consider experience in the field of chemistry a plusOur Offer to You
*
A company car with paid insurance for your work and personal use
*
All tools and equipment needed to perform the job and a clothing allowance
*
Prescription drug, medical, dental and vision coverage through Claimsecure effective on the first day of the month after 30 days of hire
*
Gym discount program if you elect our Aetna medical coverage
*
Tuition reimbursement
*
And, all the usual such as paid time off, flexible spending, short-and long-term disability, basic life insurance, business travel insurance, Employee Assistance Program, and domestic partner benefits
*
Global market strength and worldwide leadership in weighing
*
A brand name that is identified worldwide with precision, quality, and innovation
*
Thousands of patents, design and innovation awards
*
High earning potential with a proven track record of success and promotional growth opportunities
*
A commitment to extraordinary service on our state-of-the-art equipmentEqual Opportunity Employment
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We give consideration for employment without regard to, for example, race, colour, religion, sex, age, place of origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected characteristics.

We are committed to creating an inclusive, equitable and accessible work environment. If you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or an accommodation during the application, interviewing or employment process, please contact us at [1] Jamie.Anderson2@mt.com so we can discuss in confidence a suitable accommodation.

Technicien de Réparation

Travailler chez METTLER TOLEDO signifie avoir un impact important sur le monde. Nos appareils de mesure de précision sont utilisés dans les laboratoires, les installations de production et les magasins de vente au détail du monde entier. Nous concevons, fabriquons et assurons l’entretien d’instruments qui détectent, mesurent et pèsent de l’infiniment petit au plus grand des véhicules ou des avions. Travailler avec nous signifie que les produits alimentaires sont exempts de contaminants et que les substances sont mesurées selon les exigences de précision les plus élevées pour une utilisation dans les plus grandes entreprises de l’industrie manufacturière et pharmaceutique.

Nous recherchons actuellement un Technicien de réparation sur site qui travaillera avec notre gamme d’instruments d’analyse à Montréal, au Québec. En tant que Technicien de réparation, vous serez chargé des installations, de l’entretien préventif et des certifications, dépannerez, diagnostiquerez et réparerez les équipements de laboratoire, notamment les balances, les instruments d’analyse et les périphériques chez les clients.

Nous avons:
*
Une présence mondiale et une position de chef de file dans notre catégorie;
*
Une marque associée à la précision, à la qualité et à l’innovation dans le monde entier;
*
Des milliers de brevets, de prix de conception et d’innovation pour les marques METTLER TOLEDO et Rainin;
*
Une reconnaissance mondiale pour la qualité de nos pipettes qui mesurent avec précision et permettent de transférer des liquides dans les laboratoires de recherche scientifique, cliniques et industriels.
Avez-vous?

*
Un diplôme en électronique (une combinaison diplôme et expérience professionnelle pertinente peut également être considérée);
*
Des compétences avancées et de l’expérience en informatique;
*
Une solide expérience en mécanique;
*
Un engagement fort en faveur des politiques de sécurité de l’entreprise pour que vous et vos collègues exerciez vos fonctions de manière efficace et sûre sur votre lieu de travail;
*
Un permis de conduire valide et un dossier du conducteur satisfaisant.

Les connaissances suivantes seraient un atout :
*
Expérience dans le domaine de la chimie;
*
Expérience des logiciels SAP.
Vous vous imaginez?

*
Réaliser des installations, des tâches d’entretien préventif et des certifications; dépanner, diagnostiquer et réparer des équipements de laboratoire, notamment des balances, des instruments d’analyse et des périphériques chez les clients;
*
Dépanner et réparer des produits liés à l'industrie sans assistance;
*
Atteindre les objectifs de revenus attribués tout en respectant le budget;
*
Respecter les normes ISO et maintenir des niveaux appropriés de stocks de pièces;
*
Interagir avec l’équipe de vente pour répondre aux exigences des clients;
*
Veiller au respect des normes de productivité et à l’intégrité des données de la base de données de services;
*
Veiller à ce que les exigences de disponibilité de l'équipement du client soient respectées et à ce que l’entretien préventif sur le compte attribué soit effectué à temps;
*
Vendre divers contrats de service ou produits d’entretien préventif à notre clientèle actuelle d’instruments de pesage et d’analyse.

Nous vous offrons :
*
Une couverture médicale, dentaire, de médicaments sur ordonnance et de soins de la vue par l’intermédiaire de SécurIndemnité, à compter du premier jour du mois après 30 jours d’emploi;
*
Un régime d’épargne-retraite à compter de la date d’embauche;
*
Plus tous les avantages habituels, comme les congés payés, un compte gestion-santé, une assurance invalidité de courte durée et de longue durée, une assurance vie de base, une assurance couvrant les déplacements professionnels, un programme d’aide aux employés et les avantages accordés au partenaire domestique.

Pour ceux qui privilégient la précision, METTLER TOLEDO est précisément l’entreprise qu’il leur faut.

Nous sommes un employeur souscrivant au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi et nous apprécions la diversité de notre entreprise. Nous étudions toutes les candidatures sans distinction, par exemple, de race, de couleur, de religion, de sexe, d’âge, de lieu d’origine, de handicap, d’orientation sexuelle, d’identité sexuelle ou de toute autre caractéristique protégée.

Nous nous engageons à créer un environnement de travail inclusif, équitable et accessible. Si vous êtes handicapé et que vous avez besoin d’aide ou d’un hébergement pendant le processus de candidature, d’entretien ou d’emploi, communiquez avec nous à l’adresse [2] jamie.anderson2@mt.com afin que nous puissions discuter confidentiellement d’un logement adéquat.
